loans.name: Roly Andres

texts.es:
Roly Andres tiene 24 años de edad  vive en unión libre no tiene hijos, vive con la esposa en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

La VRC JERUSALEN, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto El caimito, Perteneciente a la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche Cantón Pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo Corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol Gandul.

Roly se dedica a la Agricultura siembra maíz arroz hace 6 años. Las compras y las evntanas lo realiza en Ventanas.
Solicita el crédito para invertir en la agricultura, comprar semillas, insumos, urea, fertilizantes. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar semillas. El sueño es poder comprar un carro, no se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problemas.

 En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
Con la ayuda del CREDITO ANTERIOR pudo sembrar maíz y mejorar el nivel de vida de la esposa.La producción ha mejorado en cantidad del producto.
texts.en:
Roly Andrés, 24, is in a common law relationship but does not have children; he lives with his wife in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

The “Jerusalen” communal bank is located in Recinto El Caimito belonging to Puerto Pechiche Parish, Pueblo Viejo Canton.  The members are short cycle corn, rice and pigeon pea farmers.

Roly has been farming corn and rice for the last six years.  His purchases and his sales take place in Ventanas.

He is asking for the loan to invest in farming: he will buy seeds, supplies, urea and fertilizer.  With help from the loan he will buy seeds.  His dream is to be able to buy a car.  He’s had no type of problems.  In his free time he likes to play sports.

With help from his previous loan he was able to plant corn and improve his wife’s standard of living.  Production has improved with respect to quantity of product.

loans.use: agricultural inputs and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy flour, eggs, sugar, plastic bags and firewood.

loans.name: Jawas Pankarita Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “JAWAS PANKARITA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Savina. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: taller de carpintería, ayudante de carpintería, venta de comida.

La señora Savina,  indica que hace diez años que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una familiar. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de carpintería que viene trabajando hace años atrás, aprendiendo el mismo desde su niñez.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra madera) que adquirirá de las barracas y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación de salud y de crédito.
texts.en:
The “Jawas Pankarita” communal bank will start its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes focal center.  It has six members led by a governing board headed by Savina.  The businesses that the members carry out are varied.  Among them we have: carpentry shop, carpenter’s assistant and food sales.

Savina indicates that she’s worked with Pro Mujer for ten years and joined the institution thanks to an invitation from a family member.  She currently has a carpentry shop that she’s been running for several years having learned it since childhood.

The loan she’ll now take out is to increase her capital.  She will buy it from the stands and then will make and sell based on prior orders.  This way of working allows her to generate income to support her family since she’s married and has five children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answer that she likes the health and credit training.

loans.use: to buy lumber.

loans.name: Lilia Sarahi

texts.es:
La señora Lilia tiene 25 años de edad, esta casada y tiene un hijo, su esposo se dedica a la pesca y ella se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario, tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion, ahi vende todo lo relacionado con la canasta basica familiar.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de abarroteria, lacteos, carnes, granos basicos y pan., desea surtir su negocio, sus ventas estan aumentando y no tiene el capital suficiente para surtir la pulperia,  esta epoca se vende bastante ya que en la zona comienza el trabajo de la salineras y sus clientes le consumen por mayor.
Su objetivo es tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
Lilia, 25, is married and has a son.  Her husband is a fisherman and she sells basic staple goods.  She has a hone-based general store where she sells everything related to basic family staple needs.

She will use the loan to buy groceries, dairy products, meats, basic grains and bread.  She wants to stock her store.  Her sales are increasing and she does not have sufficient capital to stock it.  Sales are high this season because work in the salt fields starts and her customers buy at wholesale.  Her goal is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Koemheang's Group

texts.en: Koemheang,41, is a mother of three children, two of whom are in school. She is a resident from Kampong Cham province where her business is run. Her rice cropping on two hectares of farmland and fishes trading business have returned her a decent income to cover the need in her household. This is the first loan for Koemheang with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner). Now, in a group of three, she is a leader. For this cycle, Koemheang will spend her entire loan portion to buy fishes for resale. She hopes to gain a good income than before.

loans.use: To buy fishes for resale.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a single woman with two children, one  of whom attends school. She lives at her own  house that has no electricity but has  piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of theft and transportation as a major challenge in her business.

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Abel

texts.en:
Abel sells cleaning products and other household items. He started off in this type of business by working with a friend for about 3 years. Recently he and his wife decided to start their own business and sell the products out in the neighborhood and from their home. They have 3 children to support with this business. They just moved into this sector of the city after having an unfavorable experience in a different part of the city. They have high hopes for their loan. They will use it to invest in different plastic plates and containers. He hopes he can continue to build on his strong client base.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in different plastic plates and containers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Set up a new point of sale

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Mrs. Irma is married and lives in the town of Santa Catarina in the state of Nuevo Leon. Her husband is a lathe operator in a local business, however, to improve their economic situation, 11 years ago, Irma decided to open her own business, offering her services as a stylist. Her skills have made it possible to maintain her business for so long.

Now, she needs a $550 loan to buy beauty products for her salon, as well as equipment to provide better service for her clients. She is committed to paying back the loan in 6-12 months. You can be a part of helping this business develop. Decide to take part, she thanks you sincerely.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Irma es casada y vive en el municipio de Santa Catarina del estado de Nuevo León, su esposo se desempeña como tornero en una empresa de su localidad, sin embargo, para mejorar la situación económica en la que estaban, desde hace 11 años Irma decidió abrir su propio negocio, ofreciendo sus servicios de estilista. El buen servicio que ofrece le ha permitido estar en el negocio por tanto tiempo.

En estos momentos Irma necesita un crédito por $ 550 dólares que empleará en la compra de productos de belleza que ofrece en su estética, así como equipo que necesita para darles un mejor servicio a sus clientes, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un plazo de 6 a 12 meses. Tú puedes formar parte del desarrollo de este negocio, decídete a apoyarla, ella te agradece sinceramente tu ayuda.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Nguyet

texts.en: Mrs. Nguyet was born in 1984. Because her husband left her for another woman, now she lives with her daughter, 2 years old. Mrs. Nguyet sells fruits and the family income is $12 per person/month. She hopes to receive a loan of $75 to run her fruit shop. She will repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: Fruit selling

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Mr. Michael O. is a 57 year old man. He is married with 14 children, and he lives in Ubiaja, Edo State, Nigeria. He specializes in the milling of cassava for the community. He started his business in 1989 after 6 months of training.

Michael has been an LAPO client for 2 years. He now hopes to improve his milling business with a loan of $325.

loans.use: To improve his milling business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in more products

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.es:
This is Benedicta and her eight-year-old son William. Three months ago, with the support of her husband, Benedicta decided to buy a weaving machine and began her craftwork; she weaved beautiful children's jumpers, thanks to her talent to create different styles and in a variety of colours. There has been a great interest in her excellent work, which has been very well received.This is why she is appealing for your help and requesting a loan which she hopes to invest in the purchase of raw materials (wool) in order to increase the variety of her products and in order to weave a greater number of jumpers, pullovers, trousers, for both children and adults. Benedicta promises to repay the loan within six months. She and her family are hopeful that they will receive your unselfish help. Support them, they are counting on your help.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva Volunteer.

Ella es doña Benedicta y su pequeño hijo William de ocho años de edad, hace tres meses con apoyo de su esposo, decidió comprar una máquina de tejer y empezó ha incursionar en el trabajo artesano; teje hermosas chompas para niños, gracias a su ingenio para elaborar diferentes modelos y por la variedad de colores su excelente trabajo esta teniendo gran acogida y mucha solicitud, es por esa razón que recurre a tu ayuda y solicita un préstamo que pretende invertirlo en la compra de materia prima (lana) para ampliar la variedad de mercadería y tejer mayor cantidad de chompas, chalecos, pantalones, para niños y adultos, Benedicta promete reintegrar el préstamo en un lapso de seis meses.Ella y su familia están esperanzadas en recibir tu ayuda desinteresada, apóyalos, ellos esperan por ti.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials (wool)

loans.name: Kawala 1A (Iii) Group

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 46-year-old widow with seven children. She sells charcoal to earn a living and support the family. With the profits she intends to pay school fees for the children and also buy a plot of land.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Felícitas

texts.es:
Doña Felícitas comes from a very hard-working family. Since she was a little girl, she would help her parents in the making or construction of bricks. Thanks to her acquired knowledge over the years, she has been able to manage a very successful brick making business which she inherited from her parents.

With this job, she was able to support and to pay for her children's education. She took care of her 2 beloved children all by herself, after separating from her husband. Today, even though she's a little bit older, she still has the same strength, eargerness and will-power to succeed. This is why she still works non-stop making all types of bricks. Felicitas dream is to expand her business even more.

She's requesting for your assistance. She commits in repaying this loan within 6 months and she promises to pay you on time. "Felicitas awaits for your promising answer."

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Felícitas, proviene de una familia muy trabajadora y emprendedora, desde que tuvo uso de razón siempre apoyó a sus padres en su noble labor de ladrilleros, gracias a los conocimientos y a la experiencia que adquirió durante muchos años ha logrado sacar adelante la fábrica que heredó de sus padres.Con este noble oficio logró educar y brindarles bienestar a sus queridos hijos, por quienes se esforzó y veló constantemente desde que decidió separarse de su esposo y hacerse cargo de sus dos queridos retoños.Actualmente, pese a su avanzada edad sigue conservando la misma fuerza, voluntad, y ganas de superación, es por eso que sigue trabajando incansablemente elaborando una inmensa variedad de ladrillos.El deseo que tiene Felícitas es incrementar aún más su negocio, con este fin recorre en búsqueda de tu apoyo y hace la solicitud de un préstamo que se compromete a retornarlo en un lapso de seis meses y además promete ser puntual en el pago.“Felicitas, espera tu respuesta alentadora”

loans.use: To purchase more basic material to make bricks

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 28-year-old Monica M.. She is married with 2 children, aged 4 and 9, and has 1 other dependent, who is her nephew.

In 2006 Monica established a used clothing business, and she now requires a new loan in order to purchase additional stocks of clothing in bulk.

Second-hand clothes journey across the oceans from America and Europe, and they are then washed, ironed, and sold in bulk by wholesalers in Dar es Salaam to retailers who then re-wash and re-iron them for sale on the streets of Dar es Salaam and the surrounding towns and villages. These clothes are becoming increasingly popular, especially amongst the younger generation, because they are so cheap and because of the general appeal of anything Western or modern. Many people argue that the popularity of the West’s cast-offs is damaging the local cloth and garment industry. There are many people who still appreciate the beauty of traditional Tanzanian dress; however, the growing market in used clothing and its importance to many micro-entrepreneurs cannot be denied.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of used clothing in bulk

loans.name: Florence Kyaligonza`s Group

texts.en:
Florence is the leader of the group of five members. She is 48 years of age, a single mother with two children in school.  The community she lives in is urban in a slum wetland area that floods in the rainy season. Her main challenges are high transport and renting costs, stiff competition, working in the open space and residing in an area, which is prone to flooding. 

The benefits of her loan program include being able to take her children to school, fending for her family and she was able to buy a plot of land
Her plans include building a house with the money she earns from selling fuel and firewood.

Mary has successfully paid back 3 MCDT loans.

loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
Mr. Enrique lives with his mother in a rented home on Buenos Aires Avenue in La Paz city. His business is providing sound amplification at social events, such as weddings, birthdays, etc. The loan he is seeking will be used to buy a sound system that will improve the quality of sound so that he will gain more contracts and improve his income. Because of his good credit history he can obtain a new loan for this purchase.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

El señor Enrique vive en anticrético con su mamá en la Av. Buenos Aires de la Ciudad de La Paz; la actividad que realiza para generar sus ingresos es el servicio de amplificación en acontecimientos sociales, como ser matrimonios, cumpleaños, etc. El crédito que solicita es para comprar un equipo con el cual puede mejorar la calidad del sonido de tal manera que pueda tener mayores contratos y mejorar sus ingresos. Por su antecedente histórico puede obtener un nuevo crédito ya que su historial de pagos es muy bueno.

loans.use: Buy a sound system for his disc jockey business

loans.name: Bafana

texts.fr:
Monsieur Bafana B. is 42 years old, married with two children. To earn a living and meet the needs of his family, he drives a motorcycle taxi in Adéta, a village about 150 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. He picks passengers up at the roadside and drops them off at their destinations. With this loan, his first from FECECAV, Monsieur B. wants to buy a new, more comfortable motorcycle. He hopes that with this improvement he will attract more customers, earn more money and improve his family’s standard of living.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva volunteer.

Monsieur Bafana B. est âgé de 42 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. Pour gagner de l’argent et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, il conduit un taxi moto à Adéta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale Togolaise. Il prend les passagers au bord de la route et les dépose à leurs destinations. Avec ce crédit, son premièr de FECECAV, Monsieur B. espère acheter une nouvelle moto qui est plus confortable. Avec cette amélioration, il espère avoir plus des clients, gagner plus d’argent et changer les conditions de la vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge Luis originally started selling natural medecines to help a friend and share the profits with him. Later he decided to set up his own business or work directly with the company, and receive training, as the profits would be for him alone. Once he was qualified to sell the products, he dedicated his time to this entirely, and has been doing well until now.

He is requesting a loan of US $500 which he will pay back within 6 months, to buy products, material to set up a club, and also train his customers. He hopes that with your help, his business will be a success.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Jorge Luis inicio vendiendo productos naturistas como promotor ayudándole a un amigo y compartiendo las ganancias con el. Posteriormente el decidió poner su propio negocio o sea estar trabajando directamente con la empresa, y recibir su capacitación respectiva, ya que así las ganancias solo serian para el. Después que fue capacitado para la venta de los productos, se dedico de lleno a esto, y hasta hoy le ha ido bien.

El solicita un crédito de US $500 que pagara en 6 meses, para la compra de productos, compra de material para poner un club, y al igual dar capacitación a sus clientes. El tiene la esperanza que con que con tu apoyo el hará crecer su negocio.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Sandra Marilu

texts.es:
Señora Sandra Marilú is 33 years old. She's a single mother. She studied to become a First Response assistant but she never got to exercised. She also studied cosmetology and couture. She has one son who goes to primary school. She lives in the district of Trujillo in La Libertad.

This entrepreneur has bought a name-brand sewing machine and since she's very knowledgeable when it comes to sewing, she decided to start making sports apparel. Since she needed to make more money, she began to sew other types of clothing. She decided to take her mom's advice to join the communal bank called "Luz Divine" (Divine Light) and with her first loan she obtained money to purchased fabrics, thread, cotton, etc.

With this loan, which she will repay within 6 months, she's hoping to buy more cotton, fabrics, thread, elastics, etc. to make intimate apparel.

She hopes to one day be able to provide sewing jobs to other women in the area and to be able to export their clothing.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Sandra Marilú, tiene 33 años, es madre soltera, estudió la carrera de auxiliar en educación la cual nunca ejerció, así también estudió cosmetología y costura, tiene 01 hijo, es estudiante del nivel primaria, vive en el Distrito de Trujillo en la Provincia de Trujillo en el Departamento de La Libertad-Perú. La empresaria ha comprado una maquina remalladora y como tiene conocimientos sobre confección de ropa empezó a confeccionar polos deportivos pero necesitaba mayor capital para ampliar su negocio y dedicarse a la confección de otro tipo de prendas, por lo que aceptó la invitación de su mamá par integrar el Banco Comunal “LUZ DIVINA” y con el primer préstamo que recibió de S/. 300.00 compró telas, algodón, hilos, etc. Con el crédito de S/. 800.00 que cancelará en un plazo de 06 meses tiene pensado comprar algodón, telas, hilos, encajes, elásticos para confeccionar ropa interior. La socia sueña con tener una empresa sólida, dar trabajo a otras mujeres y porque no poder exportar sus prendas.

loans.use: To purchase fabric, thread, elastics, etc.

loans.name: Merly Benidia

texts.es:
La señora  Merly, socia del BC “LAS MARGARITAS II”, vive en la Región y provincia de San Martín, distrito de La Banda de Shilcayo. Se dedica a la venta de golosinas de manera ambulatoria en los lugares donde se realizan eventos y hay mayor concentración de personas como en las afueras de los colegios y  recreos turísticos.   

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,200, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará galletas de distintas variedades en cajas, chocolates en cajas, chupetines y chicles en bolsas de diferentes marcas y tamaños, caramelos de diferentes marcas y sabores, para tener en stock y luego sacarlos a la venta. 

Merly tiene 45 años de edad, vive con su esposo, quien la apoya en esta actividad. Es una mujer muy perseverante y responsable, con ganas de salir adelante y apoyar a su esposo en la economía de la casa. Desea arreglar su casa y preparar un ambiente propicio para poner un negocio de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Merly, a member of the Community Bank “Las Margaritas II,” lives in the region and province of San Martin, La Banda de Shilcayo District. She sells candy on foot at large outdoor events, local high schools and where tourists are situated.

With a loan of $400 US Dollars, which will be repaid in four months, Mrs. Merly will buy a variety of boxed cookies, chocolates, lollipops and chewing gum in bags of different brands and sizes and candy of different brands and flavors to stock and sell later.

Mrs. Merly is forty-five years old and lives with her husband, who supports her activities. She is a very perservering and responsible woman who is eager to get ahead and support her husband with the finances of their home. She desires to fix their house to eventually build an environment that is conducive to setting up a grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase various boxed and bagged branded candy items

location.town: La Banda de Shilcayo - San Martín

loans.name: Meas

texts.en: Mrs. Meas S. is a villager in Preak Thom Village in Kandal Province. She is a housewife who cooks very delicious food for her household. Her husband, Mr. Meas Saroeurn, is a construction worker who can make little income to support his family. Mrs. Meas S. is 50 years old and the mother of three children – one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while another one is a laborer. The youngest one is attending the local school. Since the third child's school is far from home, Mrs. Meas S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike for that child to travel to school. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her child to travel to school.

loans.name: Thanh Thi

texts.vi: Chị Thanh năm nay  49 tuổi gia đình chị có 5 người con đều đã trưởng thành. Năm 2002 chị  tham gia Quỹ tình thương để có thêm vốn đầu tư vào chăn nuôi phát triển kinh tế gia đình. Đến nay ngoài nguồn thu từ chăn nuôi, trồng trọt hàng tháng gia đình chị còn  có thêm nguồn thu từ lương làm bảo vệ xã của chồng và sự hỗ trợ thêm của các con đã đi làm nên kinh tế gia đình chị  ngày càng ổn định hơn. Với mức thu nhập 2.500.000đ/ tháng việc hoàn trả vốn vay của gia đình chị Thanh cũng rất thuận lợi.nVòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm lợn về nuôi.n
texts.en:
Mrs. Thanh Thi V. is 49 years old. She has 5 children, who are all grown adults. In 2002, Mrs. V. joined the Fund to have more capital to invest in raising livestock to improve the family's finances. Currently, besides the income from the livestock and tree farming businesses, the family also has income streams from her husband's security job and her children's salaries. The family's finances are becoming more and more stable with time. With a total income of 2,500,000 VND per month, Mrs. V.'s repayments are proceeding very favorably. In this round of funding she would like to borrow 10,000,000 VND to invest in buying more pigs to raise.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising pigs

loans.name: Afefa Kossiwa

texts.fr:
Née le 5 janvier 1969 à Lomé, la capitale de Togo, madame L. Aféfe Kossiwa est une femme vaillante qui exerce le commerce d’alimentation générale dans le quartier Agoè, au nord de Lomé. Elle s’est mariée à un militaire et mère de quatre (4) enfants.  Depuis qu’elle a commencé cette activité en 2003 elle arrive à contribuer dans les dépenses de la famille. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé.
Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 10 sacs de sucre, 8 sacs de riz, 12 cartons de lait, et 3 bidons d’huile.
texts.en:
Born on January 5, 1969 in Lomé, the capital of Togo, Mrs. Aféfe Kossiwa is a strong woman. She runs a general food store business in the Agoè district, which in the northern part of Lomé. Her husband is in the army and she has four children. After having begun this business in 2003, she is now able to help with the family’s expenses. She purchases her products in the main market of Lomé. This first loan that she is taking out will allow her to purchase 10 sacks of sugar, eight sacks of rice, 12 cartons of milk and three bottles of oil.

Translated from French by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase general food products

loans.name: Lourdes Isabel

texts.en:
Lourdes is a member of the Sumaqcha (“Beautiful” in Quechua) Village Bank. She is 31 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their two children. Lourdes has a business selling plates, dishes, crystal ware and timepieces. She buys the items wholesale, either in Ayacucho or in Lima, and sells them from a tricycle. On Sundays, she sells at the Las Americas Market. Her business is 20 or 25 years old; she inherited it from her mother. She used to work with her mother, and now works with her husband. 

Lourdes is requesting a loan of 3000 soles to buy Christmas lights to sell for the holiday season. She always sells according to seasons; for example, she buys Christmas items now, and will buy pens, pencils and notebooks for back-to-school season in February and March. 

Lourdes’s goal for the future is to open a market stand so that she can sell her merchandise wholesale.

loans.use: Buy Christmas lights

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Kossiwa D. est une jeune femme de 29 ans, célibataire sans enfants.  Revendeuse des produits de beauté et des mèches depuis 3 ans, Kossiwa réside à Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, elle espère avec ce crédit alimenter sa boutique par de nouveaux produits. Cette opportunité lui permettra d’améliorer ses conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Kossiwa D. is a young woman, 29 years of age, unmarried, and without children. A retailer of beauty products and hair extensions for three years, she resides in Lomé, the capital of Togo. To satisfy her customers better, she hopes to use this loan to supply her shop with new products. This opportunity will enable her to improve her living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products and hair extensions for resale

loans.name: Candido Humberto

texts.es: Don Candido tiene 50 años de edad, reside en el barrio camilo chamorro, su esposa le tiene tres hijos mayores de 13,15 y 18 años de edad, dos de ellos cursan la secundaria y uno esta en la universidad lo cual son muchos gastos es por eso se esfuerzo por salir adelante para apoyar a sus hijos a que tengan una buena educación que en  futuro puedan ser unos profesionales. Su negocio es la fabricación de colchones desde hace trece años esta elaborando los suaves colchones. Inicio trabajando en elaborar colchones en una empresa, luego ahorro y con su liquidación decidió comenzar. Lo cual hasta ahora se ha beneficiado ya que ha crecido en inventario, también da gracias a Afodenic por el apoyo que le ha dado para mejorar su negocio, esta es la quinta solicitud, que quiere para invertir en la compra de cuatro quintales de tiras para la elaboración de colchones. Que espera obtener muchas ganancias con los pedidos y ventas. Sus metas a futuro es poder crecer y poder ofertar sus productos a diferente departamento del país
texts.en:
Candido is 50 years old and lives in the Camilo Chamorro neighborhood. He and his wife have three older children, ages 13,15 and 18, two of whom are attending high school and one who is at a university, which is very expensive; It is for this reason that he strives to get ahead in order to support his children so that they receive a good education and can be professionals in the future. His business is mattresses production. For 3 years he has been manufacturing soft mattresses. He began working in mattress production in a business, then saved, and with his severance decided to begin. This has benefited him until now, as he has increased his inventory, also thanks to Afodenic for the support that they have given him to improve his business. This is his fifth application, which he requests in order to invest in the purchase of four 100 pound strips of material to manufacture mattresses. He hopes to gain a lot of profit with the requests and sales. His goal for the future is to be able to grow and to offer his products to different provinces around the country.

Translated from Spanish by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase four 100 pound strips of material for mattress production

loans.name: Khiev

texts.en:
Khiev Y., 41, is married and lives with five of her children in Kampong Cham province. She and her husband are farmers who typically make about US$ 1 each day and are supported in part by two children working in a garment factory.

The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Khiev Y. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of US$ 250 to purchase fertilizer and repair her house. She is confident that this loan will allow her to increase her daily income and to better support her family.

loans.use: fertilizer and home repairs

loans.name: Mrs. Kem Chhum Village Bank Group

texts.en: The village bank group, which consists of sixteen members, is located in Damnak Sangke village in Kandal province.   Each member of the group plans to use the loan that they obtain in different ways. Mrs. Kem C. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members to lead the group. She is a vegetable seller in the local market. She is a 55-year-old widow with three children, one of whom is a tailor while the others are attending the local school. Now Mrs. Kem C. is requesting a loan to build the staircase for her house.

loans.use: To build the staircase for her house.

loans.name: Assiba

texts.fr:
J.	Assiba est âgée de 52 ans; elle est scolarisée. Assiba est mariée à DEGBE Pierre et mère de trois enfants tous scolarisés. Les enfants de Assiba sont respectivement âgés de 35 ans, 30 ans et 25 ans. Assiba réside au quartier gbégamey un quartier populaire de la ville de Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Assiba vend des céréales depuis une vingtaine d’années dans l’un des marchés décentralisés de la ville de Cotonou. Assiba achète ses produits à Cotonou, au marché international du Bénin. Assiba est à son troisième crédit avec ALIDé. Pour éviter les problèmes de rupture de stock en céréale comme d'habitude, Assiba décide de s’approvisionner en quantité importante auprès des grossistes. C'est pourquoi Assiba demande de prêt à ALIDé. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
Assiba J., 52, is married to Pierre Degbe and the mother of 3 children. Her children are aged 35, 30, and 25. Assiba lives in the Gbégamey district, a working class neighborhood of the town of Cotonou, economic capital of Benin.

Assiba has been selling cereals for about 20 years in one of the decentralized markets in the town of Cotonou. She buys her products in Cotonou, in the international market of Benin. She is on her third loan with ALIDé. In order to avoid running short of cereals, as often happens, Assiba decided to stock up, buying from wholesalers. That is why she is requesting the loan from ALIDé.

The meaning of ALIDé in the local language of Benin, Fon, is "there is always a pathway for the poorest of the poor". Benin is a small West African country next to Nigeria, where the GDP stands at US$ 1,500 per inhabitant.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of sacks of wheat flour, manioc flour, maize, and rice

loans.name: Kodzo

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est un célibataire très travailleur, pour pouvoir subvenir à ses propres dépenses, il a appris le métier de la tapisserie qu’il exerce aujourd’hui. Il fabrique des meubles, des lits et des coussins qu’il vend à ses clients. Les matières nécessaires qu’il utilise dans son activité sont épuisées, pour se réapprovisionner il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter des mousses et des tissus.
texts.en:
This gentleman is single and a very hard worker. In order to provide for himself he learned the upholstery trade, which he practices today. He builds furniture, beds and cushions which he sells to his clients. As he has run out of materials necessary for his business, he is requesting a loan from WAGES to purchase foam and fabric.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of foam and fabric

loans.name: Sallema Group

texts.en: Sallema is the group leader of Sallema group. There are four members in this group. Each of them wants to take a loan for her/his business. Sallema wants to take a loan for the business of embroidery. Norua wants to take a loan for the business of tailoring. S. Wasduin wants to take a loan for the business of a general store. Zalashta wants to take a loan for the business of a shop selling fruits and vegetables. They are requesting a group loan of 40000 Afghani . They are very happy from this loan process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: For expanding businesses

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace K. is forty years old, divorced, and has two children: a boy and a girl. According to her, both are still in school: one is in the junior high while the other is in the primary school. Grace lives with her children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Suhum in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Grace works very hard to provide for the family. She is a trader and runs a provisions store in her community. Her shop is on one of the streets. Grace buys the groceries from Accra and other big shops in her community. She has been in business for twelve years and wants a loan buy provisions in bulk so that she can increase her stock. Grace is hopeful to sponsor her children in school to greater heights.

loans.use: To buy provisions in bulk

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en: Hilda is a struggling single parent. She is 32 years old and has one child. She sells weavons, hair extensions, and cosmetics in her shop. Hilda is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more weavons, hair extensions, and cosmetics to sell. She says "Thank you."

loans.use: To purchase weavons, hair extensions, and cosmetics

loans.name: Learnie

texts.en:
For the last year, Learnie has made a living by operating a general store. She is 35 years old, married and has three children, two of whom are in school. Her husband makes a living buying and selling appliances. The couple hopes that their work will allow them to give their children a better life in the future. 

The couple's children are: Nichelle - 13 years old, who is in high school; Nizzalyn - 9 years old, who is in grade school; and Nick Emmanuel - who is 4 years old and still too young to go to school. The family lives at Barangay Research Minante 1 Cauayan City. 

Learnie has applied for a PHP 40,000 Kiva loan to buy more products to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell in her store

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina will be the first to tell you that she runs her day-care business out of love, rather than money. Establishing a day-care business out of her home, she is most proud of the fact that children remain at her center for an average of 1-2 years, much longer than the 3-6 months they spend on average at other home-based centers. Christina is passionate about making it her life's work to be a positive influence in these children's lives.

Having taken out a number of loans with ACCION USA, Christina has been able to purchase supplies and toys that enable her to provide a richer educational experience for children than those of competing businesses. Christina will use her latest loan to purchase an outdoor playhouse and picnic table so that her children can take advantage of the warm weather in the summer months to play outside. She would like to take out future loans to purchase a computer that her kids can use to play educational games.

Christina dreams of expanding her business from her home to a day-care center. She is confident that she will be able to do this with ACCION USA's help, as she builds her reputation in her community by providing a loving and comfortable learning environment for children.

loans.use: To buy an outdoor playhouse and picnic table

loans.name: Alicia Mercedes

texts.es:
En el departamento de León, la señora Alicia S. se dedica a atender su negocio de venta de ropa de todo tipo tanto para caballeros, damas y niños.

Ella ha logrado mejorar su negocio el cual se ha ido desarrollando poco a poco a raíz que el tiempo ha transcurrido. Actualmente requiere de la compra de la mercadería a sus proveedores y para ello acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito y de esta manera suplir su establecimiento de ropa para ofertarla a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Alicia sells men's, women's and children's clothing in the department of León.

With time she has been able to develop and improve her business little by little. Currently, she needs to purchase additional merchandise and for this reason she turned to Ceprodel for a loan so that she can better provide clothing to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is raising ducks within the village of Nagbukel San Isidro. She is thankful because she is able to raise all her ducks. According to her, she needs to ask financial assistance to ASKI so that she could sustain the needs of her ducks. Her husband Arturo is engaged in their rice-farming. The couple is blessed with three children: Jayson-21 years old, 1st year college student; Joe-20 years old, high school student and Jefferson-16 years old, 4th year high school student. Josephine’s goal is to send her children in higher level of education that’s why she is doing everything to supply the needs of her family. She is requesting a loan amounting to PHP5, 000. She hopes that she could avail the loan amount that she is requesting to be able to increase her profit and at the same time to provide the needs of her family.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn H.'s main source of income comes from making and selling snacks and delicacies in her community. She is 39 years old, married and has four adult children. They are from the village of Mobod, Oroquieta City Misamis Occidental. Rosalyn has been in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Rosalyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Rosalyn is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to expand her small business. This will be Rosalyn's second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement her family's income.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand a snack business

loans.name: Sam-Un

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam-un S., 31, and her husband, Mr. Vannak Seng, 29, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2003 and have one daughter and one young son.

Sam-un has been a silk weaver since she was 15 years old, a skill she learned from her mother. She also taught her husband to become a silk weaver. They sell their finished products to a middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in a market located in Phnom Penh.

Sam-un is asking for her first loan of 200 USD to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Adejoku

texts.en: Adejoku sells rechargeable phone cards and VCDs. She is 33 years old and married with three children. She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. Adejoku is a hardworking woman and she is determined to expand her business. She hopes for a loan of 80,000 nairas to purchase more rechargeable phone cards and VCDs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable phone cards and VCDs to sell

loans.name: Donasia

texts.en: Donasia A. is a married Tanzanian entrepreneur with one child. She runs a business of selling charcoal at Tabata in Dar es Salaam. She purchases the charcoal directly from the manufacturers wholesale and sells it to retail customers at her business yard. Charcoal is the main source of domestic power in most of the developing countries, although it is much more environmentally destructive. She has been in the business for three years. She is requesting a loan of 600,000 Tanzanian shillings to buy more business goods to meet her customers' demand.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a fifty-five-year-old married mother of seven children who are all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming-dominated community in the Western Region of Ghana. Most of the dwellers practice farming alongside other trading activities. Elizabeth is a trader. She runs a provision store in her community. She buys the goods from big supermarket stores in nearby towns. Elizabeth has been in business for nine years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy provisions

loans.name: Isatu Adakalie

texts.en:
This is Isatu Adakalie K.. She is 45 years old, married, and is from Tombo in Waterloo. She has four children: three boys and one girl. One child is in secondary school and the rest have grown up.

Isatu has been a LAPOSL client for some time now and has taken two previous loans. She is a member of a LAPOSL union (a credit group that acts as a collective collateral and guarantor). This the first loan she will be receiving with the help of Kiva lenders.

Isatu sells cigarettes, soap and toothpaste from her house. With her previous loans she expanded her business by purchasing additional stores of the same goods. With her new loan she hopes to add more diverse goods to her business.

loans.use: To add more diverse goods to her business

loans.name: Sakinétou

texts.en: Mrs. A. sells firewood and charcoal. She has been managing her business since 1997. Her husband is a trained civil engineer and they have 2 children. This will be Mrs. A.’s first loan with WAGES, which she will repay in installments for the next 12 months. As her stock continues to sell out, she will use this loan to purchase more charcoal and firewood to help support her family.

loans.use: To buy supplies of firewood and charcoal

loans.name: Nohra

texts.en: Nohra is a 33-year-old single man. He has been working as a DJ since 1998. With the help of the first loan, he managed to expand his business by buying new sound equipment. Today, Nohra is asking for a new loan of $1,200 to buy more music equipment.

loans.use: To buy more music equipment

loans.name: Karina

texts.en:
Karina V. is from the village of Centro 2, Mallig, Isabela. She is 32 years old. Karina is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Karina owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Karina has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Karina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Karina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand her range of products. Karina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to sell. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Karina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by the business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her range of products offered.

loans.name: Arzibaeva Burmabu's Group

texts.ru:
Бурмабу, ей 46 лет, замужем. Вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. Супруг работает в местном лесном хозяйстве. Старший работает в Бишкеке в Кока Кола Компани. Она занимается сельским хозяйством, в бизнесе активно участвуют все члены семьи. Данный кредит будет использован для аренды земельного надела, а также на закуп семян риса и минеральных удобрений. 

Адашкан, 46 лет, она вдова. У нее двоей детей, сын - 18 и дочь 14 лет. Сын занимается реализацией напитков, а дочь школьница. У Адашкан есть маленькое домашнее хозяйство, где она занимается разведением и откормом МРС, на кредит она планирует закупить 4 овец. 

Упол, ей 46 лет. Она замужем уже больше 25 лет, является матерью 2 детей. Сын учится в торговом колледже, а дочь в этом году заканчивает школу. У клиента имеется земельный надел, где она выращивает сельхоз продукцию, в основном рис, кроме этого выращивает МРС. Кредит будет использован для закупа 5 овец. 

Арзибек самый молодой участник этой группы. Ему 22 года, однако он играет не последнюю роль в группе. Он очень амбициозный и умный парень. Вместе с отцом занимается перепродажей скота на местном рынке. Кроме это его отец занимается пассажирскими перевозками на собственном автотранспорте. На кредит Арзибек планирует купить 2 овец и 4 козла для увеличения товарооборота.   


--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Burmabu is 46 years, married. Together with her husband, she is raising 3 children. Her husband works at a local forest service. The oldest son works at the Coca Cola Company in Bishkek. Burmabu is involved in agriculture, and all family members actively participate in this business. The current loan will be used for leasing a plot of land and purchase of rice seeds and mineral fertilizers. Adashkan is 46 years old and a widow. She has two children: son is 18, and daughter is 14 years old. Her son is involved in selling beverages, and the daughter is a student. Adashkan has a small household, where she is involved in breeding and feeding small livestock. She plans to buy 4 sheep with this loan. Upol is 46 years old. She has been married for over 25 years and is a mother of 2 children. Her son is studying at a trade college, and the daughter will graduate from school this year. Upol has a plot of land, where she grows agricultural products, mainly rice. She also raises small livestock. This loan will be used for the purchase of 5 sheep. Arzibek is the youngest member of this group. He is 22 years old; however, his role in the group is not insignificant. He is a very ambitious and smart young man. Together with his father, he is involved in reselling livestock at the local market. Besides this, his father also provides passenger transportation using his own vehicle. Arzibek plans to purchase 2 sheep and 4 goats with this loan in order to increase turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Lease of land, purchase of seeds and fertilizers, and purchase of livestock

loans.name: Tamara Group

texts.en:
The Tamara Group is new to ADIM. The woman are María Francisca Z., Josefa Mercedes F. G., and Julia Marcelina C. Sánchez. The coordinator of the group is Z.; she sells ice cream, cold drinks, and juices, and has a small food stand where she makes fried foods.

Josefa sells beverages, ice cream, and chocolate bananas, and Julia sells nacatamales, which is a typical Nicaraguan food, like a tamale filled with pork, peppers, onion, tomato, potato, and rice. The women will use the loans to purchase more products and ingredients for their respective businesses so they are able to produce and earn more.

loans.use: To buy ingredients like basic grains, vegetables, and meat

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob is a 29-year-old married man with three children, two of whom attend school.

It is two years now since Jacob started his own school. He employs three teachers to teach in the school. He earns extra income from selling sweet potatoes. He was previously employed before he invested his money in this business.

Jacob plans to invest more in his school to enlarge it and to buy a plot in the future. He has requested a loan of Kes 20,000 to buy office equipment and desks.

loans.use: To buy office equipment and desks

loans.name: Chandani

texts.en:
Chandani is a 47-year-old married woman living with her husband and three daughters. They all help her business with support. They live in the town of Hikkaduwa.

Chandani has an agricultural business. With this business, she is providing good support to her family. She helps to handle the family expenses instead of relying just on her husband's income. Chandani has been doing this business for a long time, and this will be her third loan from BRAC.

Chandani has requested a 35,000 LKR loan from BRAC to help her agriculture business.

Day by day Chandani is working to earn increased income with financial support from BRAC. She hopes to be self-dependent, as she makes strong financial decisions and is a very responsible woman. Ultimately, she hopes to renovate her house in near future with her increased income.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Agahikaine Karungyi Parish, Kyenjojo Group

texts.en:
N. Wilberforce is a 42-year-old married father of eight boisterous schoolchildren. To shoulder his responsibility of providing for them, he has, over the course of the last four years, been operating a retail shop in Kawanijju in Kyenjojo. His business has not been without setbacks since he began.

Wilberforce has had to bear a myriad of challenges, such as the lack of steady income. In a way, however, his business has remained active. This he principally attributes to the good working chord he has struck with his clientele.

In a week, Wilberforce says he makes more than 50,000 Ugandan shillings, a figure he admits will not substantively make his business see the light of day in the near future. He is therefore seeking a loan to lend countenance to his business. With this loan, he says he will be able to buy more garments and other forms of merchandise for his shop.

Wilberforce belongs to a group of nineteen members who support one another in paying back the loan.

loans.use: To buy more stock for his store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more palm fruits to mill into cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres Trabajadoras”tiene  1 año de formación y trabaja  con la Fundación Paraguaya , la mayoría de sus integrantes  ya  realiza actividades  productivas y todas se encuentran muy satisfechas con la actividad que realizan.
Una de las señoras que trabaja con el comité es  Marta F.  quien se dedica a   venta de ropas.
Ella es  de una familia muy humilde y trabaja  mucho para  mantener a su familia, actualmente tiene la necesidad de construir otra pieza para sus hijos por lo que solicita el préstamo a la Fundación ya que los ingresos de la actividad de venta de ropas resulta insuficiente para los gasto extras que genera mejorar la vivienda.
Agradece  la ayuda que recibe de Kiva a través de la  Fundación Paraguaya. 
Todas la integrante del comité son señoras de escasos recursos  y anhelan un futuro mejor para sus hijos es por eso que se esfuerzan el doble para facilitarles los materiales para su desarrollo y formación.
texts.en:
The group "Mujeres Trabajadoras" (Hardworking Women) has been together for one year, and works with the Fundación Paraguaya. Most of its members are already engaged in productive activities, and they are all very satisfied with what they do. One of the women in the group is Marta F., who sells clothes. She comes from a very humble family and works hard to support her own family. Currently she needs to build another room on her house for her children, and that is why she is requesting a loan from the Foundation. Right now the income from her clothing sales isn't enough to cover the extra costs of improving the house. She is thankful for the help she receives from Kiva through Fundación Paraguaya. All the women of the group are women of scarce resources, but they dream of a better future for there children. For this reason, they work twice as hard to provide them with what they need to grow and develop.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of building materials

loans.name: Bakusekamajja Development Group, Mukono

texts.en:
The fishmonger business has mostly been the preserve of men for quite a long time. For a woman, therefore, to bear a hand in such an undertaking in Busembatya, Mukono, was not only remarkable but also unconventional.

46-year-old N. Prossy was undeterred, however. She wanted to obtain a footing in this business regardless of ingrained societal beliefs. Approaching her late 30’s, she knew she had to set her wits to work to bring food to her family’s table. Her seven children had no support since their dad was deceased.

With enough courage and conviction, Prossy started off her business eighteen years ago. Her persistence and “never quit” attitude have ultimately been her invaluable stocks in trade. She makes approximately 200,000 shillings a month and, with this loan, she is aiming to revamp her fish-sales business.

loans.use: To purchase more fish and to revamp her stalls

loans.name: Jehova Es Mi Proveedor Group

texts.es:
El grupo Jehová es mi Proveedor está integrado por tres personas trabajadoras una de ellas es Ángela del Carmen Maltés Gutiérrez, coordinadora del grupo. Ella se dedica al comercio de mercadería en general de seis años.

Sus compañeras Reyna Isabel R. Aguilera es propietaria de una pulpería  y Adela Francisca V. García tiene una zapatería. Ellas invertirán el préstamo en sus negocios con la compra de materia prima como granos básicos, carne, verduras, plásticos, ropa, pega, cuero etc.
texts.en:
The Jehová es mi Proveedor group is comprised of three hard-working people. One of them is Ángela del Carmen Maltés Gutiérrez, the coordinator of the group. She has been selling general merchandise for six years. Reyna Isabel R. Aguilera is one of her colleagues. She has a mini market. Her other colleague, Francisca V. García, has a shoe shop. They will use the loan to invest in their businesses. They will buy raw materials like basic grains, meat, vegetables, plastic products, clothes, glue, and leather, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: General merchandise like clothes and cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.es:
Mariana trabaja en una empresa donde distribuye medicamentos, es soltera e independiente.
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Villa san Antonio Bajo de la ciudad de La Paz. 
El crédito será destinado para el tratamiento medico de su madre ya que el año pasado sufrió una parálisis y requiere pagar los gastos de Fisioterapia.
Es la quinta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial la califica como cliente buena en el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Mariana works for a company that distributes medicines. She is single and independent. Her home is located in the lower Villa San Antonio area of La Paz. She is requesting this loan to pay for medical treatments for her mother, who suffered a paralysis last year and now needs to pay for physical therapy. This is the fifth time that Mariana has requested a loan through IMPRO and her record shows that she is a good client when it comes to making her repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay for physical therapy for her mother, who suffered a paralysis

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn P. is from the village of Kidahon, Malinao, Gingoog City. She is 33 years old and married with seven school-aged children. Emelyn owns a business buying and selling vegetables. Emelyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month.

In 2003, Emelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Emelyn is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the third loan taken out by Emelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Jackson Dan

texts.en:
Jackson Dan O. is a 34-year-old hardworking gentleman from Migori town, western Kenya. He is married to Rose Moraa who is formally employed. They have three children, Amos, Leviticus and Grace aged 13, 8 and 5 years respectively.

To make a living, Jackson owns a carpentry workshop in Migori town where he designs and constructs household items including tables, beds, etc. as per customer request. He is skilled in this art since he has done it for the last nine years. His carpentry shop is located in his homestead, so he has to maintain a good rapport with his clientele who come to order furniture and other items. Jackson is now requesting his third loan to buy timber, glue and additional carpentry tools. His aim is to maintain a good record with Kadet so that he will continue to qualify for future loans. His long term goal is to have a big workshop fully equipped with carpentry machines and at the same time own a timber yard.

loans.use: To buy timber for carpentry work.

loans.name: Edina

texts.en:
Edina S., age 35, is a vendor of beans, rice, and maize flour at her local market. She is requesting a loan in order to stock bags of pulses and baking flour to sell. Edina's husband is a teacher. They have three children, all of whom are enrolled in school. 

With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a shop to allow for more effective stocking of goods.

loans.use: To stock bags of pulses and baking flour for sale

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina B. is 42 years old, married and has four school-aged children. She is from the village of Lactawan in the municipality of Solano, part of the province of Nueva Vizcaya on the Luzon islands. Adelina runs a store from which she sells fruits and vegetables to the local community. Adelina has been in business for over seven years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2009 Adelina joined ASKI to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from ASKI which she used to purchase additional fruits and vegetables to sell. Adelina is requesting a new loan (her third from ASKI) of 8000 PHP which will be used to buy new produce to expand her offerings. She plans to use all additional revenue to financially support immediate members of her family.

About ASKI:

Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc., or ASKI, is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and -women, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new produce to expand her offerings

loans.name: James Lochuch

texts.en:
James Lochuch E. is 26 years old and single. He lives with six relatives who depend on him. They live in Mwanyaka area in Eldoret town. James operates transportation services with his motorbike to earn his income. He has been in this business for the past three years with an income of 29,800 KES per month.

James was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and he is applying for his first loan of 5,000 KES with KADET LTD. With this loan he plans to purchase bicycles which he will use for transport but he will also create employment for the people who will ride them.

He hopes to have a taxi van in the future.

loans.use: To purchase bicycles.

loans.name: Dorine  Jepkemoi

texts.en:
Dorine K. is a 31-year-old lady married to Evan Kurgat and is blessed with two children. Dorine helps support her family of two children along with her husband's income. She runs a second hand clothing business in Kabarnet town. From this business she gets a monthly income of 36,000 KES. She has requested a loan of 30,000 KES, which is her second loan after having paid her first loan successfully.

She intends to use 10,000 KES to buy blouses, 5,000 KES for skirts and 15,000 KES for towels. She plans to save the profits to be used for expansion of her business in the near future.

Dorine's dream and hope is to expand her business and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of used clothing

loans.name: Florentina Matilde

texts.es:
Florentina Matilde tiene 37 años, es conviviente y tiene dos hijos. Actualmente, Florentina Matilde vive en la ciudad Andahuaylillas provincia de Quispicanchis del Departamento del Cusco. Su actividad económica principal de Florentina Matilde es la venta de leña y la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes y gallinas.  

Florentina Matilde desde hace mucho tiempo participa en el banco comunal “Las Triunfadoras”. Con su próximo préstamo que espera recibir de S/. 2000 soles, ella invertirá en el negocio y utilizara el dinero para comprar cuyes. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Florentina Matilde is 37 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children. Florentina Matilde currently lives in the city of Andahuaylillas in Quispicanchis province in the department of Cusco.  Her principal economic activity is the sale of firewood and raising small animals, such as guinea pigs and hens. 

Florentina Matilde has been participating in the communal bank “Las Triunfadoras” for a long time. With her next loan that she hopes to receive, 2000 Peruvian Soles, she will invest in her business and use the money to buy guinea pigs.

She is grateful for the opportunity provided and commits to making her payments on time.

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs

loans.name: María Olguita

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Los Cerezos  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Emprendedora De Los Cerezos,  esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada.
 
La señora María es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y está muy contenta y a gusto porque siempre en todos los créditos le han cumplido con lo que le han prometido. Tiene 53 años y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual procreo 8 hijos todos mayores e independientes. Su marido es comerciante.

Ella se dedica al comercio vende productos naturales, exotéricos y medicinales, tiene un puesto en las calles Alajuela y García Moreno en el centro de la ciudad, donde vende todos estos productos. Trabaja todos los días desde las 7am hasta las 19h00, lo que más vende son productos medicinales para los riñones, el hígado, tiene productos de muchas marcas, los mismos que recibe en su local.

Este crédito es para comprar toda clase de productos para su negocio. Su sueño es tener un local más grande y de su propiedad ya que el que tiene es arrendado.
texts.en:
The "Emprendedora De Los Cerezos" loan group meets fortnightly in the citadel of Los Cerezos in the city of Portoviejo, a densely populated and poor area.  

María is a founding member of the loan group. She is very happy and pleased because with all previous loans she has had what she had been promised. She is 53 years old and lives with her partner, with whom she has had 8 children, all of them adults and independent. Her partner is a merchant.

She sells natural, esoteric and medicinal products from her stall in the centre of the city, in the corner of the streets Alajuela and Garcia Moreno. She works every day from 7am to 7pm. What she sells the most is medicinal products for the kidneys and liver. She sells different brands, the same ones she receives at her premises. 

The loan is to buy all kinds of products for her business. Her dream is to own larger premises, because at the moment she is renting.

loans.use: Buy natural, esoteric and medicinal products.

loans.name: Tony

texts.es: Tony, de 21 años, es un joven muy sencillo y trabajador, vive solo en su casa propia y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida, para ello esta dispuesto a trabajar muy duro. El negocio de Tony se encuentra en el poblado de Santa Rosa (ubicado en el interior de la selva Ayacuchana), el se dedica en la administración de una estación de radio, por lo que se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos, además por ser la principal radio del poblado, ha logrado que este trabajo sea el más rentable. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es programar música y monitorear los programas que se transmiten y que tengan un contenido adecuado, han transcurrido 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer dentro de la radio por casi 18 horas diarias, lo cual fatiga mucho. Con el tiempo, desea mejorar las instalaciones de su radio, para brindar una mejor comodidad a los visitantes de la radio. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, sabe que este aporte le será muy beneficioso para el desarrollo de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es un socio muy alegre y siempre pone orden en las reuniones. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará nuevos equipos para radio, ya que los que tiene actualmente están fallando debido al tiempo que ya tienen de uso.
texts.en:
Tony is 21 years old.  He is a very modest and hard-working young man who lives on his own in his own house.  What he wants more than anything is to get ahead in life.  He is prepared to work very hard to achieve this.  Tony's business is in the town of Santa Rosa (which is located in the Ayacuchana jungle).  He runs a radio station which has become his main source of income.  It is the main radio station in the town and he has managed to make his work profitable.

What Tony most likes about his work is programming music, monitoring the programs which are transmitted and making sure that the programs have appropriate content.  He has been in this business for 4 years.  He considers that the most difficult thing about his work is having to remain inside the radio station for almost 18 hours a day which leaves him very tired.  Over time, he would like to improve his installations to make the visitors to his radio station more comfortable.

This is Tony's fourth loan with MFP and he knows that this support will be very beneficial to the development of his work.  He is a very happy member of his community bank and he always brings order to their meetings.  He will use his loan for 3,000 nuevos soles to buy new equipment for his radio station since his existing equipment is breaking down as it has been used for a long time.

loans.use: To buy new equipment for his radio station

loans.name: Batuli

texts.en:
Batuli is a married woman with five children, four of whom attend school while one is too young for school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a boutique for the past three years, selling by retail lesos and kikois (cloth wraps) to her neighbours and passersby. In addition, she does farming which contributes to her other source of income. Batuli faces a major challenge of the high cost of paying for rental business houses. She hopes to expand and open a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase kitchen utensils and cloth materials for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase kitchen utensils and cloth materials for resale.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La señora Victoria C. Alvares vive en la comunidad de Tlayecac, Ayala, en el estado de Morelos, México, ella tiene 37 años de edad, ella estudio hasta el 3er. Año de secundaria tiene su certificado, ella es casada tiene 2 hijas Perla de 8 años de edad está estudiando la primaria e Ingrid de 5 años de edad está en preescolar, ella tiene su taller de costura y solicitó su préstamo para mantenimiento de las maquinas y para comprar, hilos, ahujas, aceite, ella ofrece a sus clientes pantalones, short, chazarilla, playeras, chamarras, además de los pedidos que le hagan los clientes, ya que ella trabaja como maquiladora. Ella inicio con su negocio hace 3 años, trabajaba con una señora de empleada cosiendo y decidió tener su propio negocio,  por medio de préstamos compró sus maquinas industriales: 2 rectas industriales y después con las ganancias compró la otra maquina recta y la otra maquina over.
Su negocio está en la casa de su mamá, ella vive a la vuelta llega caminando al taller, este negocio es importante para ella porque tiene ingresos para la alimentación de la familia y los gastos de su casa, su cliente es una persona  de Yautepec surte a diferentes estados. A ella le da gran satisfacción cuando cobra y tiene dinero, también le gusta trabajar en la maquina over  y está orgullosa de tener trabajo y tener sus propias maquinas industriales  y la saca de apuros cuando su esposo se enferma ella puede solventar los gastos. Las ganancias de su negocio las utiliza para la alimentación, para los gastos familiares, para pagar el préstamo y para seguir invirtiendo. 
El negocio si le ha ayudado en los gastos, en las colegiaturas de sus hijas y en muchas cosas, ella desea mejorar su vivienda repellara, echarle piso y comprar una sala, sus sueños son tener un cuarto especial para su taller porque el que está ocupando es de su mamá, ella está feliz con el préstamo que le proporcionan porque le va a ayudar a surtir su negocio, las mejorías que desea para sus hijas son que sigan estudiando y este préstamo le va a ayudar para comprar sus útiles y para pagar los gastos de la escuela. Ella quiere decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad muchas gracias por apoyar a gente de pocos recursos y que no le suban a los interés.”  Tlayecac es un pueblo muy bonito porque es tranquilo todo está cerca para comprar, siembran sorgo, maíz, cebolla.
texts.en:
Mrs. Victoria C. Alvares lives in the community of Tlayecac, Ayala in the state of Morelos in Mexico. She is 37 years old, she graduated from high school and she is married. She has two daughters: Perla is 8 years old and goes to elementary school; Ingrid is 5 years old and goes to pre-school. She has a sewing workshop and requested a loan to maintain the machines and to buy threads, needles, and oil. To her customers, she offers pants, shorts, shirts, t-shirts, and jackets; she also takes volume orders from her customers. She started her business 3 years ago; she worked sewing with another lady as an employee and then she decided to have her own business. With loans, she bought 2 industrial machines and with the profits she bought two more machines.

Her business is located at her Mother’s house; she lives just around the corner and she walks to her workshop. This business is important to her because it provides income for food and household expenses. She has a customer from Yautepec that supplies to other states. She derives great satisfaction when she collects payments and has money. She likes to work with the sewing machines and is proud to have a job, to have her own industrial machines, and to have ready-resources to support expenses when her husband gets sick. She uses the profits from the business for food, household expenses, loan payments, and to re-invest.

The Business has helped her with expenses, school payments for her daughters and many other things. She wishes to stucco her house, add flooring, and buy furniture. Her dream is to have a special room for her workshop since she is currently at her Mom’s house. She is happy with the provided loan because it will help her stock up her business. She would like for her daughters to continue going to school; this loan will help her to buy school supplies and pay school expenses. She wants to give thanks to Kiva and Fundación Realidad for supporting people with limited resources and for the low interest rates. Tlayecac is a pretty town because it is tranquil and with convenient shopping; they grow sorghum, corn and onions.

loans.use: Buy threads, needles, and oil for machine maintenance.

loans.name: Tolusefulutasi

texts.en:
Tolusefulutasi is 42 and married with six children (aged 5-30 years). Tolusefulutasi owns & operates a business selling bamboo handicrafts to tourists and local community members.  She has two years of experience in this business. Tolusefulutasi needs a loan of WST $2,500 to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas per week) to improve/expand her business.

In 2005, Tolusefulutasi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Tolusefulutasi's sixth loan with SPBD.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts

loans.name: Astrid Evelyn

texts.es:
La señora Astrid Evelyn M. y el señor Julio Cesar Fuentes  tiene dos hijos que actual mente están estudiando y necesitan pagar la colegiatura de este semestre para que puedan terminar el año escolar.  
Solicitan un préstamo ya que no cuenta con el dinero necesario para pagar en la escuela y desean que sus hijos sigan estudiando.
