Daña Astrid Evelyn trabaja  como niñera particular y con este ingreso pagaran el crédito  ya que Don  Julio Cesar se encargara de los gastos familiares con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo que tiene en una agencia aduanal en el departamento de tramitador.
texts.en:
Astrid Evelyn M. and Julio Cesar Fuentes have two children who are in school and they need to pay this semester's tuition fees in order to complete the school year. 

They request a loan because they do not have the necessary funds to pay these tuition fees and they wish to keep their kids in school.

Astrid Evelyn is a private daycare worker and with this loan she will pay her loan. Julio Cesar takes care of the family's expenses with the income he earns working at a custom's office in the department of labor.

loans.use: To pay for school fees.

loans.name: Las Golondrinas Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LAS GOLONDRINAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. María; ella tiene 76 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 9 hijos; La socia tiene su negocio D. costura ella confecciona materiales D. tela para cubrir licuadoras , microondas entre otros mas también realiza otro tipo D. manualidades como fundas para almohadas ,paneras,portalapiceros entre otros, la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas D. seguir adelante ya que mediante este trabajo ella sigue apoyando en lo que pueD. a su familia y también es una distraccion para ella,la socia está feliz por ese motivo y desea continuar desea forma. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra  D. más mercadería para su negocio como hilos D. todos los colores, tijeras, telas, reglas entre otros más. 

Los otros socios  se dedican al turismo tienen sus agencias D. viajes, tiendas D. venta D. equipo D. camping, otro socio trabaja con su carrito ofreciendo servicios D. tours y una socia se dedica al negocio D. venta D. cosméticos.  

La socia se siente feliz por el préstamo  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas.
texts.en:
These members are part of the Communal Bank “Las Golondrinas” (The Swallows), which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

One of the members is Sra. María. She is 76 years old, married, and has nine children. María has a sewing business in which she makes covers for blenders, microwaves, and other appliances. She also produces other types of handmaD. items such as pillowcases, bread baskets, pencil holders, and other items. María is a cheerful person who has tremendous desire to get ahead in her work so that she can support her family. In addition, her work serves as a distraction. For this reason, María is happy and wants to continue in the same manner.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more supplies for her business such as threads of every color, scissors, fabric, rulers, and other items.

The other members engage in the tourism industry. Some manage travel agencies and camping supply stores. One member has a vehicle for offering tours while another member has a business selling cosmetics.

The members are happy with this loan and promise to complete their payments.

loans.use: Purchase thread, scissors, fabric, rulers, and other items

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa P. is from the town of Banga. She is 50 years old. Ninfa is married and has two children, aged 21 and 23. To make a living, Ninfa plants and harvests rice for sale. Ninfa works hard to improve her business.

Ninfa joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ninfa has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Ninfa is requesting a new loan of 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP), which will be used to purchase fertilizers and seeds.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Mukafat

texts.ru: Mukafat G. 40 let. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey, dochku i sina kotoriye uchatsya v shkole. Mukafat yavlyayetsya IDP personom , on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione. Mukafat uje 9 let kak zanimayetsya prodajey jenskoy obuvi i sumok. Seychas Mukafat nujdayetsya v 2300 AZN chtobi kupit obuv dlya novoqo sezona i sumki dlya prodaji.
texts.en: Mukafat G. is forty years old.  He is married and has two children, a son and daughter who go to school.  Mukafat is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region.  Mukafat has been selling women’s shoes and bags for nine years.  Now, Mukafat needs 2300 AZN to buy and resell shoes and bags appropriate for the new season.

loans.use: Buying goods for resale

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine M. is from the village of Del Pilar, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 47 years old. Josephine is married and has two adult children. 

To make a living, Josephine prepares "longganisa" (pork sausages) and "tocino" (cured pork)  for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Josephine joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Josephine is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients to make more products for sale. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Josephine from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI: 
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients to make prepared food for sale

loans.name: Merle

texts.es:
Merly, de 54 años, es una mujer sincera. Vive en su casa propia en compañía de Cesar su esposo de 61 años y sus hijos de 31 que es independiente, y  Junior de 14 años, por quien se esfuerza  a diario.  

Por muchos años, se dedicaba a la venta de pescados. Pero, debido a su salud cambio su negocio, por la venta de ropas. Desde entonces hace 10 años, vende ropa casual y sobre todo zapatos, en un local alquilado dentro de un mercado lejos de su casa. El negocio que realiza le gusta mucho, solo que en esta temporada sus ventas aminoraron; debido a la campaña escolar, no vendió sus prendas ni zapatos casuales y sus ganancias fueron mínimas, ya que este mes ni siquiera pudo cubrir  el alquiler de su puesto. Por ello,  no se provee de muchas mercaderías; solo compra de acuerdo al pedido que le hacen sus clientes y, de ese modo no se acumula mercaderías mucho tiempo, sin rotarlas. Esta convencida que atrabajando arduamente, en adelante logrará instalar su bodega bazar en su casa propia, para realizar su vida más sosegada.

Está contenta de renovar su 26avo crédito que tiene con MFP, y se compromete a seguir siendo muy puntual en sus cuotas. 

Con el dinero del crédito que solicita, comprará algunos pedidos de zapatos y pantalones, con el cubrirá el alquiler de su puesto y lo que sobra las guardará, para los casos de emergencia.
texts.en:
Merly is 54 years old and a very sincere woman.  She lives in her own home with her husband Cesar, 61, and their children, one who is 31 and independent and Junior who is 14 years old, for whom she works hard every day.

For a long time she sold fish for a living but had to change businesses for health reasons.  Ten years ago she began selling casual clothing and shoes out of a stall she rents in the market located far from home.  She enjoys her work very much but this season sales are down.  She has not been able to sell much clothing or shoes during the school campaign so her earnings have been scarce and she could not even pay for the stall rental this month.  She is unable to stock up on merchandise and can only purchase what the customers order.  She is convinced that through hard work she will be able to set up a bazaar in her own home so her life is a little more relaxed.

She is happy to be receiving her 26th loan through MFP and is committed to paying it back on time.

She plans to use the loan to buy shoes and trousers, pay stall rental and save the rest for an emergency.

loans.use: To buy shoes and trousers

loans.name: Johana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Johana del Carmen P. de 31 años es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora quien vende calzado. Ella inicio este negocio  hace siete años con unos ahorros y ha continuado por medio de los préstamos lo cual le ayudo a mejorar su negocio.
Ella invertirá el crédito en calzado como sandalias, zapatos, chinelas…etc.

P. junto con su compañero de vida cría a sus cuatro hijos de 13, 12. 6 y 3 años por los cuales trabajan arduamente.
texts.en:
Johana del Carmen P., 31, is a hardworking woman, dedicated and enterprising, who sells shoes. She began this business seven years ago with some savings and has carried on by means of borrowed money which helped her improve her business. 

She will invest the loan in footwear such as sandles, shoes and flip-flops. 

P., along with her life companion, is raising four children of 13, 12, 6 and 3 years of age, for whom they work arduously.

loans.use: to purchase footwear for her business.

loans.name: Lidia Esther

texts.es:
Lidia Gutiérrez  es una mujer decidida y emprendedora que vive en Soledad y emprendió su vida comercial  desde los 19 años,  para apoyar el sostenimiento de su  familia de 4 hijos  hoy en las edades de 26 a 32 años, obligacion economica que hasta ese momento estaba totalmente a cargo de su esposo y él  trabajador de una empresa había adquirido la obligación de un crédito de vivienda.  Inició vendiendo una canasta de cerveza semanal y gradualmente fue aumentando sus ventas hasta llegar a 40 cajas mensuales y luego adicionó otro producto como el whisky; así mismo como desarrolló una clientela fija agregó a su mercadeo artículos que mediante su observación veía que la gente compraba muy frecuentemente,  especialmente  mujeres, fue así como agregó ropa interior y vestidos de baño, que son productos de todas las temporadas.  Su sueño es adecuar un cuarto en donde pueda exhibir sus productos y en especial tener un estanco ubicado estratégicamente,  ya que en fechas especiales el esfuerzo  de venta es mayor  que si contara con un punto comercial, donde los clientes la ubicaran rápidamente.
Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización con la planea hacer crecer su capital de trabajo, por eso con su credikiva Lidia  comprará mercancías que  tiene encargadas,  como ropa femenina, interiores, calzado,  bebidas y licores,  pues se acerca el día de las madres y todas las familias desean compartir y agasajar con detalles para las mujeres con quienes comparten,  entre madres, esposas, hijas familiares y amigas.
texts.en:
Lidia Gutiérrez is a determined and enterprising woman who lives in Soledad. She began her business at the age of 19 to help sustain her family of four children, who today age between 26 and 32 years of age. Until Lidia began her business, this financial obligation was the sole responsibility of her husband, a company worker who had also taken on the financial responsibility of a mortgage. Lidia began working by selling a hamper of beer every week, gradually increasing her sales until she reached 40 boxes a month. Later she added another product, whisky, and in this way she was able to develop a solid client base, adding other items which she saw people buying very frequently, especially women, such as underwear and bathing suits which are always in season. 

Lidia's dream is to fit out a room where she can exhibit all of her products, and she would particularly like to have a strategically located stall so that on special days when people are more inclined to make purchases she could have a point of sale where her clients can find her quickly.

This is Lidia's first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With this loan from Kiva she plans to increase her working capital and purchase the merchandise that her customers have ordered, such as women's clothing, underwear, shoes, drinks and liquor, since Mother's Day is coming up and every family wants to come together and spoil the women in their lives, be they mothers, wives, daughters or friends.

loans.use: to purchase the merchandise that her customers have ordered, such as women's clothing, underwear, shoes, drinks and liquor

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana, de 44 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y humilde, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo José de 45 años y sus 2 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Cada día Ana trabaja muy duro para salir adelante, es por eso que se dedica a varios oficios a la vez, ahora se esta dedicando a  la venta de productos de belleza. Ella vende a sus clientes ya conocidos, quienes difícilmente se atrasaran en el pago, adicionalmente presta el servicio de cosmetología a sus conocidos, quienes saben de la habilidad que tiene en sus manos para cortar el cabello y hacer peinados. Hace algunos años estudio cosmetología, pero no se dedicó por completo a esta labor pues sus hijos estaban pequeños, pero en la actualidad quiere trabajar con mayor esfuerzo en este oficio. Le gusta mucho su labor como peluquera pues se entretiene y le genera regulares ganancias, también brinda el servicio de cosmetología a domicilio, lo que marca la diferencia. Aunque no tiene  aún su propio salón de belleza tiene planeado para el futuro instalar uno en sociedad con una amiga. Es el segundo crédito con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible que pudiera obtener este crédito. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará algunos materiales que necesita para continuar peinando, además de tintes y líquidos para desarrollar mejor su labor.
texts.en: Ana, 44 years old, is a simple and humble woman.  She lives in her house with her husband Jose, 45 years old, and her 2 beloved children for whom she wants to bring a better quality of life.  Ana works very hard every day to get ahead, for that reason she works at several activities at the same time.  She is currently working at selling beauty products.  She sells to her current customers who are unlikely to get behind in their payments.  She also provides cosmetology services to her acquaintances who know her skills in cutting and styling hair.  She studied cosmetology several years ago but did not work at it full time because her children were small, currently she wants to devote more time to the trade.  She loves her role as a beautician because she finds it entertaining and it generated steady income. She also provides cosmetology services in the customers' homes which makes her unique.  Even though she does not yet have her own shop, she plans to open one with a friend as a partner.  This is her second loan with MFP and she promises to pay her installments on a timely fashion because she does not want to look bad to the people that made this loan possible.  With the thousand new soles that she is requesting she will buy supplies that she needs to continue doing hair, in addition to color and lotions to better develop her trade.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as hair color, hair dryer, combs and brushes.

loans.name: Delma

texts.es: Delma es una joven de 21 años que vive en el barrio Bonanza del municipio de Soledad, con su cónyuge y su hijo de 2 años de edad; allí tiene un negocio donde vende refrescos y bebidas frías, los fines de semanas y festivos,  el cual  le genera ingresos con los que también apoya su hogar; así mismo Delma  tiene una actividad comercial a la cual se dedica los días hábiles y esta es la venta de mercancías variada mediante guías especializadas de productos. Delma inició su negocio de refrescos y bebidas frías,  cuando su esposo le compró un pequeño enfriador, gradualmente fueron creciendo sus ventas y  el negocio mismo generó utilidades que reinvirtió en  un botellero de mayor tamaño, para responder  la  creciente demanda   y  generar más ingresos; como Delma es una mujer inquieta  agregó un  nuevo negocio a su vida,  el de vender mercancía variada, actividad que desarrolla mediante la distribución personal de mercancía a clientes, a quienes ofrece cosméticos, ropa, accesorios y calzados a créditos,  en plazos adaptados a sus posibilidades. Delma maneja en su negocio un margen de utilidad del 23 % que quiere incrementar y por eso está solicitando su primer financiamiento a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará cajas de cerveza en mayor cantidad, pues tiene como meta,  lograr que los pequeños negocios le compren directamente a ella, cuando estos no tengan en existencia y los proveedores no hayan respondido a sus pedidos; Delma sabe que este es un buen segmento de mercado, porque la mayor parte de los propietarios de negocios, compran en pequeñas cantidades debido al pequeño capital de trabajo que manejan usualmente.
texts.en: Delma is a 21 year-old young person that lives in the Bonanza neighborhood in Soledad City with her partner and their two year-old son. She has a business selling soda and cold drinks on the weekends and holidays. This business generates income, which she uses to support their home. Delma has another business, which she does on her free days. She sells various types of merchandise from specialized catalogues. She began her business selling soda and cold drinks when her husband purchased a small refrigerator. Gradually she increase her sales and the business generated income which she used to purchase a refrigerator that can hold more bottles in order to respond to the increasing customer demand and generate more income. Since Delma is an active woman, she began another business. She sells various types of merchandise. She developed this business from the catalogue business she started previously. She sells cosmetics, clothes, accessories and shoes on credit (with payments customized to her customers needs). Delma conducts this business on a 23 percent profit margin, which she would like to increase. This is why she is requesting her first loan from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. She will use this loan to buy a large quantity of boxes of beer on a wholesale level. She has a goal of selling these to small businesses. When the small businesses don’t have beer in stock they cannot meet their customer’s requests. Delma knows that this is a good segment of the market as a large number of small business owners can only buy small quantities as they usually have only have a little working capital.

loans.use: to buy boxes of beer on a wholesale level.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea is a domestic farmer in the Siem Reap Province. She works at growing fruit on her farm. Chea and her husband make approximately US $3.5 per day from their fruit-planting business. 

This couple has given birth to six children, all of whom are single. Three of them are employed as local workers and work by picking potatoes at a farm. 

The family owns some medium-size farm land where they plant jackfruit, banana, and mango trees, but now they don’t have enough money to plant more. Hence, Chea is looking for a loan to purchase different kinds of fruit seeds for planting. She wants to use the remainder to sell some goods in front of her house.

loans.use: to purchase different kinds of fruit seeds for planting.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a twenty-seven-year-old single mother with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been offering secretarial services for three years, a business which she started with 1,000,000 shillings and now has 4,000,000 shillings. Her hardships are debtors and high rent. Her vision is to become a big supplier of stationery supplies and secretarial services in her area, and to educate her children.  Florence intends to use this loan to buy a computer, photocopying papers, pens and envelopes for her secretarial shop.

loans.use: buy a computer and office supplies

loans.name: Dony

texts.es:
Dony es un hombre de empuje, muy trabajador y solidario.
El está solicitando un préstamo por el monto de  ₡400.000 (cuatrocientos mil colones), esto sería para la compra de una computadora portátil e impresora multifuncional, para llevar más fácil y ordenada las finanzas.
El desea mejor su calidad de vida, salir adelante con la empresa y lograr crecer e incrementar las ganancias, ya que pertenece a la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Nimboyore, en Guanacaste, una de las 110 empresas que existen en el país.
texts.en:
Dony is a hard worker and very supportive.  He is requesting a loan in the amount of 400,000 CRC to buy a laptop computer and multi-function printer so he can handle the finances more easily.

He wants to improve his lifestyle and help his company get ahead by growing business and increasing earnings.  He belongs to the Communal Credit Company of Nimboyore in Guanacaste, one of 110 companies that exist in the country.

loans.use: To buy computer equipment.

loans.name: And Soukali Jeeguene Pire 14 Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de 5 membres qui habitent dans le village de Pire à cent km de DAKAR la capitale du Sénégal, leur activité principale est le commerce de produits agricoles  les tubercules de manioc. Elles sont expérimentées dans le domaine et disposent  d’une bonne  clientèle. Leur journée commence à 8 heures du matin et se  termine vers 20heures du soir. Avec ce financement elles comptent  acheter 100 sacs de manioc qu’elles vont revendre  au marché. Les revenus tirés de la vente du manioc leur permettra de renforcer leur commerce mais aussi de satisfaire les besoins de leurs enfants (paiement des frais de scolarité les frais médicaux et participer a l’entretien de la maison).
texts.en:
This is a group composed of five members who live in Pire, a village located 100 kilometers from Dakar, the capital of Senegal. Their main business activity involves trading with farm products, such as cassava tubers. The group members are experienced in this field and have a strong customer base. The workday starts at 8 a.m. and ends around 8 p.m.

With this financing, the group members intend to buy 100 sacks of cassava that they will resell at the market. The income earned from the sale of cassava will enable them to strengthen their business and provide for their children (school fees, healthcare and household expenses).

loans.use: to buy cassava, groundnuts and millet.

loans.name: Sophat

texts.en:
Sophat, pictured here, is 51 and works as a tuk-tuk (taxi) driver. In addition, he is also hired by villagers to farm. He uses his income to support his family. Sophat’s wife, Somul, stays at home and does housework. The family lives in the area surrounding Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Sophat is requesting a 300 USD loan to repair the house where he lives.

loans.use: to repair his house

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice is 35 years old. She is a widow with four children, all of whom are in school. She has a business selling bread and onions in Kator Branch in South Sudan. She has been in this business for three years.

Joice requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She will use the profit to pay for school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more onions and bread to sell

loans.name: Abadahemana Group

texts.fr:
Claudine est une commerçante âgée de 35 ans qui habite la  commune de Rugombo de la Province de Cibitoke à l’Ouest du Burundi. Elle fait le commerce de tomates depuis 2ans. Elle est aussi cultivatrice. Elle n’a fait pas fréquenté l’école. Elle est mère de 6 enfants dont 4étudient. Elle  arrive au 4e cycle dans le crédit Communautaire avec Turame. 

Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour  accroitre son capital  en achetant de grandes quantités de tomates à revendre pour réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  Communautaire« ABADAHEMANA».
texts.en:
Claudine is a 35 year old merchant who lives in Rugombo in Cibitoke Province in West Burundi. She has been selling tomatoes for 2 years. She is also a farmer. She did not go to school. She has 6 children of whom 4 attend school. She has had 4 credit cycles with Turame.

She requests a Kiva loan to increase her capital by purchasing large quantities of tomatoes for resale to make big proceeds.

She is a member of the ABADAHEMANA community group.

loans.use: Increase her capital by purchasing large quantities of tomatoes for resale to make a significant gain.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her children.

For the past two years she has operated a boutique shop, selling to neighbors and friends. Her major challenges are seasonality and transportation. She dreams of having a wholesale boutique in the future.  

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase boutique items and cloth materials to increase her stock. She decide to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase boutique items and cloth materials to increase her stock.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 47 years old and married with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Edna has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. Edna requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more items like shoes, blouses, curtains, etc..

Edna has been in this business for five years. In the future, Edna would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy more items like shoes, blouses, curtains, etc.

loans.name: Vakhtang

texts.en:
Vakhtang is 31 years old. He lives in Vardablur village, Lori marz. Vakhtang is married and he has two small children: a son and a daughter. 

Vakhtang is a worker at gold-mining organization. At the same time he is engaged in animal breeding and land cultivation. On his farm Vakhtang breeds a cow, a calf, and two pigs. Also he has a garden where he grows various fruits and also pumpkins. Vakhtang uses pumpkins as a fodder for his farm animals. 

He intends to develop a cattle breeding operation which will allow him to produce dairy products not only for his family's use but also for sale. Therefore Vakhtang is asking for an 800,000 Armenian Dram (AMD) loan to buy four or five calves for his farm.

loans.use: to buy 4 or 5 calves for his farm

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es:
Ana, está solicitando nuevamente un préstamo, porque quiere surtir el negocio, ya que no tiene el dinero necesario para realizar una nueva inversión en el negocio, la compra será en llantas nuevas y usadas, este nuevo pedido es para mantener siempre disponibilidad ante la demanda.
Estos préstamos le han servido para que su negocio sea más rentable y pueda satisfacer a los clientes en las necesidades.
texts.en: Ana is again requesting a loan because she wants to stock her business.  Since she doesn't have the necessary funds to make a new investment in the business, she will use the loan to purchase new and used tires.  This new request is being made so that she can steadily keep up availability in the face of demand.  These loans have worked towards her business becoming more profitable and becoming more able to satisfy customer needs.

loans.use: to purchase an allotment of new and used tires.

loans.name: Norberto Natividad

texts.es: En la comarca llamada Palo de Lapa ubicada en las afueras de la ciudad de León vive, el joven Norberto, de 27 años de edad, quien a duras penas logro culminar su sexto grado de primaria, es padre de 2 hijos, el primero de sus hijos tiene 4 años de edad y esta en preescolar y el otro tiene 4 meses de nacido. El es jefe de familia quien se encarga de llevar el alimento diario a su familia gracias a su arduo trabajo a sus manos laboriosas que siembran maíz y yuca todos los días. El aprendió este actividad gracias a su padre quien le enseño a trabajar desde muy temprana edad, con el tiempo fue adquiriendo experiencia hasta que al cumplir 20 años de edad se independizo comenzó a sembrar por si solo. Hoy en día los cultivos que esta sembrando eS yuca y maíz pues son los que mas se venden en su zona y los que le dejan mejores ingresos. El realizo el crédito para sembrar 4 manzanas de yuca tipo ceiba, que es una variedad muy demanda por la población de su zona. Con el crédito podrá pagar parte de los costos que implica sembrar yuca, sacar una buena producción así venderla aun buen precio que le permita seguir invirtiendo y trabajando. En sus planes futuros quiere diversificar sus cultivos, sembrar ajonjolí y sorgo que son productos buenos para cultivar y comercializar. Sus próximas metas son sembrar 10 manzanas de yuca y 5 manzanas  de ajonjolí ya que son cultivos que dejan buenos ingresos.
texts.en: IThe young Norberta, aged 27 years, lives in the district called Palo de Lapa located on the outskirts of the city of León. He barely managed to complete his 6th grade education. He is the father of 2 children, the eldest one being 4 years old and in preschool and the other one being 4 months old. He is the head of the household, responsible for providing food daily for his family thanks to his hard work and industrious hands that plant corn and cassava every day. He learned this work from his father who taught him from an early age. With time he gained experience until on reaching the age of 20 he became independent and started planting by himself. Nowadays, he plants cassava and corn as they sell the most in his area and gives him a better income. He realized the loan to plant 4 blocks of cassava of the ceiba variety which is a variety that is in high demand in his area. With the loan he will pay part of the cost of planting the cassava, get a good harvest and sell it at the best price possible to allow him to continue investing and working. His future plans are to plant 10 blocks of cassava and 5 blocks of sesame as they are crops that give a good return.

loans.use: to buy 4 blocks of cassava of ceiba variety which is in great demand in his area.

loans.name: Simana Shg Group

texts.en:
Beatrice is the facilitator of the Simana SHG group. Beatrice and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Beatrice takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund to grow enough to feed her family and to have additional maize profits to educate her children. In the recent 2011 season, Beatrice had a good maize yield harvesting 7 ½ bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Beatrice was only able to harvest three bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Beatrice and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Beatrice will educate her children and invest in raising livestock.

In 2012, the members of Simana SHG group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

Beatrice is pictured with her group members in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.es:
Margaret, de 28 años, es una joven mujer, buena, amable y muy responsable, esta casada y tiene tres hijos de 9, 6 y 2 años, es feliz teniendo a su lado a sus hijos y a su esposo, comparte junto a ellos una casa propia desde donde a diario se esfuerzan mucho y así poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.
El trabajo de Margaret, consiste en la venta de medicamentos y perfumería, desde muy temprano abre su local, ubicado en su casa, ahí tiene a la venta todo tipo de medicinas, desde lo mas simple hasta medicamentos compuestos, además vende algunos artículos de decoración y artículos personales. Se inicio con un negocio muy chico, solo tenía algunos tipos de medicinas y los más simples, pero gracias al esfuerzo que siempre puso pudo crecer de a poco. Tiene buenas ventas ya que ofrece todo tipo de productos y es la garantía que sus clientes esperan siempre para poder ir y encontrar lo que deseen. Al principio como todo emprendedor tuvo algunas dificultades, no sabia mucho como era el ritmo de este negocio y tuvo que poner mucho esfuerzo para poder aprender, además tenía muchas dificultades en cuanto a lo económico ya que tenia que depender solamente de su esposo y con eso algunas veces no bastaba. Ahora le esta yendo bien, tiene la ayuda de un químico farmacéutico quien la asesora y le da el prestigio que necesita su negocio. Como toda persona tiene muchos objetivos, el de ella es hacer crecer aún más su negocio y poder tener un médico para convertir su negocio en un consultorio medico. Este será el tercer préstamo con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez mas de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada mucho estar en el banco comunal que pertenece por que todos sus integrantes con personas que con responsables y muy solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado 2000 soles, comprará medicina para seguir con su negocio, además implementara en algunos artículos personales para que así tenga mas variedad de productos que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Margaret, 28, is a young, good, kind and very responsible woman.  She’s married and has three children who are 9, 6 and 2 years old.  She’s happy with her children and husband by her side.  She shares her house with them where they strive daily very much to attain a better quality of life

Margaret’s work consists in selling medicine and perfumes.  She opens her store, which is home-based, very early.  She sells all types of medicine, from the most simple to complex medicines.  She also sells a few decorative and personal items.  She started out in this business while still very young.  She only had a few types of medicine, the most simple ones, but thanks to the effort she always put into it she was able to grow gradually.

Her sales are good because she stocks all types of products and that guarantees that her customers expect to go and find what they desire.  At the beginning, like all business people, she had a few difficulties.  She did not know the rhythm of this business and had to put much effort into learning; she also had many economic difficulties because she depended solely on her husband and sometimes it just wasn’t enough.

Now she’s doing well.  She now has the help of a pharmacist who adviser her and gives her business needed prestige.  Like everyone, she has many objectives.  Hers is to make her business grow and to have a doctor on site to turn it into a medical office.

This will be her third MFP loan so she’s hoping for your collaboration to continue toward her objectives.  She enjoys being in the communal bank she’s a member of very much because all the people who are members are very responsible and very supportive.

She will use the requested 2000 soles to buy medicines to continue with her business.  She will also add some personal items to have more variety of products to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy medicines and personal items.

loans.name: Ana Loidover

texts.es: La señora Ana a sus 65 años de edad es madre de 5 hijos, se dedica junto con su esposo a trabajar en su propia tienda desde hace 8 años. La señora Ana quiere tener adicional a su tienda, un almacen en el cual pueda vender variedades como artículos de belleza y papelería. La señora Ana desea comprar para la temporada de fin de año surtido para su almacen que recién inicia tal como aretas, pulseras, accesorios para mujer y ropa para toda la familia. Con lo anterior, la señora Ana podrá aumentar sus ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y a corto plazo realizarle mejoras locativas a su almacén. El sueño de la señora Ana es ver crecer su tienda y su almacén.
texts.en:
Ana, 65, is the mother of five children.  She and her husband have worked in their own store for eight years.  Ana wants to have an addition to her store, a shop in which she can sell varieties such as beauty products and stationery.  

Ana wants to buy stock items for her shop that she recently started, such as earrings, bracelets, women's accessories, and clothing for the whole family, for the end-of-the-year season.  With this Ana will be able to increase her earnings and so improve her quality of life and, in the short term, make improvements on her shop.

Ana's dream is to see her store and her shop grow.

loans.use: to buy stock items.

loans.name: Elsa Guadalupe

texts.es:
Elsa Guadalupe, tiene 40 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos, quienes están estudiando, vive en Cofradia, Cortes.
Doña Elsa, hace 4 años se gana la vida elaborando comidas rápidas y típicas como nacatamales, baleadas (tortilla de harina con frijoles, queso, mantequilla y huevo), pastelitos de carne, enchiladas, tacos, tortilla con quesillo y refrescos. Estos productos los vende en una glorieta (cocina) de la escuela. Vende durante todo el año escolar y los meses de vacaciones de los estudiantes ella elabora nacatamales en su casa. Los nacatamales es una comida que tiene gran demanda en este país, son muy ricos elaborados con harina de maíz, rellenos de carne, papas, arroz, chicharos y condimentos. Es un negocio rentable.
Este préstamo es el noveno que ha solicitado a ODEF. El que ha solicitado actualmente es para comprar, ingredientes para hacer nacatamales, como harina de maíz, carne, verduras y condimentos.
A crecido su negocio, ella empezó vendiendo refrescos y ahora es muy reconocida en la comunidad por los ricos nacatamales que vende. Su sueño es establecer otro puesto de venta.
texts.en:
Elsa Guadalupe, 40, is a single mother; she has two children attending school.  She lives in Cofradía, Cortes.

Elsa has been earning her livelihood selling fast food and traditional dishes like nacatamales [Nicaraguan-style tamales], baleadas (flour tortilla with beans, cheese, butter and egg), meat pies, enchiladas, tacos, tortilla with cheese and soft-drinks.  She sells these items at a school snack bar.  She sells during the entire school year and on student vacation times she makes nacatamales at home.  Nacatamales are a food that is in high demand in this country.  They are very delicious and made from corn flour stuffed with meat, potatoes, rice, peas and condiments.  It is a profitable business.

This is the 9th loan she’s asked for at ODEF.  The one she’s asked for on this occasion is to buy ingredients to make nacatamales like corn flour, meat, vegetables and condiments.

Her business has grown.  She started selling soft-drinks and now she is very well-known in her community because of the delicious nacatamales she sells.  Her dream is to set up a second sales point.

loans.use: to buy corn flour, rice, meat, potatoes, condiments and peas to make nacatamales to sell.

loans.name: Punto Clave - 26 Group

texts.es: El banco Punto Clave- 26 esta conformado por un grupo de nueve personas que  viven en su mayoría en la zona de Alto San Pedro y se dedican al comercio minorista y otras actividades laborales,  la presidenta es la señora Dabne que realiza artesanías en goma Eva y otros materiales  a pedidos y venta a las tiendas de cotillones, es una persona muy hábil y talentosa para realizar este tipo de trabajos, ya que por el trabajo de muy buena calidad recibe muchos pedidos, con el dinero del crédito comprara material para la realización de cotillones de goma Eva y también trabajos que tiene que entregar estas fechas, La Sra. Dabne es una persona joven con ganas de superación que con desea con poder crecer en su actividad y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The Punto Clave–26 communal bank is comprised of a group of nine people.  Most of them live in the Alto San Pedro zone and devote themselves to small businesses or other work activities.  

Dabne is the president.  She makes handicrafts using “goma Eva” (foam) and other materials.  She takes orders, and she sells in party stores. 

She is a skillful and talented person in making this type of work.  Because her work is of a very good quality she receives a lot of orders.

She will use the loan to buy materials to make foam souvenirs.  She also has work that she needs to deliver around this time.

Dabne is a young person with the desire to improve herself and the wish to be able to grow in her business activity.  This is the way to improve her income in order to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy materials to make foam souvenirs.

loans.name: Maria Noelia

texts.es:
Maria Noelia a sus 49 años de edad busca sacar adelante a su único hijo de 8 años, el cual es la luz de sus ojos!

Ella comenzó elaborando tejidos a mano, y luego, buscando un mejor futuro para ella y su pequeño se lanzo a comercializarlos desde su propio almacén, el cual se encuentra ubicado en un pequeño local del centro comercial La Fe en el Retiro – Antioquia desde hace ya 7 años.

Buscando diversificar su oferta a los clientes, y tener ingresos más constantes, comenzó a comercializar en su punto de venta artesanías también, lo cual poco a poco fue atrayendo nuevo público.

Con el crédito ella quiere comprar nuevo surtido para su almacén y algunos otros insumos, ya que sabe que en esta época del año llegan algunos turistas a la región que se ven interesados en llevarse algún recuerdito de su paseo.

Ella sueña con tener un almacén cada vez más grande y con surtido más diverso que le permita interesar a todo aquel que pase por el frente de su local.
texts.en:
Maria Noelia is 49 years old and is looking to provide for her only son who is 8 years old, and who is the light of her eyes!

She began making handmade weavings, and later, searching for a better future for herself and her little one, she launched into business with her own clothing shop, which can be found in a little place in the commercial center La Fe en el Retiro, in Antioquia, and she has been there 7 years.

Wanting to diversify her inventory for her clients, and have more steady income, she began selling handicrafts as well, which little by little have been attracting new customers.

With the money from this loan she wants to buy new inventory for her store and some other supplies, as she knows that at this time of the year the tourists visit the region and they are interested in taking back some little souvenir of their trip.

She dreams of having a store that continues to grow and have a more diverse selection that will interest everyone that passes in front of her store.

loans.use: to buy inventory and supplies for her clothing and handicraft store

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Hello, lenders. Meet Esther who is a 55-year-old sweet mother of four. She is very smiley, charismatic, and tender.
Esther is a farmer from the remote village of Gicici, situated in the Central province of Kenya. The living conditions in this area are tough because there is neither clean water nor electrical connections. 

For 10 years, her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs and horticultural produce. Esther’s biggest challenges are disease and a shortage of farm inputs. Farmers in the area lack capital to purchase farm inputs such as chemicals to prevent these diseases. Esther made the decision to join Juhudi Kilimo in order to access loans that would help her improve her farming activities. She is kindly seeking a loan to buy seeds and expand her horticulture farm. 

The additional income from the expansion will go to Esther’s children's education. The cost of education in Gicici is becoming high for smallholder farmers. With your loan, Esther’s children will acquire a quality education that will act as a strong foundation for a bright future.

loans.use: to buy seeds and expand her horticulture farm.

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en:
Cornelia is 73 years old, married with ten children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Cornelia has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Cornelia requested a PHP 22,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more sea foods to sell in her food stall.

Cornelia has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Cornelia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sea foods to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Komi Mawuko

texts.en:
Mr. Komi Mawuko A. was born in 1947 in Kuoma-Adamé (Kloto prefecture). He attended school until the end of middle school but could not continue his studies because of a lack of financial means. After training to be a mechanic, he could not work as one due to a lack of funds to set up a business. He thus began to work in agriculture and runs a farm in Djaglé. His business consists of growing cassava and turning it into \"Gari\" flour and tapioca, which he is easily able to sell at the market. He employs seven workers and sharecroppers.

To meet the growth and development needs of his business, Mawuko is requesting a loan of $1200, which will allow him to increase his production capacity and to buy a machine to scrape cassava. This will allow him to increase production and to meet his customers\' demand. This project deserves to be supported now.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur A. Komi Mawuko est né en 1947 à Kouma-Adamé (P/Kloto). Il a suivi un cursus scolaire jusqu’à l’obtention du brevet et faute de moyens financiers, il n’a pas pu continuer ses études. Après sa formation en mécanique qu’il n’a pu exercer par manque de moyens pour s’installer, il s’est alors lancé dans l’exploitation agricole et gère une ferme agricole à Djaglé. Cette exploitation consiste à la culture du manioc et à sa transformation en farine « Gari » et en tapioca qu’il arrive à écouler facilement sur le marché. Il a à sa charge sept (07) ouvriers et métayers.

Pour les besoins de développement et de croissance de ses activités, Mawuko sollicite un crédit de $1200 qui servira à augmenter sa capacité de production et à acquérir une râpeuse. Ce qui lui permettra d’accroître le rendement de ses activités afin de satisfaire la demande sa clientèle. A l’heure actuelle, ce projet mérite d’être soutenu.

loans.use: Buying a machine to scrape cassava and food processing activities

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Client History: Monica works weaving sweaters, ponchos and jackets for men and women. Her workshop and home are located on Ismael Zeballos Street in the Vivienda Obrera (Worker's Housing) Zone of La Paz. She is 27 years old and has been self-employed for 4 years. She is single and does not have children.

She has 2 employees who work for her out of their own homes. She sends the sweaters to them so that they can finish the sewing and add decoration.

Monica has been an Impro client since 03/03/05. Her case history in our institution classifies her as "Client 1", that is to say, with excellent fulfillment of the payment of her loan. The loan for which she is applying will be used to buy a weaving machine and wool.

Her work and her previous credit history with Impro allow her access to this loan, since she has experience in her business and the capacity to repay the loan with her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Historia del Cliente: La cliente se dedica al tejido de chompas, ponchos y sacones de varon y mujer. Su taller y domicilio estan ubicados en calle Ismael Zeballos Zona Vivienda Obrera. Tiene 27 años trabaja por cuenta propia hace 4 años es soltera y no tiene hijos.

La cliente tiene dos empleadas a domicilio es decir que les envía las chompas a su domicilio para que ellas puedan terminarlo en la costura y demás adornos.

Es cliente de Impro desde el 03/03/05. Su historial en nuestra institución la califica como cliente 1, es decir con cumplimiento excelente en el pago de su obligación, el monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de una maquina de tejer y la compra de lana.

Su trabajo, antecedentes crediticios con Impro le permiten acceder a este crèdityo, ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio y la capacidad de fuente de repago.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Shohista

texts.en: Shohista A. has been trading for seven years. In the beginning, she started her business with selling candies, and then she added dried fruit.  She works with her sister, and they have two big tables. When one of them goes to get more goods, the other works for both. Now their main target is to cover their working place with glass. It would be easer to work in the winter and keep their goods. Shohista has 3 children, and as her husband is in Russia now, she has to take care of her children herself.  Another of her plans is to purchase an auto sewing machine for her eldest daughter, who would like to be a sewer.

loans.use: Activity extension

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
"I have an unfinished construction project that I would like to finish so that I can make my house bigger and more comfortable for my family, something that's needed because space is becoming more and more limited." I'm asking for $1,000 to finish the construction.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

“Tengo una construcción sin terminar y me gustaría terminarla, así como poner el piso, esto hará más amplia mi casa y más cómoda para mi familia ya que el espacio es cada vez más reducido”. Solicito $ 1.000.00 dlls para terminar la construcción y poner el piso.

loans.use: Finish house construction.

loans.name: Esther Friday

texts.en:
"I learnt the act of farming from my late father and started mine in the year 1983," says Mrs. Esther Friday I.. She hails from Ubiaja of Edo State, Nigeria.

Esther Friday has a farm where she cultivates yams, cassavas, plantains and fruits. After harvest, she takes her produce to the market to sell. She is 38 years old and a mother, married, with 7 children.

Esther Friday is requesting a loan of $550 to boost her farming business.

loans.use: To buy more seeds for planting

loans.name: Martina Durán

texts.en:
Martina is 63 years old and has a grown-up son.  She has been widow for more than 10 years. Her son has graduated from the university and has his own family. 
In spite of her advanced age, Martina wants to be an active businesswoman.  Six months ago, she got from our organization a loan to purchase goods in order to supply her business activity.  The entrepreneur sells clothes and fabrics, curtains, sheets, beds and tablecloths. 
Martina wants to have a local shop where to sell the goods.  Now, every day she has to go to the public place to operate the business.  She has applied for a second loan, which she will use to rent a small local store and a showcase for some of the products.
The entrepreneur thinks that obtaining the funds will be a huge opportunity for her change the way she’s doing business, and that she will get more clients.

loans.use: Part of the funds will be spent to rent a small local store where the entrepreneur can sell the clothes.  Also to buy a showcase to put the goods.

loans.name: Corina

texts.es:
Corina is a hardworking, separated single mother. Since she took responsibility of her five underage children on her own, necessity has led her to face a tougher world. She has tried different activities to make a living and offer security and education to her little children. She presently delivers meals to local merchants at the San José market of her hometown Juliaca. Thanks to her popularity and delicious food, she has gained numerous clients. The good results she has achieved in this activity motivate her to better herself and ensure the well-being of her children, keeping alive the hope of one day having her own country house, where she would be able to offer a variety of tasty dishes and delight her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Corina es madre separada y muy laboriosa. Desde que se hizo cargo sola de sus cinco hijos menores, la necesidad y su familia, la llevaron a enfrentarse a un mundo más duro. Desde entonces buscó desarrollar diferentes actividades para ganarse la vida y así ofrecerles seguridad y educación a sus pequeños retoños. Actualmente se dedica a repartir almuerzos en viandas a los comerciantes del mercado San José de su ciudad natal, Juliaca, oficio que gracias a su popularidad y deliciosos potajes va obteniendo muchísimos comensales. Este trabajo que desempeña le va generando buenos resultados, hecho que la motiva mucho más a salir adelante y tratar de ofrecer bienestar a sus hijos, sin perder las esperanzas de algún día poseer su propia quinta, lugar donde pueda ofrecer variedad de platos y así deleitar con sus deliciosos potajes a sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase of consumables to prepare her delicious meals.

loans.name: Masanafu (Ii) Group

texts.en:
Sylvia is a single mother of two children. She owns a retail shop. With the extra profits she intends to build rental houses.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more goods for resale in her shop

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
Señora Ana Julia is 37 years of age, lives with her life companion and has 4 children, all of which go to grade and secondary school. She lives in the Villa Reconciliación settlement, a marginalized, very poor, rural neighborhood. The dwellings of the settlers are built of zinc, plastic and/or wood. The area does not have a sewer system. There is a shortage of water and the streets are not paved. The housing conditions of the lady are very humble. She has many limitations due to the fact that she can not rely on having the necessary resources to improve the infrastructure of her dwelling.

Ana Julia’s life companion works in the duty-free zone of operative. The pay that he receives is very little and does not cover even half of the basic food needs of the children. Being in this difficult situation, the lady has decided to rent rooms at low prices to people from other areas, with the objective of having a monthly income and in this way she can meet all the family expenses. With this activity the lady assures that her children will have food. This is how her family will subsist and move forward, despite the difficult economic situation in the country. At this time Ana Julia needs a loan to improve the condition of the rooms that she rents. She wants to refinish the walls, to cover certain holes that they have and to paint them, to give a better appearance to the rooms so that she can come to receive a better income from them.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Ana Julia tiene 37 años de edad, vive con su compañero de vida, tiene 4 hijos, los cuales todos se encuentran estudiando en primaria y secundaria, habita en el asentamiento Villa Reconciliación, un barrio rural, muy pobre, marginado, las viviendas de los pobladores son construidas de zinc, plástico y/o madera, no tiene alcantarillado, existe escasez de agua, las calles no están pavimentadas. Las condiciones habitacionales de la señora es muy humilde, tienen muchas limitaciones debido a que no cuenta con los recursos necesarios para mejor la infraestructura de la vivienda.

El compañero de vida de la señora trabaja en la zona franca de operario, el pago que obtiene es muy bajo y alcanza a cubrir ni la mitad de la canasta básica de los alimentos de los niños, viéndose en esta difícil situación, la señora decide alquilar cuartos a personas ajenas a la localidad a precios bajos, con el objetivo de tener ingresos fijos mensualmente y de esta manera pueda asumir todos los gastos familiares. Con esta actividad la señora asegura la alimentación de sus hijos, es así como esta familia subsiste y sale adelante, pese a la dura situación económica en la que se encuentra el país. En estos momentos la señora requiere un préstamo para acondicionar mejor los cuartos que alquila, desea darle un fino a las paredes, tapar ciertos agujeros que poseen y pintarlos, para darle una mejor presentación a los cuartos y pueda llegar a tener una mejor renta de los mismos.

loans.use: To buy blocks, zinc, cement and iron to improve the condition of rooms for rent.

loans.name: Lwaba East F Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Fida N.. She is currently in the business of clothing sales and is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes. Fida is 48 years old and is divorced. She has 7 children ranging from age 11 to 23 and her children go to school. Each week, Fida makes approximately UGX 10000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to re-invest in her business.

Fida is joined in her small group by Joy Nampande, Hanifah A., Mariam K., and Eseza K.. Joy Nampande has a business in poultry keeping and wants to buy chicken feed. Hanifah A. is currently operating a business in poultry keeping and wants a loan to buy more chicks. Mariam K. operates a business selling bread and wants to add to her business. Eseza K. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes and is requesting a loan to uplift business.

loans.use: To increase clothes purchases and boost business

loans.name: Natty

texts.es:
Natty’s greatest wish is to become a successful professional so that her beloved parents can be proud of her. With this goal in mind, she works hard daily and tries to do her best in all of the activities in which she is involved. Natty is originally from the province of Macusani, but over 6 years ago, she moved to Juliaca, where she is obtaining her professional degree thanks to her dear parents’ support. A few years ago, after much discussion, they decided to open a mini market, which helps them meet their most urgent needs and pay for her studies. Upon seeing the demand and the ever-rising cost of basic foodstuff, they would like to increase their stock. They believe that with this investment, they will be able to increase their earnings and keep the prices down for better customer satisfaction. Your indispensable contribution will permit Natty’s plans to materialize.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El deseo más gran de Natty es convertirse en una exitosa profesional para que sus queridos padres se sientan orgullosos de ella, con este objetivo en mente se esfuerza a diario y trata de dar lo mejor de sí en cada una de las actividades que desarrolla.Natty es natural de la provincia de Macusani pero hace más de 6 años radica en la ciudad de Juliaca, lugar en el que estudia una carrera profesional gracias al apoyo incondicional de sus queridos padres. Hace algunos años decidieron después de mucho diálogo abrir su bodeguita de abarrotes, tiendita con el que están logrando solventar sus necesidades más urgentes y su educación, ahora viendo la demanda y el elevado costo que día a día van adquiriendo los productos de primera necesidad desean aumentar el stock de su mercadería, consideran que haciendo esta inversión lograrán mejorar sus ingresos económicos y mantener los precios para mayor comodidad de sus clientes.“Tu indispensable aporte permitirá concretar los planes de Natty”

loans.use: Increase capital to offer a greater quantity of basic foodstuff

loans.name: Santa Cecilia

texts.en:
Santa Cecilia is forty years old and the proud mother of a five-year-old boy. Santa Cecilia is a multifaceted and experienced entrepreneur. She sells women’s clothing and operates a beauty parlor in the Hato Nuevo community of San Cristobal, where she cuts, dyes, and straightens hair, and gives manicures and pedicures.

The entrepreneur plans on using her loan to buy a new armchair with a manicure basin. She’ll also buy some nail brushes and manicure products.

Santa Cecilia explains that her big dream is to open a primary school for the children of her community. She has a degree in Primary Education and would like to help low-income families by giving their children a chance to attend primary school.

loans.use: To buy a chair and manicure products for a beauty parlor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy printed T-shirts for students at her school.

loans.name: Martha Amalia

texts.es:
Martha is always thinking about the well-being of her family. She has 3 kids but only one still lives with her, the other two are independent. Her husband is a salesman and they both are in charge of supporting their family. Martha has been working hard in a small grocery store that she has in her home for 3 years.

The credit she asked for is to build a wall for her house so that it will be more secure as in the neighbourhood Villa Reconciliacion where she lives there are a lot of delinquents.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Martha está siempre pensando en el bienestar de su familia. Tiene tres hijos, pero sólo a uno de ellos tiene a su cargo, sus otros dos hijos ya son independientes a ellas. Su esposo es comerciante y ambos se encargan de aportar para mantener a su familia. Doña Martha lleva tres años de duro trabajo en una pequeña pulpería que tiene en su hogar. El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de un muro lateral en su casa de habitación para así poder darle mayor seguridad a su casa, ya que el barrio de Villa Reconciliación donde habita tiene altos índices delincuenciales.

loans.use: To build a wall for their house/Construcción de un muro lateral en su casa de habitación

loans.name: Gloria Magdalena

texts.es:
Gloria Magdalena is 61 years old, married, completed grade school but couldn’t complete high school because she didn’t have the support of her dad, she has 3 sons and all of them are currently working. She started her business 35 years ago with the little savings she had. She sold Mondongo (local soup) in a spot at the San Pedro de Lloc market. She saved all her earnings until she had enough to buy and sell small groceries and liquor from her house in the San Pedro de Lloc district, at the Pacasmayo province, in the Libertad area.

She has been a member of the Banco Comunal “LIBERTAD” for four years and with her first loan of 300 PEN she purchased noodles, rice, sugar, stew, etc.

With the loan for 1000 PEN, which she will pay back in six months, she plans to purchase rice, sugar and oil, do to the current high prices its better for her to buy in bulk to get better prices.

Currently her husband is sick, she is in charge of maintaining the household, she is reliable and a hard worker.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Jimenez, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Gloria Magdalena tiene 61 años, está casada, estudió primaria completa, no pudo continuar estudiando porque su papá no la apoyó, tiene 03 hijos, ellos actualmente están trabajando. Se inició en el negocio hace 35 años, con poco dinero que tenía ahorrado, vendiendo mondongo en un puesto del mercado de abastos de San Pedro de Lloc, lo que ganaba lo iba ahorrando y cuando tuvo algo más de dinero se dedicó a la venta de abarrotes y licor, en su casa en el Distrito de San Pedro de Lloc en la Provincia de Pacasmayo en el Departamento de La Libertad.

Hace 4 años pertenece al Banco Comunal “LIBERTAD” y con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 invirtió en la compra de tallarines, arroz, azúcar, menestras, etc.

Con el crédito de S/. 1000.00 que cancelará en un plazo de 06 meses comprará arroz, azúcar y aceite porque como los precios han subido últimamente le conviene comprar al por mayor para obtener mejores precios.

Actualmente su esposo se encuentra delicado de salud, la señora es la que se encarga de generar ingresos para poder subsistir, es responsable y luchadora.

loans.use:
Purchase products for her store.

Compra de diversos productos (abarrotes).

location.town: San Pedro de Lloc - La Libertad

loans.name: Paquita

texts.es:
La Señora Paquita, socia del Banco Comunal “LAS BRISAS”, vive en la región D. San Martín, provincia y distrito D. Bellavista. Se dedica a la venta D. pollos eviscerados, venD. en su propio domicilio, ubicado en el Jr. Ica 3er piso, lugar donD. acuden diariamente a comprar los clientes, los cuales son los vecinos D. su barrio y personas particulares.

Paquita se inició con la venta D. abarrotes, pero vio que no obtenía muchas ganancias por lo que deciD. cambiar a esta actividad, la cual si le resulta por que el pollo es una carne D. consumo diario. 

Con el préstamo D. S/. 1,000, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará pollos vivos para tenerlos en su casa y así abastecer a los clientes que requieren D. esta carne todos los días. Ella manifiesta que últimamente las ventas se han incrementado gracias a la amabilidad con la que atienD. a los clientes que se acercan a su negocio. 

Paquita, es una mujer trabajadora, carismática, tiene 68 años y muchas ganas D. seguir trabajando. Ella quiere continuar con esta actividad hasta que Dios lo decida y sus fuerzas lo permitan.
texts.en:
Paquita is a member of the communal bank called Las Brisas. She lives in San Martin, in the district of Bellavista and works selling chickens from her home. Each day her customers come to her house, many of them are neighbors or people whom she knows.

Paquita used to sell groceries and household items, but she saw that she didn't generate enough income. She decided to change her business and began selling chickens, as it is a meat that people consume daily. With the loan, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy more chickens to keep in the house so that she can meet her customers requests. Lately her sales have been growing thanks to her friendly service.

Paquita is a hardworking and charismatic woman. She is 68 years old and has a great desire to continue working. She would like to continue with her business as long as God is willing and she has the strength to do so.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE CHICKENS FOR HER BUSINESS

loans.name: Nuon

texts.en:
Nuon S., 36, is a widow living in Phnom Penh with her two children. She decorates handicrafts and typically makes US $3.00 a day. Her son helps her and works as mechanic for a Honda company. She learned how to decorate clothes using beads and other materials from her mother and has been doing that business since before she was married. Most housewives are in the same business and they learn from one another. It takes about 5-8 days to complete one dress and it is also expensive. People wear these decorated dresses during the P'chum Ben ceremony, Water Festival, Khmer New Year, or for weddings.

Because now the rate of inflation is out of control, this work alone is not enough to support her family. Nuon S. is asking a loan of US $1000 to set up a stand out of her home selling vegetables and fruits.

loans.use: To set up a stand out of her home selling vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Younos

texts.en:
Mr. Younos S. (pictured with his daughter and hammocks), 45, and his wife, Mrs. Aisas Tres, 43, live along National Road Number Six about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1985 and have four children: one son and three daughters. Their eldest daughter assists her mother in sewing hammocks to sell, while the rest study in the local school.

For ten years Younos has been selling cloth hammocks sewn by his wife and daughter. He is now requesting a loan of $700 to purchase additional cloth with which to make more hammocks.

loans.use: To purchase cloth to make hammocks to sell.

loans.name: Yanina

texts.es: Yanina tiene 29 años, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos. Desde hace más de 15 años se dedica al bordado, todo comenzó por curiosidad y le terminó gustando realizar este arte, el que aplica más en los trajes típicos de su zona, elabora bellos bordados, teniendo un buen criterio en el uso de los colores. Por la calidad de los trabajos que ofrece, ha adquirido más clientela, que siempre la recomiendan. Su negocio, es para ella, su pequeña empresa, inclusive tiene tarjeta de presentación para adquirir nuevos clientes. Yanina tiene ahora mayores expectativas para ser mejor. Es la segunda vez que solicita un préstamo en MFP, reconoce que el préstamo que recibe le sirve mucho en su trabajo, y por la puntualidad en sus pagos ha sido aceptada para renovar un ciclo más de préstamo. Yanina solicita este dinero para comprar hilos de variados colores, los más costosos suelen ser el dorado y el plateado.
texts.en:
Yanina is 29 years old and lives with her husband and two children. For more than 15 years she has worked doing embroidery. Everything began with curiosity and she ended up liking this art, which she applies on the typical clothing of the area, makes beautiful embroidery and has a good judgement in the use of the colors. Because of the quality of the work that she offers, she has acquired more clientele as they always recommend her. Her business is for her a small enterprise and she even has a business card to acquire new clients. Yanina now has greater expectations to improve. It is the second time that she is applying for a loan in MFP. She recognizes that the loan that she receives will help her very much in her work and due to the punctuality of her payments she has been accepted to renew another loan cycle. Yanina is requesting this money to buy thread of various colors, the most expensive ones are usually gold and silver.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase thread of different types and colors

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
La Señora Josefa P. tiene la edad de 57 años su estado civil es soltera, Doña Josefa tiene 7 hijos de los cuales solo 2 de sus hijos dependen de ella que tienen las siguientes edades un niño de 11 años de edad y cursa recientemente el 3 grado de primaria y su otra hijo de 14 años que cursa 1 año de secundaria, sus propósitos son de aumentar en su negocio para que este progrese y se mantenga de forma activa ya que este su mayor ingreso que tiene hasta los momentos, sus deseos son de instalar un negocio lugar estable ya que no posee las condiciones necesarias para instalarlo y se la hecho un poco mas difícil por tener que mantener 2 negocios como lo es la repostería y la venta de ropa que ha sido uno de sus mayores ingresos para su familia y para ella.


La actividad económica es la de repostería y mercadería en general por lo que vende los productos de: pantalones, camisas, ropa interior y camisas para dama, la ubicación de su negocio es en su casa de habitación, el tiempo que tiene de poseer el negocio es de 4 años, Doña Josefa inicia su negocio por su hija quien fue la responsable de enseñarle este negocio ya que su hija vivía en honduras y aprendió esta profesión  en este país y así Doña Josefa se instruye en este oficio y lo adquiere como su medio de trabajo por lo que y trata de balancear ambos negocios tanto la venta de ropa y el de repostería, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que necesita comprar mas ropa por la temporada festiva y mas ingredientes necesarios para la elaboración de sus productos como lo es harina, azúcar, huevo y leña y agradece tanto a Fundación León 2000 como a las organizaciones amigas que le ayudan a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Mrs. Josefa P. is 57 years old and single. She has 7 children, 2 of whom are still dependent upon her, and they are an 11 year old son who recently completed 3rd grade of primary school and another son age 14 who finished 1st year of secondary school. Her goals are to expand her business so that it grows and in this way she remains active as this has been her greatest income lately. Her wishes are to open a business in a stable locale as she doesn’t have the necessary conditions to open it. She has found it difficult to maintain 2 businesses, which are a bakery and selling clothing, which has been one of the greatest sources of income for her and her family. Her work involves the bakery and general merchandise, where she sells items such as pants, shirts, women’s underwear and shirts. It is located in her home, and she has had this business for 4 years. Josefa began this business because her daughter was the one who showed her this business as her daughter used to live in Honduras and learned this work in that country. So Josefa entered into this business and balances now both the bakery and clothing selling. The financing is for working capital so she can buy more clothing for the holiday season and more ingredients to make her products, such as flour, sugar, egg, and firewood. She thanks Fundación León 2000 and other supportive organizations that help her be successful.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to buy clothing and ingredients to make baked goods

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 46-year-old married man with four children, living in Katermaya in Mount Lebanon. When he was 15 he started working in a car paint shop until he opened his own in 1983. Ali has already received several micro-loans from Ameen to improve his shop. Today Ali wants to borrow $1,200 to buy new car paints, so he can diversify the choices he offers his customers.

loans.use: Buy new car paints

loans.name: Deri René

texts.es:
Deri se dedica a tejer colchas de lana desde hace quince años. Conocidos le piden unos ciertos productos y ella los produce en su casa por las tardes. Las mañanas las dedica al  mercado donde vende verduras en su propio puesto. Empezó con este negocio hace diez años. Además, desde el mismo tiempo, en los fines de semana cocina y vende tamales, solo en algunas oportunidades atiende cuando le hacen pedidos grandes.

Deri es casada, y conduce el negocio del mercado junto a su esposo. Tienen tres hijos pero ya son todos mayores de edad e independientes.

A sus cincuenta y dos años está planeando usar sus futuros ahorros para implementar una tienda en su casa donde podría vender productos variados, abarrotes, golosinas y productos para el hogar.
texts.en:
Deri has been dedicated to sewing wool blankets since she was 15 years old. Acquaintances request certain products and she makes them in her home in the evenings. During the day, she works in the market selling produce from her own stall. She began this business ten years ago. In addition, since the same time, on the weekends she cooks and sells tamales at some opportunities when large orders are made. Deri is married and she manages the business in the market with her husband. She has three children but they are all older and independent. At her fifty two years of age, she is planning to use her future savings to start a shop in her house where she would be able to sell various products: groceries, candy and products for the home.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Material for her sewing and ingredients for her tamales.

loans.name: Ouch

texts.en:
Ouch S., 65, is married and resides with her husband in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She runs a grocery store, making around US$ 5 per day, while her husband earns US$ 10 by working as a village chief. This couple has five children, four of whom are married and live separately, and one who is a high school teacher.

Ouch S. is asking for a loan to expand her grocery store by adding grocery items to meet her customers' demand. (Their oldest daughter is pictured because Mrs. Ouch and her husband were not available.)

loans.use: To expand her grocery store

loans.name: Arif

texts.en: Arif G. is a 36-year-old man who works in his own barber shop in a small city called Imishli. He is married and has two children. He started his career working in a general barber shop but after he gained experience in barbering and saved some money he was able to open his own small barber shop. Arif is a very polite man and a professional in his business. His barber shop is always full of people. Arif’s dream is to provide to his children a better education. He would like to expand his business and purchase modern barber tools for his shop. Arif and his family count on your help.

loans.use: To purchase modern barber tools

loans.name: Rey De Reyes 2 Group

texts.es: Las socias del banco comunal "Rey D. Reyes 2",  presentan  como nexo consanguíneo a la Sra. Maria Teresa y la Sra. Ana Gabriela son madre e hija. Las socias D. este banco tienen diferentes actividades algunas venden comida por las noches y son promotoras D. cosméticos, otros como la señora María se dedican a la confección D. prendas D. vestir, también algunas venden plantas y todo lo referente jardinería. Como en todo rubro comercial siempre existe la competencia D. la oferta y la demanda. Este crédito esta destinado para la variación D. productos y para invertir en lo que se refiere a cada uno D. sus rubros. Efectivamente las socias comentan que trabajan con  créditos D. otras instituciones financieras. Lo que respecta a la Fundación se encuentran en su 1er ciclo.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank "Rey D. Reyes 2" have chosen the mother-daughter team of Mrs. Maria Teresa and Mrs. Ana Gabriela as their representatives. The members each have different activities such as selling food in the evenings, selling cosmetics, sewing clothing (like Maria), as well as gardening-related items such as plants. As in all business there is competition through supply and demand. This loan is targeted to buy varied merchandise and to invest in each of the businesses. The members commented they have worked with loans from other financial institutions. This is their first loan with the Fundación Agrocapital.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in operations and merchandise

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina T. is 59 years old and lives in Katipunan,Guipos, Zamboanga Del Sur. Marina's husband works on the farm.  Her sari-sari store is still going, but her inventory is not enough to meet the demands of her customers. She has applied for a loan with the amount of PHP 5,000.00 (USD 125), payable in 6 months. This will be her 2nd cycle of project loan with Paglaum Coop. She will use the amount to purchase 4 cases of softdrinks, candies, noodles and other inventory.  Marina is determined to help her husband in providing for their daily needs with income generated from her sari-sari store.  She plans to have retirement savings and insurance benefits for their future.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Parda

texts.ru: Одинаев Парда в возрасте 37 лет, живет в районе Яван. Женат, имеет 1 сына. Парда более 5 лет занимается земледелием. Его сын помогает ему по земледелию. Клиент хочет взяь у нас кредит, чтобы купить минерали и посеить сельхозяйственную продукцию.
texts.en:
