Parda Odinaev lives in Yavan. He is 37 years old and is married with one son. For the past 5 years he has been an agricultural worker. His son helps him around. Parda would like to use the loan for the purchase of fertilizers and planting produce.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: fertilizers

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
With his desire to have a good quality of life, Richard tries and does his best in managing his computer shop business that provides his family, especially his parents, with their basic necessities. Richard is 28 years old and still single. He worked abroad for three years until he decided to come home and put up his own business.

However, due to lack of capital to maintain his business, Richard is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000. His dream is to become a successful businessman someday and to have a family of his own.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is 25 years old. She is married with no children yet. Oksana sells women's and men's clothing at an open-air market in Drogobych city. This market is located close to a bus station. This helps Oksana to serve many people who are traveling or making a connection.

Oksana has been in this business for 3 years. She is constantly increasing her gross income. Oksana is a very happy and full of energy. She would like to borrow 13,000 UAH to increase her inventory. She is committed to work hard to develop this business further.

loans.use: To increase the inventory of her clothing shop

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is 27 years old and has three children with her 30-year-old husband Alex. Josie's eldest child is eight years old, second is six years old and youngest is one year old. For her children, Josie dreams of having them experience a comfortable life and finish their studies until college.

When ASHI came to the municipality of Sibalom where Josie and her family live, she did not let the chance of a loan pass her by. She joined ASHI in 2008 and she availed her first loan then. She knew in her heart that her membership in ASHI was a step towards achieving her dream. Therefore, loans she received from then on were used to put up an initial business that generated her own income. This helped her husband who is a tricycle driver (motorcycle with a sidecar attached to it. Most common means of transportation of people all over town.)  

Now Josie applied for another loan intended for her vision of having a backyard poultry (raising of chicken) and hog (pig) raising business. Chickens will be raised up to 45 days and will be sold thereafter while hogs will be raised up to four months and will be sold thereafter. Josie realized having this kind of business could maximize her time while she attends to her previous business, a variety store, and to her children. While at home, she believes she can make money that will change their lives.

loans.use: To buy piglets, chicks, and feed.

loans.name: Julia Angelica

texts.en:
Julia is 29 years old, married, and has two children with whom she is pictured here. Julia lives in the city of Pucallpa and her husband works as a bricklayer. Julia has a small business selling foods typical of the region from the front porch of her house in the evenings.

Julia has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for about 1.5 years and is a member of the communal bank "Las Guerreras" (The Warriors). Julia used her first loan of 300 soles (about $100) to invest in basic food items with which to prepare her meals. She plans to use this loan of 1000 soles for the same purpose. Julia runs her business independently and hopes that this loan will help her to continue to grow, little by little.

Julia is pleased with the financial assistance she has received from Manuela Ramos. She also enjoys the educational sessions given by Manuela Ramos loan officers at the monthly meetings of her communal bank. With the assistance of her loans and the profits from her business, Julia purchased a piece of land and is constructing her home there.

loans.use: Basic food items for a restaurant business.

loans.name: Agripina

texts.es: Agripina tiene 59 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos, a quienes trata de brindar las condiciones necesarias dentro y fuera de casa. Su actividad como vendedora de comida la viene realizando desde hace 12 años, tiempo en que ha trabajado en diversos centros comerciales ofreciendo sus deliciosos aperitivos. Sin embargo, el tiempo fue menguando su resistencia y tuvo que aminorar las horas de ventas; por lo que actualmente con el apoyo de su hija puede seguir trabajando. Por tal motivo, vende sólo en las tardes en los paraderos de los carros de transporte de pasajeros, donde hay una favorable concurrencia de personas, quienes ya se convirtieron en su fiel clientela y esperan a doña Agripina para degustar sus deliciosas bebidas calientes acompañadas de diversos sándwich que prepara al instante. Por otro lado, con las ganancias obtenidas tiene que hacer un pago a la municipalidad de su localidad por la utilización del espacio. Para un futuro cercano, Agripina espera adquirir un carrito de comida más cómodo y amplio, con el que pueda atender a mayor cantidad de personas para incrementar sus ingresos. Este es su 8vo préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA, sus anteriores créditos le permitieron mejorar su calidad de vida; sobre todo, su capacidad de organización, ya que dentro de su banco comunal -el compromiso- es uno de los valores más importantes que fomentan. Los 2000 soles que ahora solicita están designados para la compra de utensilios que requiere para la preparación de los alimentos que vende. Con otra parte, también invertirá en un coche nuevo de comida para ampliar y mejorar su espacio de venta.
texts.en:
Agripina is 59 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children. She tries to provide a good home for her family. For the past 12 years, she has worked as a food vendor in the various commercial centers offering her tasty snacks. Lately, her stamina has been waning and she has been forced to reduce her work schedule. Agripina currently has the assistance of her daughter to help her continue working.

She only works in the afternoons in the midst of all the traffic. Around this time, she encounters all type of people who eventually become her loyal customers. They can’t wait to try one of Doña Agripina’s delicious beverages along with one of the many different sandwiches that she prepares instantly. From her earnings, she has to pay the local municipality for the use of her vending space. In the near future, Agripina hopes to acquire a large food cart that will be more comfortable for her to handle. This will allow her to serve more people and increase her revenue.

She is requesting her 8th loan from Microfinanzas PRISMA. Her previous loans have enabled her to improve her quality of live and her capacity for organization, which is the second most important value stressed by her Communal Bank (next to commitment). Agripina will use her loan of 2000 soles to buy utensils needed to make the food that she sells. She will also purchase her desired food cart so that she can expand and improve her space.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase utensils & a new food cart

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
La señora Virginia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manuela de Hoy II”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Camicachi de el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 31 años de edad, estado civil conviviente y es madre de 04 hijos y tiene estudios de primaria completa, vive en la comunidad de V. Chile.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 02 años,  con un préstamo inicial de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles  para la compra de ganado menor. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 2000.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de ganado mayor, para engorde.

Su mayor sueño es poder educar a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan las facilidades en los préstamos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Virginia belongs to the Communal Bank “Manuela de Hoy II” which is located in the community of Camicachi in the Llave district, El Collao province, department of Puno. She is 31 years old, lives with her partner and is the mother of four children. She has elementary school education and lives in the community of V. Chile. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement (micro-finance institution) for two years. Her first loan of 500 nuevos soles was used as capital to purchase small livestock. She is now requesting an additional loan of 2,000 nuevos soles to invest in the purchase of large livestock. Her greatest wish is to give her children an education. She enjoys the convenience of the loans.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase large livestock.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
32-year-old Jennifer C. has three children ages two, six, and seven years old. Her husband is a tri- bike (bicycle with sidecar attached to its body) driver and has been a great partner of her not as a husband and father to her children but in the business as well.

When Jennifer joined ASHI in 2004, she had an opportunity to request for a loan. From then and there, she was able to start having a tri- bike for public transport business managed by her husband.  Eventually, she had purchase three tri-bikes and her business had generated employment. Aside from her husband, Jennifer employed two more drivers for her business. 

Entering the villages of the municipality of Hamtic where Jennifer and her family live, tri- bike is the most common means of transportation for short distances. This kind of business has been a great provider of income to Jennifer and the rest of her employees. 

With the loan Jennifer is requesting now, she wanted to put up a business to be run by her while looking after the needs of her family at home. In their wide verdant plane sloped backyard, she wished to build a pig pen for a hog fattening business and purchase a cattle for her cattle fattening business. With these kind of business, profit is as much double the amount of its capital after a period of time fattening hogs (pigs) and cattle.

loans.use: Will be used as an additional capital for a hog and cattle fattening business.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy P. is from the village of Malibangcao Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old and married with 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Daisy owns and operates a specialized maize retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling corn in the local community. Daisy has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Daisy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Daisy is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Daisy from GDMPC and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her maize sales business

loans.name: Timotea

texts.es:
La socia Timotea; pertenece al banco comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS”; UBICADOS EN EL DISTRITO DE Andahuaylillas a 5 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 29 años de edad la socia vive con su novio y el es agricultor, ellos tienes 4 hijos, nuestra socia alterna sus actividades con el comercio minorista, ella vende comidas en el distrito de Urcos, ella elabora sus diferentes platos de comidas rápidas y los lleva hasta el distrito de Urcos que esta situado de Andahuaylillas a Urcos a unos 20 minutos, ella se instala allá en el paradero porque de este punto salen diferentes carros, buses y empresas terrestres a Puno, Arequipa, la selva de Perú, y todos paran aquí obligadamente, lo que a ella le permite vender sus platos. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para poder comprar o alquilar un puesto de venta aquí en Urcos y así no tener que llevar todos los días sus ollas y sillas hasta Urcos.

Nuestra socia se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido y agradece infinitamente esta ayuda.
texts.en:
Timotea belongs to the Las Triunfadoras Communal Bank, which is located in the Andahuaylillas district five minutes from the city of Cusco. She is 29, and she lives with her fiancé who is a farmer. They have four children. She alternates her small business activities. She sells food in the Urcos district. She makes different fast food dishes. She takes them to the Urcos district, which is located 20 minutes from Andahuaylillas. She sets up at the station there because it is the point where different cars, buses, and trains depart for Puno, Arequipa, and the Peruvian jungle. They all must stop there, which allows her to sell her dishes. She is asking for a loan to be able to buy or rent a place to sell here in Urcos. That way she will not have to take her pots and chairs with her to Urcos everyday.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy or rent a place to sell so that she can leave her cooking utensils there

loans.name: Mwanahamis

texts.en:
Mwanahamis B. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur. She is a married woman with four school-aged children of whom three are in secondary school and one is in primary school.

Mwanahamis runs two groceries at Tabata community in Dar es Salaam. She sells a variety of both soft and alcoholic drinks. She has been in the business for six years and, with her business income, she has managed to pay school fees, meet daily family demands and also capitalize the business.

Mwanahamis finished repaying 1,200,000 Tshs and she is requesting a new loan of Tshs 1,400,000 to boost her business.

loans.use: To use for business expansion

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 39 años, vive con su esposo, quien se dedica al transporte de pasajeros, y con sus 2 hijos que están estudiando.
Desde hace un año se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y ropa, los mismos que lleva a repartir a sus clientes en el motocarro de su esposo. Adicionalmente, hace 4 años Rosa tiene una pequeña tienda de comestibles y bebidas en su vivienda, donde cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos  para la atención mientras ella está repartiendo los productos de belleza. 
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es estar en contacto con las personas, con quienes comparte conversaciones muy amenas y hace muchas amistades; además le muy rentable porque trabaja para una marca cosmética muy reconocida y sus clientes no dudan en requerir de estos productos. 
Su deseo a futuro es convertir su bodega en un minimarket.

Este es su 8vo crédito con MFP, ella es parte de un banco comunal, está muy acostumbrada a sus compañeros, a quienes aprecia mucho porque trabajar unidos y son bien organizados. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más productos de belleza y ropa, también incrementará los productos que vende en su tienda.
texts.en:
Rosa, 39, lives with her husband, who is a public transport driver, and their two children, who are students. For the past year she has sold clothing and beauty products which she takes to her customers in her husband's motor vehicle. Also, for the past 4 years, Rosa has had a small grocery store in her home where she sells food items and beverages; her children help her tend to the customers at the store while she is out delivering her beauty products. What she most likes about her job is the contact she has with people with whom she has pleasant conversations and makes many friendships. Besides, it is profitable because she works for a very well-known cosmetics brand and her customers always require these products. Her wish for the future is to convert her small store into a minimart. This is her 8th loan with MFP. She is a member of a communal bank and very accustomed to her fellow members, who she likes very much because they work well together and are very well organized. With the financing requested now she will buy more beauty products and will increase her supply of items sold in her store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock inventory.

loans.name: Kehinde

texts.en:
Kehinde sells building materials and footballs. With this business, she hopes to meet the basic needs of her family. She is 47 years old and married with four children. They live in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. Kehinde is a very hardworking woman. She has been in her business for a long time. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more building materials to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

Kehinde is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more building materials to sell

loans.name: Sohibnazar

texts.en:
R. Sohibnazar is 41 years old. He has a successful business selling flour at the local market in Kabodien region. Sohibnazar sells an assortment of good quality flours. In the picture you can see Sohibnazar with his guarantor of the loan. Because he buys the flour at wholesale, the price is cheaper than the price of his competitors. Thus, he has many customers who even make a purchase of his flour straight from his house. Today he has a great demand for his goods and that is why he wants to take an individual loan. Sohibnazar has requested a loan of 13,000 Somoni to add to his working capital and allow him to purchase more inventory. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more flour to sell

loans.name: Victoria Natividad

texts.es:
Victoria P. de 37 años, vive en una casa de cemento con agua luz y alcantarillado su casa esta ubicada en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, su esposo trabaja como electricista con el tiene 2 hijos uno de ellos es un niño down tiene 7 años.

Victoria se dedicaba solo a estudiar y la solvencia de su familia era el sueldo de su esposo pero eran muchos gastos y opto por tener otro ingreso ya hace 4 años atrás  comenzó como vendedora Yanbal. Ahora Victoria trabaja por pedidos vendiendo perfumes, maquillajes, cremas etc. Una de las mayores dificultades es cuidar a su hijo down con las terapias.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar maquillajes, shampoo, cremas, perfumes para tener un poco más de variedad en sus productos. En el futuro quiere ser directora Yanbal y tener más ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Victoria P. is 37. She lives in a cement house with water, light, and a sewer system. It is located in the Perimetral area of Guayaquil. Her husband works as an electrician. She has two children. One child is seven and has Down’s. Victoria devoted herself solely to education, and her husband’s salary was for the family’s solvency. However, there were a lot of expenses, and she decided to have another income. Four years ago she started as a Yanbal salesperson. Now Victoria works by orders selling perfume, make-up, and creams, etc. One of the major difficulties she has is using the therapies to take care of her child with Down’s. She will use the loan to buy make-up, shampoo, cream, and perfume to have a little more variety in her products. In the future she would like to be a Yanbal manager and have more income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make-up, perfumes, and creams

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Construction of a room.

loans.name: God's Chosen Ones Group

texts.en: Jackson G. is the leader of this group of five borrowers called God’s Chosen Ones. He is 35 years old, single, and is a high school graduate. He has two children who are 5 and 7 years old and who are in 1st and 3rd grade. In addition to his children, Jackson also supports his sibling. In the photo, Jackson is the one holding the sign. For six years, Jackson has had a slippers business at the Waterside Market, which is the largest market in Monrovia. He says that he provides high quality service in a friendly manner, which attracts customers. Jackson plans to use his 14,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 56,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more slippers. His goals are to grow his business, to help his children go to school, and to empower other family members as well. About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating micro-finance institution with thirteen branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more slippers to sell

loans.name: Luis Armando

texts.es:
el señor Luis Armando O. P. tiene 51 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene dependientes,  vive con sus padres y se dedica al negocio de salon de belleza y cosmetologia, esta acividad la realiza desde hace 37 años y dice que le va muy bien con este negocio.
A podido ayudar a sus padres y sacar adelante a sus hermanos, esta solicitando el credito para la compra de tintes, cosmeticos y algunos accesorios que le faltan para su negocio.
 
el señor Luis el viaja todo los dias para su trabajo, comento que ese trabajo es su pasion que lo disfruta cuando lo realiza y que se siente bien consigo mismo, es una persona que no le gustan mucho las deudas, es honesto.
texts.en:
Luis Armando O. P. is 51 years old, single, lives with his parents, and does not have any dependents. For 37 years he has had a beauty salon and has done very well with this business. He has been able to help his parents and siblings get ahead. He is asking for a loan to purchase hair dye, make-up, and other items needed for his business. Luis works every day at his job. But, he says that it is his passion and he truly enjoys it and it makes him feel good about himself. He is an honest person who does not like to have debts.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of dyes and other items for beauty salon

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah is 47 years old, married, and has two children, both of whom are grown up and financially independent. His primary business is crop and animal farming, and he has been involved in this activity for the last 22 years. Jeremiah lives and works in Githunguri - an evergreen highland area in central Kenya that receives plenty of rainfall and is therefore particularly favorable for agriculture. Jeremiah's wife Lucy is also involved in business - she sells groceries. 

Jeremiah was introduced to KADET by another member of the organization, and this is his first loan with KADET, although he has already previously borrowed from the farmers society to which he sells milk. Jeremiah plans to use the current loan to purchase and install a water pump as well as buy a tank for water storage. Jeremiah hopes to be able to thereby increase his income to be able to improve the livings standards of his family.

loans.use: Purchase of a water pump and a tank for water storage

loans.name: C2350 Tuzamurane Group

texts.en:
Francine is 31 years old and is married with four children aged between 3 and 9. She also takes care of one dependent who is 17 years old. Francine’s husband is driver.

Francine is into tailoring as well as being group leader of this group called Tuzamurane, which contains six members. Francine uses her sewing machine and has been in this business for eight years. The hours of her business are from eight in the morning to eight in the evening, every day except Sunday.

Francine and her group are requesting a loan simply because they need to get ahead in their business through buying the new sewing machine. Most of them are tailors but one has a public phone business.

With this loan Francine and her group hope to obtain more profits which will allow them to change their family situations through providing everything they need.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Kimbene

texts.en:
Kimbene M. is thirty-five years old and married. He has three children to whom he hopes to give a good education. 

His business is located in Vok, a residential area in Mombasa, Kenya. Mombasa is the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many tourist attractions, not to mention the white beaches along the Indian Ocean. 

For the past six years, he has been selling fruit to the local people. He says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge is that fruit prices escalate sometimes, making the fruit very expensive. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. 

He is using his loan of Kes 40,000 to buy more fruit to expand his business. He hopes to be a wholesaler in the future. He is a very hard-working man.

loans.use: To buy fruit to sell

loans.name: Regie

texts.en:
Regie J., from the village of Southwestern Poblacion, is 26 years old, married and has two infant-aged children. To make a living, Regie owns and operates a business venture selling household items (basic needs) in the local community. Engaged in her business for over five years, she earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Regie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC that was used as additional capital for her business, she is now requesting a new loan, her fourth, of 14,900 PHP to purchase additional stocks for the store.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks for the store

loans.name: Rosalía

texts.es:
Rosalía tiene 26 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a su madre en el distrito de Mochumí, un distrito ubicado en la provincia de Lambayeque que tiene como actividades principales la agricultura y el comercio, sus pobladores son gente bastante trabajadora, se encuentra a cuarenta y cinco minutos de camino de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su domicilio desde hace seis años, ella compra sus productos en el mercado Moshoqueque (mercado mayorista) de la ciudad de Chiclayo. El negocio goza de muy buena acogida gracias a que siempre trata de brindar un buen trato a sus clientes y también porque prefiere ofrecerles productos de calidad.

Rosalía desea comprar mas mercadería para satisfacer la creciente demanda de sus clientes, además desea incursionar en el comercio de prendas de vestir, para lograr su meta ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Rosalía es una joven trabajadora y de trato amable, en la zona donde vive ella es muy querida y estimada por sus vecinos y conocidos. Su meta es seguir creciendo como empresaria para poder sacar adelante a su madre.
texts.en:
Rosalía is 26 years old. She is single and lives with her mother in the Mochumí district, located in the province of Lambayeque, which primarily relies on agriculture and business. Its population is made up of hard working people and is located 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For the past six years, Rosalía has been running a small shop out of her home, where she sells basic need items and groceries. She buys her products in the market in Moshoqueque (the main marketplace) in Chiclayo. The business does well, thanks to the good customer service she provides and because she prefers to offer only good quality merchandise. Rosalía wants to buy more items to satisfy her growing customer demands. She would also like to begin selling articles of clothing. In order to be able to reach her goal, she has requested this first loan of 1,000 PEN ($375) through Edpyme Alternativa. Rosalía is a hard working young woman with a wonderful personality and who is well liked and respected by her friends and neighbors. Her goal is to continue to grow as an entrepreneur in order to help her mother get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Saviour Group

texts.en:
Maron Z., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Saviour. She is 64 years old, married and has four children whose ages range from 18 to 38. She did not attend school due to poverty. She also cares for three siblings. 

For 15 years, she has been selling dried fish and meat at the ELWA Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She says customers are attracted to her business because she sells good dried fish and meat.

She plans to use her 8,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 40,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more dried fish and meat. She describes herself as a polite person. Her dream is to build a house and be able to assist other family members.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Anna is inset at the lower right because she was absent during the interview.

loans.use: To buy more dried fish and meat

loans.name: Melania

texts.es: La señora Melania es madre soltera, y tiene tres hijos los cuales están estudiando. La señora  se dedica a la venta y destace de cerdo, cabe señalarse este negocio lo empezó desde hace cuatro años, además que todos los viernes elabora nacatamales en su casa de habitación y vende al público en general. Ella desea este crédito con el objetivo de realizar compras cerdos debido a que actualmente tiene mucha demanda de este producto. Ella también entrega carnes a las pulperías cercanas, generalmente entrega a crédito y sale a cobrar en la semana. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio y mejorar su economía, que permita mejorar también la economía de sus hijos
texts.en:
Melania is a single mother, and she has three children who study. She sells and butchers pork. This business was started four years ago, and in addition every Friday she makes nacatamales [large Nicaraguan tamales] in her home and sells them to the general public. She is requesting this loan with the goal of buying pork, since there is currently a great demand for this product. She also delivers meat to the local grocery stores, normally offered on credit which she collects in the week. Her dream is to expand her business and to improve her economic situation, which will in turn allow her to improve the economic situation of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina, tiene 36 años, es viuda, tiene tres hijos y vive en la comunidad de Rumichaca de la ciudad de Urubamba.  Su principal actividad económica de Sabina es la venta de comida y también se dedica a la venta de verduras como ejemplo zanahorias, cebollas, maíz, papas, etc. Sabina participa en el banco comunal y le va muy bien porque es una persona responsable y puntual al momento de pagar sus cuotas, ella requiere el préstamo para comprar más productos como papas, verduras, arroz y azúcar.

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Sabina is a 36 year old widow with three children living in the Rumichaca area of the city of Urubamba. Her main source of income is from the sale of food: carrots, onions, corn, potatoes, etc. Sabina is a member of the community bank. She is responsible and punctual in paying her share. She needs a loan in order to buy more products such as potatoes, vegetables, rice and sugar. This member is grateful for the opportunity presented with this loan and agrees to comply with the payment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Susanna Sabahi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase more products such as potatoes, vegetables, rice, and sugar.

loans.name: Maria Charito

texts.en:
Maria Charito A. is from the village of Brgy.Lantap,Bagabag,Nueva Vizcaya. She is 47 years old. Maria Charito is married and has 3 young children. To make a living, Maria Charito owns & operates a specialized retail store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Maria Charito has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Maria Charito joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria Charito has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Maria Charito is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Maria Charito from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Stephen Ouma

texts.en: Stephen Ouma is a 27-year-old experienced furniture seller in Kibuye, a busy open air-market in the outskirts of Kisumu City. He is married to Lilian Ojwang, a housewife, and they have a five-month-old daughter. They live in Obunga estate, a low-income settlement in Kisumu. Ouma has been doing this business for the last three years and he has great plans to expand. He recently took out a loan from Kadet Ltd to buy more furniture for sale. His intention is to surpass his monthly income of Kshs 10,000 ($250). With the profits, he plans to pay his wife’s college fee because he wants to empower her through education. His dream is to continue working hard in his business to generate more income and improve his family’s living standards.

loans.use: To buy furniture for sale.

loans.name: Shirali

texts.en:
K. Shirali is a hardworking man who works in the cattle raising business. He is married with four children. He works hard to provide everything his family needs. Presently, Shirali is sacrificing and working hard to make his business grow.

He is requesting a loan that will allow him to purchase baby cows. He plans to feed and raise the cows. His goal is to then get the most return from the sale of the cows' milk products. This will be his first loan with IMON and Kiva. His evaluation shows he is qualified to receive the loan.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase young cattle

loans.name: Oyun

texts.en:
Oyun R., age 46, lives with her husband and three children in a Ger, traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her oldest daughter attends a university while her youngest son attends a secondary school. Her older son, Ganbaatar, works as a private businessman. Her husband runs a transportation business in his town to supplement his family's income. 

Oyun operates a fruit retail business at a stall in Narantuul, Ulaanbaatar's biggest market. Her business earnings have enabled her to improve her family's quality of living. She is a well organized and skillful businesswoman. She says, "I want to expand my business operation as well as provide a high level, good education to my children". Oyun is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to buy more fruit to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To buy more fruit.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catharine N., who is 16 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala West region of Uganda, is single and has no children. Catherine has had a poultry business for five years, and she also has a brick-laying enterprise.

In order to expand, Catherine has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to purchase chicken feed (maize brand) and more chicks. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Catherine hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and own land.

Catherine is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to get enough capital for the future.

loans.use: To purchase chicken feed (maize brand)

loans.name: Lena Nzasu

texts.en:
Lena Nzasu is a single mother; a business lady aged 25 years old. She operates a green grocer stall. She is blessed with two children aged six months and three years old. She has been operating a green grocer business for the past three and half years. Her current monthly income is Kshs. 3,800. She supports two family members. 

Lena has never borrowed from any other MFI; she is applying for her first loan with KADET LTD. She plans to purchase  beans, green grams (lentils), soya beans and millet. With the extra profit generated from her business she intends to purchase a piece of land and construct her own permanent premises. Her hopes and dreams are to grow from small entrepreneur to a wholesaler.

video.title: Kiva Entrepreneur Review Lena Nzasu from  Kenya

loans.use: To buy assorted cereals

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
La  señora sabina E. C. tiene 38 años D. edad y vive en una casa propia en la comunidad D. Tablada GranD. D. la ciudad D. Tarija. Sabina  es casada tiene 6 hijos con el señor Feliciano P. Moscoso. Sabina se dedica a la crianza y comercialización D. carne D. chancho, actividad que viene realizando desD. hace mas D. 5 años.                                                                                                             

Sabina quiere tener mejores ingresos para brindarle una mejor vida a su familia, pero ella nos cuenta que quiere comprar más chanchos, alimento y mejorar el corral D. sus animales. Es por eso que el crédito será destinado para la compra D. dichos elementos para, D. ese modo poder incrementar sus ingresos.                                                                                                         

Sabina  nos cuenta que quiere darle a sus hijos la comodidad que pueda, por eso nos dice que el próximo crédito que solicite será para mejorar las condiciones D. su casa donD. vive.
texts.en:
Señora Sabina E. C. is 38 years old and lives in her own house in the Community of Tablada GranD. of the City of Tarija.  Sabina is married and has 6 children with Señor Feliciano P. Moscoso.  Sabina is dedicated to the raising and selling of pork; an activity that she has been participating in for over 5 years.  

Sabina wants to improve her earnings in order to be able to proviD. her family with a better life.  However, she tells us that she wants to purchase more pigs, feed, and improve her barnyard.  As such, the credit would be used towards the purchase of the above-mentioned items with the intention of increasing her income. 

Sabina tells us that she would like to give her children all the commodities that she can afford.  For that reason, she tells us that her next loan would go towards the improvement of her house where she currently lives.

loans.use: Investment in operations capital.

loans.name: María Andrea

texts.es:
María Andrea es una madre de familia de 36 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a un hijo en el distrito de Oyotún, una zona agrícola situada a más de hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Se caracteriza principalmente por poseer una geografía accidentada debido a la cercanía con la sierra norte del país.

Trabaja vendiendo productos de belleza y cosméticos por catálogo, ella cuenta con un grupo de clientes que le compran sus productos con frecuencia, mientras más pedidos le realizan obtiene mas puntos de parte de la empresa que le provee los productos y por consiguiente obtiene mayores ganancias. Por este motivo se esfuerza por obtener cada vez más clientes.

María desea contar con un capital estable para adquirir mas productos y contar con un stock fijo de cosméticos que permita a sus clientes adquirir los productos que necesitan rápidamente y no esperar hasta fin de mes, que es cuando le entregan los pedidos. Por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

María es una mujer bastante entregada a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para brindarles una mejor calidad de vida en el futuro.
texts.en:
María Andrea is a 36-year-old mother living with her husband and child in the district of Oyotún, an agricultural area situated more than an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. This area is mainly characterized by its rugged landscape, due to the proximity of Peru's northern mountain range.

María Andrea sells beauty products and cosmetics from a  catalog. She has a group of regular customers who buy her products frequently. The more orders she gets, the more points she is awarded by the company that provides the products and consequently the bigger profit she makes. She therefore tries to continue attracting more customers.

María Andrea would like to have a stable capital in order to buy more products and have a fixed stock of cosmetics, thus allowing her customers to obtain the products they need quickly, without having to wait until the end of the month when the orders are fulfilled. She has therefore requested her first loan of 1,000 nuevos soles from Kiva Field Partner, Edpyme Alternativa.

María Andrea is devoted to her family. Her greatest wish is that she should continue to grow as an entrepreneur, so that she can provide her family with a better quality of life in the future.

loans.use: To buy cosmetic products to increase her sales.

loans.name: Eunice Del Milagro

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VAMOS JUNTOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Eunice; ella tiene 29 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de pinturas como acuarelas,temperas entre otros ella lo vende en forma ambulatoria y la vez ella apoya con los estudios a su hermano.
 
La  socia solicita el préstamo para los estudios de su hermano.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Eunice belongs to the “Vamos Juntos” (We Go Together) Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

Eunice is 29 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has two children.  She alternates her daily activities with the business of selling paints like water colors and tempura, among others.  She sells them in an itinerant manner.  At the same time she supports her brothers’ education.

She is requesting the loan for her brothers’ education.

She is grateful to those who are helping fulfill this dream, and she promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

loans.use: For her brother's education

loans.name: Baloon Group

texts.en:
Telesia D. is in her mid-thirties and is married with four children. She has been selling  doughnuts, fabrics, sarongs, and drinking water for one year. She sells her products door to door and works from 6:00 am to 7:00 pm daily. She is able to make good monthly profits.

This will be Teresia's first motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. A Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. She hopes to get a loan to pay her children's tuition fees, buy food for her family, make more doughnuts, and pack and sell 50-shilling bottles of drinking water to people who pass by near her house.

In the picture, Telesia is the lady standing first on the left.

loans.use: To pay tuition fees, to buy food, to make more doughnuts to sell, and to sell more water.

loans.name: Severiano

texts.es:
El Sr. Severiano C. tiene 33 años de edad, es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, soltero aún no tiene hijos.


   Se dedica como tejedor desde su infancia, pues, la profesión aprendió de su querida madre.
   Severiano comenta que los productos que realiza es de muy buena aceptación ya que lo realiza con mucho esmero y dedicación.

       Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya y a kiva por el apoyo crediticio que le brinda y promete cumplir con puntualidad con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en: Mr. Severiano C. is 33 and from the city of Carapegua. He is single and has no children. He has worked as a weaver since his childhood, a profession that he learned from his beloved mother. Severiano says that the products that he makes have had great success since he makes them with much care and dedication. He is grateful to the Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the support offered through this loan and he promises to repay his quotas punctually.

loans.use: the purchase of threads and dyes for thread

loans.name: Maridel

texts.en:
Maridel M. is from the village of Punta, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old, married and has 2 adult children. Maridel owns & operates a specialized retail store where she sells daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste. Maridel has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Maridel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Maridel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Juana Angelica

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” MUJERES UNIDAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Juana Angélica; ella tiene 34 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de ropa ,la socia viaja hasta la ciudad de Lima para poder comprar mercadería para luego venderlo a sus clientes que le solicitan como sus vecinos, amistades y familiares, 
la socia lleva un buen tiempo en este negocio y de esta forma saca a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más productos para su negocio y así poder tener más variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Mujeres Unidas communal bank located in Cusco district, Cusco province in Cusco district.

She is Juana Angélica, 34, and she lives with her common-law husband and they have two children..  The member alternates her daily activities with her business of buying and selling clothing.  She travels as far as Lima to buy merchandise so that she can then sell the requested items  to her customers, such as her neighbors, friends and relatives.  She has been in the business for a good while and this is the way she gets her family ahead. 

 Juana Angélica is requesting the loan to buy more products for her business and thus she will be able to offer a greater variety to her customers.

She is happy because of the loan and promises to make the payments in the established time period.

loans.use: She is requesting the loan to buy more products for her business and thus she will be able to offer a greater variety to her customers.

loans.name: Melvin Jose

texts.es: Melvin José tiene 42 años, su actividad es la crianza de pollos de engorde. Hace más de 2 años que tiene este negocio, ya que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado sacar adelante su actividad. Es un hombre muy responsable por lo que siempre está pensando en la forma de mejorar sus ingresos el disfruta de tener un medio de vida que le ha brindado lo necesario para mantener a su familia. El solicita este crédito para la compra de pollos, alimentos para ellos entre otras cosas necesarias.
texts.en: Melvin José is 42 years old. His activity is raising meat chickens. He has had this business for 2 years and with much effort he has managed to get his activity ahead. He is a very responsible man and is always thinking of ways to improve his income. He enjoys a lifestyle that has given him everything he needs to support his family. He is asking for this loan to buy chickens, feed for them and other necessary things.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Houssein

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 25 years old, married and has three children. In 2008, Houssein opened his own food market in an area where the competition is minimal. He is well known in his community and has an excellent reputation.

Houssein is requesting an $1800 loan to install an external ceiling, put up a sign at the entrance and buy a refrigerator. He is aiming to extend his business and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To install an external ceiling, put up a sign at the entrance and buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Lilit

texts.en:
Lilit H. is 32 years old. She lives in Lchashen village. Lilit is married and she has a 9-year-old son, who is in schooll. 

Lilit used to work as a geography teacher at Lchashen village school, and since 2006 she has worked in village administration as a secretary. Simultaneously with her permanent work, Lilit manages animal husbandry. She breeds cows, sheep, pigs and chickens as well. Her husband helps her a lot and that's how they support their family. 

Lilit intends to increase her farming livestock, so she is asking for a 1,000,000 AMD loan, which she will use to buy some calves or sheep (depending on their cost).

loans.use: To buy some calves or sheep

loans.name: 01. Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Phương T. Thị (01)is a 58-year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoa. Phương is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 01-Đông Vệ (08.01.01-Đông Vệ).

Phương is married and has 3 adult -aged children. She owns and operates a business providing general clothing services to local community members. Phương has been engaged in this business for over 7 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from it.

In 2010, Phương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Phương has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,253,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women, which was used to invest in renovating the business. She is now requesting a new loan of 6,159,600 VND which will be used to purchase cloth to resell. This will be the 2nd loan  Phương has taken out from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1.  Lê Thị Hương (02) is a 36-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her clothing business.

2.  N. Thị K. Thoa (03) is a 42-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her clothing business.

3.

loans.use: to purchase cloth to resell

loans.name: Lurgia

texts.es: Lurgia tiene 28 años, natural del distrito de Santa Rosa; convive con Osorio de 30 años de edad y tienen 03 hijos y cuentan con su propia casa situados en la comunidad de Pampa Miraflores anexo del distrito de Santa Rosa. Lurgia y su pareja son el sostén de su familia. Desde muy niña sus padres le inculcaron a trabajar en la chacra, ella es campesina y cuenta con 03 hectáreas de terreno cultivados con plantas de café, cacao, achiote y hojas de coca; plantas oriundas de la zona selvática del Valle Río Apurimac. Viene trabajando 06 años en sus propias tierras, y en tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de los jornaleros encargados en cosechar y desmontar la maleza. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar los frutos de las plantas; ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos. Considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta los centros de acopio ubicados en la ciudad de san francisco; lugar donde le ofrecen mejores precios por sus productos. Su dificultad es no poder contar con la maquina despulpadora de café que es de utilidad para descascarar los granos de café; es por ello que acude a la institución MFP para concederle el préstamo. En adelante, desea incrementar sus sembrios con plantas de café ya que cuenta con 02 hectáreas de terreno no cultivado. Este su octavo crédito con MFP, y espera poder pagarlo a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarles problemas a las compañeras de su banco comunal, en donde es muy respetada debido al orden que impone al grupo. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles solicitados, comprará una  maquina despulpadora  para descarar los granos del café.
texts.en:
Lurgia is 28 years old.  She is from Santa Rosa district and lives with her partner, 30 year-old Osorio.  They have three children and live in their own home which is located in Pampa Miraflores community, a small village in Santa Rosa district.  Lurgia and her partner support their family together.

Lurgia's parents taught her to work on the farm from a very young age.  She is a farmer and owns 3 hectares of land where she plants coffee, cacao, annatto and coca leaf.  These are all plants which are native to the rainforest area of the Apurimac River Valley.  Lurgia has been working her own land for 6 years and, during harvest time, she has the support of day laborers who harvest and weed her crops.  What Lurgia most enjoys about her work is harvesting the fruit from her plants since this is when she feels that the months of hard work are providing their reward in the quality of her fruit.  Lurgia considers the most difficult part of her work to be transporting her produce from her farm to the wholesale warehouses which are located in the town of San Francisco.  This is where they offer her the best prices for her products.

Lurgia's problem is that she doesn't have a coffee depulping machine which is very useful in shelling coffee beans.  This is why she is requesting a loan from MFP.  In the future, Lurgia would like to increase her crops by growing more coffee plants since she has 2 hectares of land which are not currently cultivated.  This is Lurgia's eighth loan from MFP and she hopes to be able to repay her loan on time since she doesn't want to make trouble for the other members of her community bank.  Lurgia is a well-liked member of her community bank because of the order that she brings to the group.

Lurgia will use the 1,000 Peruvian soles she is requesting to buy a depulping machine to shell her coffee beans.

loans.use: to buy a depulping machine

loans.name: Tayson Group

texts.es:
El grupo Tayson lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras. Una de ella es Cecilia Z. de 41 años es propietaria de una pulpería la cual inicio con $50 dólares hace 4 años que le regalo su padre.  Ella ha si do beneficiada con Adim tanto con el crédito como con las capacitaciones las cuales le han ayudado a administrar su negocio según comento. 
Z. tiene cuatro hijos pero solo el menor de 17 años depende de ella quien este año inicio la universidad. 
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Juana Vertida Muños de 64 años quien es modista y tiene un modesto taller de costura y Maribel L. Mendoza de 45 años vende frutas y tamales desde hace 25 años.
texts.en:
The Tayson group is made up of three hard working enterprising people.  Cecilia Zavalda, years old, runs a general store, which she started four years ago with an investment of $50, a gift from her father.  She says that she’s benefited from ADIM not only because of the loan, but also the training that has taught her how to manage her business.  Z. has four children, but she only still supports the youngest, age 17.  This year he began studying at the university.

The other members are 64 year old Juana Vertida Muños who is a fashion designer and has a tailor shop, and 45 year old Maribel L. Mendoza, who has been selling fruits and tamales for 25 years.

loans.use: to buy items to stock her store

loans.name: Las Triunfadoras De La Ensenada Group

texts.es:
El Sr. Milton tiene su negocio “FERRETERIA MILDER” ya tiene trabajando en el 3 años, antes vendía todo tipo de productos eléctricos era un negocio muy bueno pero la distancia era un impedimento  por que  trasladarse de su casa al negocio le tomaba mucho tiempo  es si que después de 7 años decidió poner su ferretería en el lugar donde vive empezó  vendiendo pocas cosas poco a poco fue incorporando mas productos en su negocio según las necesidades de sus clientes  así fue ganando muchos clientes ahora tiene 02 trabajadores  incluyendo a su familia que apoyan en el negocio, el considera que su mayor logro es  darle buena educación a sus hijos y haber terminado la construcción de su casa ahora esta ahorrando por que quiere comprarse un  volquete para transportar la mercadería de su ferretería también  desea compra otro terreno donde poner  una sucursal de su negocio lo que hará con su  préstamo es comprar mas materiales de construccion como tubos, cemento, y todo lo que le haga falta para tener  todo lo que su clientela le exige.

* El Sr. Milton es la cuarta persona sentada.
texts.en:
Mr. Milton has had his business "Ferreteria Milder" for three years now.  He used to sell every kind of electric product and that was a good business, but the distance prevented him from getting to and from his business -- it took too much time.  This is why after seven years, he decided to open a hardware store in his home.  He began selling a few things and bit-by-bit incorporated more products into his business according to his customers' needs.  He got a lot of customers that way and now has two employees including his family who help him with his business.  He thinks his biggest achievement has been to provide his children a good education and finishing construction on his house.  Now he is saving because he wants to buy a dump truck to transport merchandise from his hardware store and also wants to buy more land where he can open another branch of his business.  He will buy construction materials with the loan like:  tubes, cement, and anything else he's missing so he will have whatever his customers need.  

*Mr. Milton is the fourth person seated (at the table).

loans.use: Construction materials.

loans.name: Mónica Lucia

texts.es:
Mónica Lucia vive en Santa Lucia barrio de Arjona, un municipio del departamento de Bolívar, con su esposo y su hijo de 3 años de edad; en este municipio todos conocen a Mónica por su negocio llamado “Abasticos Dary Luz” donde vende galletas, mecatos, frutas, además de tener un pequeño vivero que cultiva con sus propias manos, vender frutas, plantas y poteras y atender  una venta de minutos a celulares, negocio con el que inició su vida microempresarial hace un año y gradualmente fue  ampliándolo con los otros productos  ya mencionados.  Su visión es convertir su negocio en una gran tienda que le ayude a aumentar sus ingresos, lo que conseguirá gradualmente mediante su trabajo,  pues aún no tiene el capital suficiente para hacerlo. En la actualidad está solicitando su primer financiamiento a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará víveres, abarrotes y adicionará variedades de mercancías.
Su sueño es construirle un futuro mejor a su hija mediante el ahorro y la disciplina en su negocio, porque quiere brindarle oportunidades de estudios superiores, pero mientras eso ocurre, Mónica Lucia sigue trabajando fuertemente , para alcanzar una rentabilidad no menor de 56%.
texts.en:
Mónica Lucia lives in the Santa Lucia neighborhood of Arjona, a town in the Bolívar department, with her husband and three-year-old child.  In this town everyone knows Mónica by her business called “Abasticos Dary Luz” where she sells cookies, sweets, and fruit as well as for having a small plant nursery where she cultivates plants with her own hands.  She sells fruit, plants, flower pots, and also sells cell phone minutes with the business she started her micro business life with a year ago and gradually expanded with the other products already mentioned.  Her vision is to convert her business into a big store that will help her to increase her income which she will accomplish gradually through her work, although she doesn’t have sufficient capital to do it.  Right now she is requesting her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo which she will use to buy plants, groceries, and additional varied merchandise.
Her dream is to build a better future for her daughter by saving and using discipline in her business because she wants to offer her the opportunity of higher education, but while this is happening, Mónica Lucia continues working hard to reach a minimum level of profitability of 56 percent.

loans.use: to buy plants, groceries, and additional varied merchandise.

loans.name: Matilde Edilma

texts.es:
Matilde de 32 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Suburbio de Guayaquil. Su esposo trabaja como guardia de seguridad y tienen dos hijos de 11 y 18 años uno de ellos esta en escuela fiscal. Su actividad es la ventas de comidas.

Comenzó hace tres años por medio de su mama que hacia almuerzo un día la mama falleció y ella queda con el negocio así que escogió esa actividad. Labora sola los almuerzo desde las 10H00am a 2H00pm que termina abre su negocio de lunes a sábados. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere comprar ollas , tarrinas y 8na cocineta para mejorar su negocio e incrementar sus ganancias. Ella anhela abrir un local propio para su restaurante y que su hijos después lo administre.
texts.en:
Matilde, 32, lives in an urban area in the Suburbio de Guayaquil. Her husband works as a security guard and they have two children, 11 and 18, one of whom attends a public school. Her business is food prep and sales. 

She began her business three years ago through her mom who prepared lunches. One day her mom passed away and she ended up with the business, so that is how she chose it. She works alone making lunches from 10 a.m. until 2 p.m. Monday through Saturday. With the help of the loan she wants to buy pots, tubs and a kitchenette to improve her business and increase her earnings. Her hope is to open up a storefront of her own for her restaurant and that later her children would manage it.

loans.use: to purchase pots, tubs and a kitchenette.

loans.name: Wouyessouly  1 Group

texts.fr:
WOUYESSOULY 1 est un regroupement de 10 hommes tous mariés vivant des familles traditionnelles élargies à  KOMALABA. Ils ont  en moyenne 42  ans, et ont en moyenne  5 enfants. KOMALABA un village situé à environ 45 km de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ces producteurs sont à leur premier cycle de prêt  pour la production du maïs avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. 
LADJI se tenant au milieu en position debout, compte utiliser son prêt de la façon suivante : achat de 6 sacs d’urée, 3 sacs de complexe céréale, 3 litres d’herbicides et le reste comme frais de  labour.
Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice d’environ 100.000 FCFA utilisée  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
Il ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
WOUYESSOULY 1 is a group of ten men who are all married living in traditional extended families in KOMALABA. They average 41 years of age and five children each. KOMALABA is a village located about 45 km from Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). With the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, these producers are on their first loan cycle for producing corn.
 
LADJI, who is standing in the middle of the photo, intends on using his loan in the following way: to buy 6 sacks of urea, 3 sacks of a fertilizer mixture for grains, and 3 liters of herbicides. And the rest will be used for the cost of plowing.

LADJI envisions making a profit of about 100,000 francs CFA that will be used to cover day-to-day family expenses. His ambition is increase his turnover, so as to satisfy his customers further.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and to pay for plowing

loans.name: Lesinko

texts.en:
Lesinko is 24 years old and single. He supports his parents. He is a farmer and he does the farming on his own piece of land which he has been doing for the past three years.

He learned about KADET from other men in a group already registered with KADET in his area of residence. This will be his second loan which he is planning to spend to buy farm supplies. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to build a permanent home and expand his farming activity.

His dream is construct rental houses and educate his children in order to have a better future. He is an industrious man who is determined to achieve his objectives.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Filemon

texts.es: Filemón, un señor muy humilde de 45 años de edad, originario de la zona de Isiqui - Estelí, casado con  dos hijos los cuales  crio desde muy pequeños como hijos propios, a los cuales le ha enseñado el amor y cultivo a las tierras, haciendolos hombres de bien . Inicio sus actividades en la agricultura a la edad de 15 años, con ayuda de su amigo Ramón Diaz ya que no pudo contar con su padre, quien lo abandonó a muy pronta edad. El señor Filemón solicitó su crédito para la compra de insumos que le hacian falta para la siembra de maiz y frijoles. Él espera llegar a terminar su cosecha y no perderla, para asi poder ampliar su cosecha en un futuro no muy lejano y realizar mejora a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Filemón is a very humble 45 year-old man from Isiqui-Estelí.  He is married and has two children who he raised from a very young age as his own.  He has taught them how to love and cultivate the land and has made good men out of them.  Filemón started working in farming when he was 15 years old with the help of his friend Ramón Diaz.  He couldn't rely on his father as he abandoned him at a very young age.

Filemón requested this loan to buy supplies that he needs to grow his corn and beans.  He hopes to have a successful harvest, and not lose it, so that he can expand his plantings in the not-so-distant future and make improvements to his home.

loans.use: to buy supplies for growing beans and corn

loans.name: And Soukali Jeeguene Pire 18 Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de 5 membres qui habitent dans le village de Pire à cent km de DAKAR la capitale du Sénégal, leur activité principale est le commerce de produits agricoles  les tubercules de manioc. Elles sont expérimentées dans le domaine et disposent  d’une bonne  clientèle. Leur journée commence à 8 heures du matin et se  termine vers 20heures du soir. Avec ce financement elles comptent  acheter 100 sacs de manioc qu’elles vont revendre  au marché. Les revenus tirés de la vente du manioc leur permettra de renforcer leur commerce mais aussi de satisfaire les besoins de leurs enfants (paiement des frais de scolarité les frais médicaux et participer a l’entretien de la maison).
texts.en: Ce groupe est composé de 5 membres qui habitent dans le village de Pire à cent km de DAKAR la capitale du Sénégal, leur activité principale est le commerce de produits agricoles  les tubercules de manioc. Elles sont expérimentées dans le domaine et disposent  d’une bonne  clientèle. Leur journée commence à 8 heures du matin et se  termine vers 20heures du soir. Avec ce financement elles comptent  acheter 100 sacs de manioc qu’elles vont revendre  au marché. Les revenus tirés de la vente du manioc leur permettra de renforcer leur commerce mais aussi de satisfaire les besoins de leurs enfants (paiement des frais de scolarité les frais médicaux et participer a l’entretien de la maison).

loans.use: to buy cassava, peanuts, and millet

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is 25 years old, married to David and has one child aged five. She owns a retail shop that has been in operation for one year and earns her a monthly profit of 10,000 KES.
Millicent has applied for her first loan of 20,000 KES from Kiva partner, KADET. She plans to use the loan to purchase more stock for the shop such as sugar, milk, cooking oil, tea leaves etc.
With her anticipated profit Millicent plans to expand her business since it is small. In the near future she hopes to grow her business and increase her stock to half a million.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for the shop like sugar, milk, cooking oil, tea leaves etc

loans.name: Jappo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Jappo a été crée le 22 Juillet 2011 à l'inauguration du Banc villageois. Il est composé de 16 femmes qui sont issues du même village. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Debout à l'extrême droite de la photo, la responsable du groupe est âgée de 31 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants.

Elle vend de l'huile de palme, du sucre, du lait. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine pour l'avoir pratiquer pendant plus de cinq années. 

Ce prêt lui permettra de s'approvisionner en huile, sucre et lait pour la revente.

Avec les bénéfices qu'elle tirera de son activité, elle compte soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille et surtout de la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
The group Jappo was created on July 22, 2011 when the Banc Villageois was inaugurated. The group comprises sixteen women who are all from the same village. Their main work involves small-scale commerce. 

Standing at the extreme right in the photo, the group's official is 31 years old, married, and the mother of four children. She sells palm oil, sugar, and milk, She has good experience in this domain for having worked in it for over five years. 

This loan will enable her to stock up on oil, sugar, and milk to resell. 

With the profits she will make from her business, she plans on supporting her husband to support the family and  especially to provide an education for the children.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (oil, sugar, milk....)

loans.name: Adilia Esperanza

texts.es:
Adilia casada, su esposa trabaja como chofer, sus hijos ya mayores. Su proyecto mejorar la infraestructura de la vivienda. Trabaja cocinera desde hace tiempo. Inicio a realizarle mejora a su vivienda con fondo propio y esfuerzo. La seguridad y comodidad es la meta para cumplir.  Con el préstamo comprar materiales de construcción como: cemento, arena, piedrines, piedra cantera, láminas de zinc entro otros materiales para la construcción de un anexo a la casa. 
Agradece a ala financiera por el apoyo a l desarrollo socio económico de su familia.
texts.en:
Adilia is married, her husband works as a driver and her children have now grown up. Her project is to improve the infrastructure of her home. She has worked as a cook for some time. She began her home improvements with her own funds and effort. The ultimate goal is safety and comfort. With the loan she will buy construction materials such as: cement, sand, gravel, quarry stones and zinc roofing sheets, among other items needed for the construction of a house extension.

She is grateful to the financier for the support of the socioeconomic development of her family.

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Sanavbar

texts.ru: Санавбар проживает в городе Истаравшан. Возраст, 43 года. Она замужем. Имеет двоих детей. Ее муж занимается бизнесом, а сын находится в Российской Федерации на заработках. Сама Санавбар занимается торговлей. Она на центральном рынке города имеет торговую точку, где продает ткани и платки. Этим видом деятельности занимается 20 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения разных видов тканей и платков.
texts.en: Sanavbar lives in the city of Istaravshan.  She is 43 years old, married and has two children.  Her husband is involved in business, and son works in the Russian Federation.  Sanavbar is involved in retail sales.  She has a retail outlet in the city center, where she sells fabrics and scarves.  She has been in this business for 20 years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of various types of fabrics and scarves.

loans.use: to buy various types of fabrics and scarves

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
This is Mary Ann, 41, resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Claro, and mother to three children. She, together with her husband, manage their own household while operating their business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Mary Ann operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piece-meal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns her profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 11,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory and for the maintenance of her sewing machine.
