She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Mary Ann hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to sell, and for the maintenance of her sewing machine

loans.name: Mher

texts.en:
Mher is 42 years old. He is married and has two children: a son and a daughter. Mher and his family live in Ijevan City. His son is studying at the Ijevan branch of Yerevan State University, and his daughter is attending school.  

Several years ago Mher worked as watchman at a Ijevan carpet manufacturer. Then he and his family moved to Russia where they lived and worked for about 7 years and in 2003 they returned to their native land. Now Mher works at wood-working shop as a master. 

Simultaneously with his work, Mher has run a clothes and shoes trading business since 2010. He and his wife buy clothes from Yerevan and resell them from their house at Ijevan city. They sell mens, women's and children’s clothes. Thanks to his occupation, Mher pays for his son’s education and supports his family. 

Mher is seeking a 700.000 AMD loan to buy autumn and winter clothes for his business. This is Mher’s second loan from Nor Horizon.

loans.use: to buy autumn and winter clothes for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy an overlock sewing machine

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 49 años, es una mujer admirable. Hace 4 años que falleció su esposo, con quien tuvo 3 hijos: Luis, Estefania y Andrés. Ahora ella cuida de ellos en casa de su madre, ubicada en el anexo de San pedro de saño. Ella afronta los problemas con mucho optimismo, aunque se siente triste por la perdida de su compañero. Todos los días pide la bendición de Dios para que su negocio de venta de cuyes y gallinas, le brinde buenas ganancias ya tiene clientes fijos, que constantemente la buscan en el mercado mayorista que es donde ella lleva a vender. Cuenta que en fechas festivas, vende la carne de los animales, “ahí obtengo más ganancia”, afirma. A pesar de la pensión que recibe por la muerte de su esposo, elle sigue trabajando, pues no le alcanza el dinero, sus hijos todavía son pequeños y estudian. Por esa razón planea incrementar sus animales, hasta tener una granja grande y de calidad, para poder obtener mejores ganancias. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “san pedro” y este es el decimoquinto crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete una vez más de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Rosa de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de gallinas y cuyes, además de comida balanceada para la alimentación de sus animales.
texts.en: Rosa, 49, is an admirable woman who lost her husband four years ago.  They had three children, Luis, Estefania and Andrés, who she takes care of in her mother's house located in the San Pedro de Saño annex.  She faces her difficulties with optimism even though she is sad about losing her partner.  Every day she thanks God for her business selling guinea pigs and hens, which provides her with ample earnings because of her fixed customers.  They seek her out constantly at the wholesale market where she has her stall.  Around the holidays she sells meat, "making a good profit".  Although she receives a widow's pension, it is not enough, so she continues to work since her children are still young and in school.  She plans to increase the number of animals and expand the farm for better quality and to increase earnings.  She belongs to the communal bank "San Pedro" and this is her 15th loan through MFP.  She looks forward to your help so she can continue striving to reach her goals, and is committed to paying back the loan on time.  Rosa enjoys being part of the communal bank because all the members are reliable and supportive.  She plans to use the loan to buy hens and guinea pigs, as well as balanced feed for the animals.

loans.use: To buy hens and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Bienjelesia Group

texts.en:
Eliud is the facilitator of the Bienjelesia group. Eliud and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Eliud takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund for One Acre Fund’s best prices and to access fertilizers and hybrid seeds. In the recent 2011 season, Eliud had an excellent maize yield harvesting 16 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Eliud was only able to harvest five bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Eliud and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Eliud will educate his children and build a house.

In 2012, the members of Bienjelesia group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

Eliud is pictured with his group members in the photograph above. The person standing on the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es: Don Juan, de 60 años de edad, casado, tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 2 de ellos están en la secundaria los otros son independientes, el es originario de la ciudad de León, el es comerciante tiene un taller de vulcanización lleva 20 años con este negocio el cual esta localizado en las afueras de la ciudad. Cuando inicio su negocio fue cuando trabajaba en un taller de mecánica y el soñaba con tener su propio taller y trabajo muy duro para poder tenerlo. Hoy en día tiene 2 ayudantes, su esposa trabaja desde su casa vendiendo cosméticos y leña. El requiere el préstamo para comprar llantas y material para reparaciones  de vehículos y motos. Su próxima meta es comprar 2 herramientas que necesita tales como un compresor y un motor.
texts.en: Don Juan, 60, is married and has five children, two of which are in high school and the others independent.  He is from the city of León and is a merchant by trade.  He has a vulcanization workshop and has been in business for 20 years on the outskirts of the city.  Before he started his business he worked in a mechanic's workshop and dreamed of having his own workshop.  He worked hard enough to get it and now he has two assistants.  His wife sells cosmetics and firewood out of the home.  He is requesting a loan to buy tires and materials for auto and motorcycle repair.  His next goal is to buy two tools that he needs such as a compressor and an engine.

loans.use: To buy tires and materials for auto and motorcycle repair.

loans.name: Santo Cruz

texts.es:
Santos de 42 años, empezó con esta actividad desde que salió de la escuela y gracias a Dios ha ido creciendo productivamente.

Trabaja junto a su esposo sin horarios fijos. Gracias a Dios no ha tenido dificultades en su negocio. 
Vive felizmente en unión libre junto a su esposa que también es sastre, tiene 4 hijos de 15, 11, 7 y 3 años que estudian en instituciones fiscales.

Tienes muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere comprar para mejorar sus ingresos hilos, telas, botones. Su meta es poder comprar un vehículo para así poder trasladar  su mercadería.
texts.en:
Santos, 42 years old, started this job as soon as he left school and thanks to God has managed to grow productively.

He works together with his wife, without a fixed timetable. Thanks to God their business has not had any difficulties.

He lives happily in a common law marriage with his wife who is also a tailor. He has 4 children aged 15, 11, 7 and 3 who study in private education.

He has many hopes for his business and for this reason he wants to improve his stocks of cloth, thread and buttons. His goal is to buy a vehicle so he can transport his merchandise.

loans.use: to buy cloth, thread and buttons.

loans.name: Williams

texts.es:
Williams, de 46 años, es una hombre bueno, amable y muy trabador, esta casado y tiene un hijo quien tiene 18 años y es su motivo de inspiración ya que su máximo deseo es darle una profesión. Él vive en su casa propia a lado de su hijo, su esposa y su suegro a quienes brinda lo necesario para tener una beuna calidad de vida. El trabajo de Williams consiste en brindar el servicio de electricista, además de ser mecánico, también se dedica al transporte ya que sale a trabajar en su unidad móvil. Siempre esta a la expectativa ya que sus clientes le llaman muy seguido a los diferentes talleres de la ciudad para brindar sus servicios de mecánico  y así brindar sus conocimientos a los mecánico nuevos y jóvenes. Trabaja solo y le esta yendo muy bien, al principio solo se dedicaba al transporte pero con el tiempo fue ganando experiencia además de conocimientos.
Lo bueno de su trabajo es que tiene entradas de dinero por todos lados, si no esta brindando sus servicios de electricista, esta laborando como mecánico o sino ofreciendo el servicio de transporte. Tiene muchas cosas en mente en cuanto a su actividad pero por el momento solo se esta concentrando en aperturar una asociación de mototaxista en donde pueda brindar algunos repuestos y servicios a crédito a sus demás colegas de trabajo. Este será el crédito numero 3 con MFP, por ello esta muy contento ya que tendrá un apoyo financiero y así podrá seguir avanzando con su negocio, además se compromete una vez mas de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo, por otro lado menciona estar muy contento de trabajar junto a su banco comunal ya que todos sus socios son muy responsables y solidarios. Con el monto solicitado 2500 soles, comprará mercadería para poner una tienda de repuestos de motos en su casa y así empezar a concretizar uno de sus objetivos trazados.
texts.en:
Williams who is a very good man is 46 years old. He is friendly and a hard worker. He is married and has an 18 year old child who is his source of inspiration and his greatest desire is to give his child a vocation. He lives in his own house, along side of his child and his wife and his father-in-law,  providing what is necessary to have a good quality of life.

Williams is an electrician and also a mechanic, and he also works in haulage and uses his cell phone to conduct his business. He is always on the alert as his customers call him continuously to various workshops around the city in order to offer mechanical help and advice passing along his knowledge to new and young mechanics. He works alone and is doing very well, at first only working in haulage, but with time he gained experience and knowledge.

The good thing about his work is that he has several sources of income. If he is not offering his services as an electrician then he is working as a mechanic or else providing haulage service. He has many things in mind regarding work activities, but at the moment he only is concentrating on launching a motorcycle taxi driver association where he can provide some repairs and services on credit to his work colleagues.

This will be his 3rd loan with MFP, so he is very happy that he will have financial support and thus be able to continue moving forward with his business. Also he promises to once again make his loan payments, as he has done with previous loans he has had. At the same time he mentions that he is very happy to work with the communal bank because all the members are very trustworthy and caring. With the 2500 soles from the loan, he will buy merchandise in order to be able to open a motorcycle spare parts store in his home and thus begin to actualize one of his planned objectives.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for motorcycles to begin a business

loans.name: Luchando Por Un Sueño Group

texts.es: Maritza es integrante de la Alcancía Comunal “Luchando por un Sueño” la cual está conformado por  08 socios entusiastas y trabajadores siendo Maritza una de las socias activas del grupo. Maritza tiene 26 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 02 hijos menores la cual sigue apoyando. Ella se dedica a la venta de queso la cual lleva 02 años en dicho negocio, su madre fue quien la motivo para emprender su propio negocio ya que es ella quien la abastece de dicho  producto, también nos manifiesta Maritza que  realiza trabajos todos los  fines de semana como ayudante de cocina, de donde obtiene un ingreso mas para su hogar, con arduo trabajo a logrado mejorar su calidad de vida. Con los deseos de seguir mejorando  solicito el crédito para la compra de quesos ya que tiene pedidos por entregar. El deseo de Maritza es de comprar su propio terreno. La Alcancía Comunal “Luchando por un Sueño” están muy agradecidos con el crédito brindado. Maritza es la que viste un polo rosado y pantalón plomo. Gerlyn y Esthefani no pudieron estar presentes en el desembolso por motivo de trabajo, es por ello que adjuntamos sus  fotografías.
texts.en:
Maritza is a member of the communal bank "Luchando por un Sueño" which is comprised of eight enthusiastic, hard-working members.  

Maritza is 26, has a common-law husband and two small children who she supports.  She has been selling cheese for two years and it was her mother who encouraged her to set up her own business since she is the one who supplies the product.  Maritza also works on weekends as an assistant cook to earn extra income for the household.  By working hard she has been able to improve her quality of life.  Since she wants to continue improving she has requested a loan to buy cheese so she can fill the orders she has already taken.  Maritza's goal is to buy her own land.

The communal bank "Luchando por un Sueño" is very grateful for the loan.  Maritza is the one in the pink t-shirt and grey pants.  Gerlyn and Esthefani could not be present for the picture because of work, so their photographs are seen below.

loans.use: To buy cheese.

loans.name: Elsy De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Elsy, vive con su esposo y dos hijos, su negocio es una tienda,  desde hace más de 15 años de dedica a la venta de refrescos, productos de primera necesidad, pólvora, su esposo es un profesional de la carrera de derecho, desde hace tres años trabaja como abogado.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de juegos pirotécnicos (pólvora china), para las fechas de navidad y fin de año, también comprara mercadería como gaseosas, galletas, pan de barra, dulces, entre otra mercadería que es muy necesaria para atender a la clientela. 
Su aspiración es mejorar la situación económica de su familia, apoyar a su esposo para tener una mejor solvencia económica.
texts.en:
Elsy lives with her husband and two children. He business is a store. For more than 15 years she has sold soft drinks, basic necessities, and fireworks. Her husband is a law professional and has worked as a lawyer for the past three years.

She is asking for a loan to buy fireworks (Chinese gunpowder) for the Christmas and New Year holidays. She will also buy merchandise such as soft drinks, cookies, french bread, candy, and other items that are necessary to meeting her customers' needs. She aspires to improve her family's economic situation and to support her husband financially.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, cookies, bread, and candy.

loans.name: Magda Patricia

texts.es:
la sra Magda Patricia tiene 41 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos los que estudian en centro educativo públicos de su comunidad, Magda se dedica brindar servicios de consulta medica, ella es medico general, contando con mas de 6 años de experiencia. su negocio se ubica en una de las calles del comercio, este negocio le genera utilidades para satisfacer gastos familiares y compromisos adquiridos.
la Dra. Magda es una persona muy reconocida en el municipio ya que ha formado parte de la corporación municipal y por su don de servicio a la comunidad en pro del bienestar y de la salud de los más desprotegidos.
El credito lo utilizara para la compra de medicamentos y así satisfacer la demanda de sus pacientes.
texts.en:
Magda Patricia, 41, is a single mother with two children enrolled in public school. 

Magda is a general practitioner with more than six years' experience. Her business is located on one of the main streets. Thanks to her business, she generates enough income to cover household and other expenses.

Magda is very well-known in her town for her service in favor of the well-being and health of people in need. She was also a member of the municipal council.

She is requesting this loan to buy medicines in order to meet her patient's demands.

loans.use: to buy medicine.

loans.name: Kunthea's Group

texts.en:
Kunthea is aged 28 years and married with two children, all of whom are too young for school. She and her husband have worked very hard for seven years to support their family by farming rice and working for other for a fee. The current business earns them about 72,000KHR per day and they manage to save about 10,000KHR each day after expenses. 
This is the second loan for Kunthea with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to seek for a loan. Kunthea wants to use her portion to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Kathia Danelia

texts.es:
Doña Kathia, continua con su afán de mejorar sus condiciones de vida, ya que para ella lo primordial es su familia, su esposo la apoya incondicionalmente, ella siempre tiene su negocio de venta de Frutas y Verdura en el mercado, por lo que solicita este crédito para la compra de productos, tanto en verdura como de frutas, ya que en esta temporada los clientes le exigen un poco mas y ella aprovechara al máximo las venta para obtener mayores ganancias, ya que con la ganancia ella invierte en la compra de materiales para mejorar su vivienda.
Agradece el apoyo que Kiva y Afodenic le han brindado en estos tres años y espera contar con los financiamientos.

loans.use: Compra de Frutas y Verduras

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
The above picture presents Pamela, a practical, intelligent, and ingenious woman. She has always liked everything related to farming.
She is an old fox in this field, as she has dedicated all of her life to this wonderful profession.
Pamela is a farmer from Kitale in Kenya who has defied the common thinking of most Kenyans about agriculture. Pamela is a proud owner of a small parcel of land on which she has been practicing mixed farming for the past ten years. Her primary sources of income have been from planting crops, milk, eggs and a variety of vegetables. She also engages in some personal business to make ends meet. 

Pamela passionately loves farming. She got interested in farming out of a desire to be a solution to food security which remains a big problem in her remote village. From farming, she has been able to earn a decent income and she attributes all this success to hard work and determination. Although she makes profits, she has always wanted to increase her farming and start a cereal-selling business. The main challenge she faces is lack of funds. 

She is seeking a loan to buy cereal. Demand for cereal is overwhelming in Kitale and through this loan she will buy different varieties of cereal. This will help her satisfy the demand in her village and local market. 

With this loan, Pamela will improve her living conditions through increased profits from selling cereal. 

Pamela has been practicing agriculture with energy, enthusiasm and knowledge attained through training from Juhudi Kilimo. She believes that her cereal-selling business will grow in leaps and bounds. There is no doubt that through this loan, Pamela's life will change permanently. It will ensure her 4 school-going children have a secure future.
Lenders! If there is someone that you should invest in with a loan during this festive season then that person is Pamela. You can help Pamela to accomplish all her dreams, and a loan will do that for her.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Melanie works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines. Melanie is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell for her general store business.

Melanie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Santos Ariel

texts.en:
My name is Santos Ariel. I have a grocery business in the transportation terminal of the city. I have had this business for years and it brings me income to cover the cost of food, education and health care for my family. In this Christmas season the volume of sales is higher and so I need to supply my business in order to offer more variety to my customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ruth, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi Nombre es Santos Ariel, cuento con negocio de pulperia, ubicado en la terminal de transporte de esta ciudad, tengo varios años de dedicarmen a este tipo de negocio el que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos de alimentanción, educacion y salud de mi familia, en esta epoca de navidad el volumen de venta aumenta por lo que necesito surtir mas mi negocio y poder ofrecer mayor variedad a mis cliente.

loans.use: To purchase food and supplies including jello, apples, grapes, orange juice, toilet paper, canned juice, cookies and candy.

loans.name: Chova-Chova

texts.en:
My name is Chova-Chova Domingos B., and I am a 56-year-old native of Chilembene, Chokwe district, Gaza province. I grew up under the care of my parents; however, the family’s financial situation offered me few opportunities to attend school. I started working as a young boy at the age of 12. At 22 I began to work in South Africa as a miner. I worked there 3 years before returning to Mozambique in 1975. Since 1984 I have assumed the full administrative duties of the family’s business and owned a territory with more than 50 hectares. Starting in 2006, through some neighbors' suggestions, I met Hluvuku-Adsema and solicited information about obtaining a loan for the expansion of my business. My business is in horticulture; I sell cabbage, peppers and tomatoes at the principal market in the district of Boane and the city of Maputo. Currently I employ 4 valuable workers, and when I am in need of help I contract someone with potential. The revenues help me support my basic needs, including the education and health of 7 children. With the loan I intend to purchase fuel for a motorized water pump and agricultural seeds and fertilizers.

Chova-Chova’s impact on the community is great because outside of providing employment for herself and four others she places the product nearer to the client. Her business also supplies the nearby market of the city of Maputo with cabbage and other horticultures.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Chova-Chova Domingos B. de 56 anos de idade, natural de Chilembene, distrito de Chokwe província de Gaza, cresceu sob a responsabilidade dos pais, a situação financeira da família ofereceu-lhe poucas oportunidades para estudar, teve que começar a trabalhar ainda criança com 12 anos de idade. Aos 22 anos de idade começou a trabalhar na Africa do Sul como mineiro, apenas trabalhou 3 anos, tendo regressado a Moçambique em 1975. Desde 1984 vem assumindo na integra a gestão do negocio da família e possui um terreno com mais de 50 ha. A partir de ano 2006 por indicação de alguns vizinhos teve conhecimento da existência da Hluvuku-Adsema tendo se aproximado para obter informações sobre as condições de acesso ao crédito para ampliação do seu negocio. A sua actividade é horticultura, produção de repolho, pimento e tomate, sendo principal mercado o distrito de Boane e cidade do Maputo. Actualmente conta com 4 empregados efectivos e quando necessário contrata pessoal eventual. Com os rendimentos suporta as despesas básicas, incluindo educação e saúde de 7 filhos. Com o empréstimo, pretende comprar combustível para motobomba e ínsumos agrícolas. A sua actividade tem um impacto maior na comunidade porque alem de providenciar emprego para ele próprio e mais outras quatro pessoas, coloca o produto mais perto do cliente e fornece o mercado vizinho da cidade de Maputo com repolho e outras hortícolas.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Nerida

texts.en: Nerida works selling cosmetics and clothes to people in their homes. She travels door-to-door offering her products to acquaintances and friends. She began doing this after saving about $100 from a job she had as a maid. She is still in need of investment capital so that she may purchase more products at wholesale prices. She hopes that she can explore the potential of new products and accesories. She is only 22 years old and has two children. They live in a home made out of wood, which she hopes to improve with the profits from her business.

loans.use: to invest in new products

loans.name: Yannette

texts.es:
A year ago Yannette started her own business selling snacks and soft drinks. She started her business aiming to earn extra income to help her husband with the household expenses. The couple has two children, 6 and 9 years old, both of whom are still in school. To give her chidren everything they need while still being personally taking care of them, Yannette set up her business in her home. Thanks to the good quality of the products she sells she has successfully grown her clientele.

To continue growing, Yannette is applying for a loan of $200. She'll use the loan to buy merchandise which will increase the variety of products she offers and thereby the quality of the service she offers her clients. She agrees to repay the loan in 3 months. You can help this family. No need to think further: decide to support them. They sincerely appreciate your collaboration.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Desde hace un año Yannette inició su propio negocio con la venta de botanas, comenzó para obtener un ingreso extra que le permitiera ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, tienen dos hijos de 6 y 9 años que están estudiando, para poder darles todo lo necesario y cuidar de ellos, Yannette instaló su negocio en su propia casa y gracias a la buena calidad de los productos que vende ha logrado incrementar su clientela.

Para continuar creciendo Yannette está solicitando un préstamo de $ 200 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder incrementar la variedad de productos que vende y ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, ella esta dispuesta a devolver esta cantidad en 3 meses. Tú puedes ayudar mucho a esta familia, no lo pienses más y decídete a apoyarlos, ellos agradecen sinceramente tu colaboración.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Anatolyi

texts.en:
Anatolyi is married with grown children. She lives in Kahovka and sells footwear in the local city market. It has always been difficult for Anatolyi to meet the needs of his family. He has worked hard to provide even for the most basic needs but his salary was not sufficient. That is why Anatolyi decided to try his luck in business. He has been in the trade for five years. Currently, Anatolyi has about $3000 in inventory. His turnover capital is about $1000. Monthly net profit is about $350.    

Anatolyi would like to get a loan of $1200 to increase inventory and boost his sales. We believe his natural ability to think through to what is the most essential and make quick and wise decisions will help him succeed and repay the current loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase new shoes wholesale

loans.name: Irma Leticia

texts.es:
“I have had a paper and notions store for one year and I would like invest in decorations, balloons and gifts for the Christmas season, as that is when my sales increase the most. I am requesting $1,000 to invest in my business.”

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

“Tengo una mercería y papelería desde hace 1 año me gustaría invertir en la compra de adornos, globos y regalos para la época de navidad ya que es cuando más aumentan mis ventas. Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para invertir en mi negocio."

loans.use: Buy Christmas decorations and gifts.

loans.name: Faalelei

texts.en: Faalelei is a lady of forty-one years of age, married with four children. She is very good at making handicrafts such earrings, rings, hats and mats in different styles and in Samoan style. She applied for this loan in order to buy everything she needs for her business, but some of it will be used to build her family a European-style bathroom. She is very happy to be able to support her family and improve her home.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her handicrafts business and for home improvements

loans.name: Mariam's Motomoto Group

texts.en:
Mariam, age 27, is married with a 12-year-old child. She also takes care of her 46-year-old mother who lives with them. Just last year in 2007, Mariam started a clothing sales business. From this business, she now makes a monthly profit of about $26. She works from 7am to 6pm daily.

Mariam hopes for a loan to increase her clothing stock. She will share this loan with Nasra, who is also in her loan group. Nasra has a business of selling chickens.

loans.use: To buy clothing inventory

loans.name: Estrella

texts.es:
The sale of cold drinks (beer and soda) is the daily activity that Mrs. Estrella carries out. She is fighting to get ahead and to progress with this business. She is 56 years old. With the help of her husband, Jose, who is an independent worker and always helps out with everything, she was wants to keep getting ahead and her dream is to implement him to construct a kiosk to offer more comfort to her clients. Your help is very important for the crystallization of this dream. Estrella appreciates it very much.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer

La venta D. bebidas heladas(cervezas y gaseosas), es la actividad diaria que desempeña la señora Estrella, quien lucha por salir adelante y progresar con este su negocio, ella tienen 56 años D. edad. Con la ayuda D. su esposo, José, quien es trabajador independiente y siempre la apoya en todo, quiere seguir surgiendo y su deseo es implementarlo y construir un kiosco para brindar una mejor comodidad a sus clientes. Vuestra ayuda ese muy importante para la cristalización D. este deseo, Estrella te lo agradece.

loans.use: Implementation of her business

loans.name: Zimula Josephine's Group

texts.en: Josephine, the leader of her group has a retail shop in Mbiko that has been operational for one year. The group has been together for 1 year and so far no regrets. She is single with no children but cares for her 5 year old neice in primary one. She plans to expand her shop by buying more sugar, soap, washing powder, bread so that she can be able to buy a plot and build a house. Her dream is to get married and see her shop transform into a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy sugar, soap, washing powder, bread, biscuits, plus other goods for her shop.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace B. sells clothing. She is married and has five dependents. She is working very hard to support her husband to meet the needs of their large family. She wants to increase salse to meet the increasing demand of her customers.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more clothing to sell

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es:
Ronald and his grandfather have a workshop where they fix automobile brakes. The workshop is Ronald’s principal source of income, enabling him to support his mother and pay for his university classes. His home is in the Nueva Jerusalén zone of El Alto in Rió Seco. Ronald is asking for a loan to buy a machine for his workshop, an arch to weld compressors. The loan will also contribute to purchasing raw materials. This is Ronald's first loan with Impro, whose evaluation resulted in Ronald’s credit approval.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Ronald (quien trabaja con su abuelo), tiene un taller de servicio de Frenos y Cambio de Balatas de movilidades. El taller es su principal fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre sus estudios universitarios y ayuda económicamente a su madre. Su domicilio es en la ciudad de El Alto Zona Nueva Jerusalén – Rió Seco. Ronald solicita crédito para comprar una herramienta de trabajo, es decir, un arco para soldar compresora, el monto también esta destinado para materia prima. Este es su primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada determina la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Ronald.

loans.use: Purchase tools for his shop.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosita, as she is affectionately known, has improved her quality of life thanks to her business of buying and selling second-hand items. This diligent mother comes from the province of Huancane and moved to the city of Juliaca more than 15 years ago with her 3 wonderful children. She has used the income she has earned over the years to build a small house, which provides both shelter from the heat and a home for her loving family. Rosita purchases her products second-hand in the city of Tacna, and then sells them for extremely reasonable prices on a busy street in the city of Juliaca. By working in her business she is hoping to offer her 3 children the opportunity to go to university. She wants to provide all of the necessary tools that will help them to be successful in their lives.

Translated from Spanish by Chris Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

Gracias a su negocio de compra y venta de artefactos de segundo uso ha mejorado su condición de vida Doña Rosita como cariñosamente la tratan. Ésta diligente madre es natural de la provincia de Huancané y hace más de 15 años junto a sus 3 adorables hijos radica en la ciudad de Juliaca. Con los ingresos que obtuvo a lo largo de estos años ha construido su vivienda, casita que cobija bajo el calor de un hogar a su querida familia; Rosita adquiere sus artefactos de segunda mano en la ciudad de Tacna, luego los ofrece a precios sumamente cómodos en una concurrida avenida de la ciudad de Juliaca.Con este negocio pretende brindarle estudios superiores a sus 3 retoños, a quienes desea facilitarles las herramientas necesarias para que puedan alcanzar el éxito en sus vidas.

loans.use: Increasing her capital so she can increase her selection of products

loans.name: Mateo Martin

texts.es:
Martin is married with six children: Gabriel (37), Hilda Nelly (31), Alejandro (29), Julian (28), Araceli (26) and Ana Luisa who is 24 years old. He began his business when he found himself unable to work and he opted for selling used clothing that his children sent him from the U.S. He began three years ago and gradually he has grown his business, which supports his wife and him.

Martin is requesting a loan of US $300, which he will repay in 4 months and use to purchase merchandise for resale allowing him to reduce his reliance on his children sending clothes. With your help, he will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Martín es casado y tiene 6 hijos: Gabriel 37, Hilda Nelly 31, Alejandro 29, Julián 28, Araceli 26 y Ana Luisa de 24 años. Inició el negocio porque quedo incapacitado para trabajar y opto por vender ropa usada que sus hijos le enviaban desde E.U. Comenzó hace 3 años y poco a poco ha hecho crecer su negocio, ya que de esto viven el y su esposa.

El solicita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar mercancía para la reventa y no tener que esperar a que sus hijos le envíen la ropa. Con tu ayuda el saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Um

texts.en:
Um V., 40, lives in Phnom Penh with her husband, Soa Bun Thoeun, and their nine children. Her husband operates a large trailer taxi service making US$3 per day, while three of her children work in the local garment factories making US$90 per month each. Five of her other children are still young and in the local school system. This large family depends heavily upon the trailer service to maintain a steady flow of income for the family, however, the trailer is currently in need of repair. Um V. has asked for a loan of US$150 to repair her husband's trailer, allowing the family to improve its economic stability.

Um V. was unavailable for a photograph at the time of the interview, so her husband is pictured above.

loans.use: Um would like to repair her husband's trailer transport.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy shoes to sell

loans.name: Micheal Mhenga's Maisha Zakhem B Group

texts.en:
Michael M., age 42, is married with two children (ages 18 and 14). He has a bar in Mbagala which he started in 1999. He works from 8am to 11pm daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about $560.

In the past, Michael has taken out four previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase capital and repair the bar building. He hopes for a new loan to increase on stock, buy chairs and do some painting. Michael will share this loan with his subgroup members who vegetables, fruits, coconuts, clothes, charcoal and have shops. The subgroup, Maisha Zakhem, hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Michael is first on the right.

loans.use: to increase stock, paint the bar buiding and buy more chairs

loans.name: Sinat

texts.en: Mrs. Sinat C. is 38 years old and she lives in the Chambork village in the Kampong Cham province in Cambodia. She is a duck breeder. She owns a plot of land to cultivate rice, so her husband, Mr. Chim Ven, is a farmer. Mrs. Sinat Chhom has six children; three children are construction workers, and the other three children attend the local school. Even though Mrs. Sinat Chhornu's family members work in different businesses, they still do not have enough money to support a good living condition. Thus, Mrs. Sinat C. is requesting a loan to buy ducks and food for the ducks. She hopes to increase thier income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: Buy ducks and food for the ducks to breed more ducks and increase income

loans.name: Akoko

texts.fr:
Madame A. Akoko est née le 12 octobre 1969 à Tsévié localité située à 35 Km de la ville de Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants qui vont tous à l’école. Elle a pour activité principale la vente des pagnes qu’elle achète au grand marché de Lomé.
Avec le revenu de cette activité qu’elle a commencé en 1997 elle arrive à aider son mari dans les dépenses de la famille.
A l’approche de ces fêtes de fin d’années elle désire augmenter son stock afin de pouvoir bien vendre a cet effet elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 15 pièces de pagne.
texts.en:
Ms. Akoko A. was born on October 12, 1969 in Tsévié, a town located 35 km from the city of Lomé. She is married and the mother of four children, who all go to school. She works principally in selling pagnes (colorful West African cloth) that she buys at the grand marketplace of Lomé. Using the income from her business, which she started in 1997, she manages to assist her husband with family expenses. With the coming year-end holidays, she would like to increase her inventory in order to do well in her sales. For this, she is requesting this initial loan to buy 15 lengths of pagne cloth.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy "pagne" cloth

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
La señora Karina F. I. tiene 27 años de edad, pertenece al Grupo Solidario Azucenas de Villa Hermosa y vive en el distrito de Huanchaco, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Karina vivía en la Selva en la provincia de Tarapoto,  estudió secundaria, pero no continuó estudios superiores por motivos económicos. Se casó de 19 años y actualmente tiene un hijo de 7 años y otro de 10 meses.
Su negocio consiste en la venta de zapatos o ropa de acuerdo a la época. 
Con el primer crédito de S/. 300 que fue cancelado en 4 cuotas, compró ropa y calzado.
Con este crédito de S/. 500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, invertirá en juguetes y sandalias.
Karina sueña con tener un negocio con capital propio.
texts.en:
Karina F. I. is 27 years old and is a member of the "Grupo Solidario Azucenas" of Villa Hermosa. She lives in the district of Huanchaco, in the province of Trujillo of the La Libertad department of Peru.

Karina used to live in the jungle in the province of Tarapoto, finished high school but was not able to continue her studies for financial reasons. She married at 19 years of age and has a 7- year old child and a 10-month old baby.

She is a shoe and clothing saleswoman, depending on the season.

With her first loan of 300 Soles ($1 US = 3 Soles), which she repaid in 4 installments, she bought clothing and shoes. With this loan of 500 Soles, which she'll repay in 4 installments, she'll invest in toys and sandals.

Karina dreams of owning her own business and growing it with her own capital.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in toys and sandals

loans.name: Adrienne

texts.fr: Née vers 1957 à  Porto-Novo dans le département de l'Ouémé au Sud du Bénin, dame Z. Adrienne est mariée et mère de six enfants et dont trois n'est plus à sa charge. Dame Adrienne est revendeuse d'oignon en gros et en détail. Voire actuellement la chèreté de l'oignon, elle est en difficulté financière qui ne lui permet pas de renforcer son activité. Pour ce fait, elle sollicite ce crédit.
texts.en:
Born around 1957 in Porto-Novo, in Ouémé County in southern Bénin, Ms. Adrienne Z. is married and the mother of six children, of whom three are no longer in her care. She is a retailer of onions at the wholesale and retail levels. In fact, with the current high cost of onions, she is in financial difficulty, which prevents her from strengthening her business. Because of this, she is requesting a loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy three sacks of onions

loans.name: Delma

texts.es:
A raíz de que sus hijos empezaron a trabajar en un centro comercial, se fue dando cuenta de la demanda que existía de parte de los trabajadores para poder vender menús como pensión, es decir un servicio delivery al centro de trabajo. Gracias al apoyo de sus hijos fue haciéndose conocida y hoy en día cuenta con un número regular de clientes a quien reparte almuerzo a diario.

Por otro lado,  Delma se dedica también a vender productos de belleza en sus tiempos libres y por las noches vende salchipapas.

Su esposo trabaja como albañil y entre ambos contribuyen a cubrir los gastos de la casa. Sus seis hijos ya son independientes, por ello en un futuro quisiera abrir un restaurante en su  propia casa.
texts.en:
When her children started to work in a commercial center, she realized that there was demand by the workers for daily homemade meals. That is, a delivery service of meals to their workplace. Thanks to the support of her children, she became well known and nowadays she has a regular number of customers to whom she delivers a daily lunch. In addition, Delma also sells beauty products in her free time, and at night, she sells salchipapas (meat and potatoes fast food dish). Her husband works as a laborer, and together they contribute to the household expenses. Their six children are already independent, and so they would like to open their own restaurant in their own house.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fixing a cart for selling fast food (salchipapas)

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
S. is 45 years old and a resident of Siem Reap Province. She has eight children: the first three are married and live separately, another one is single but living with her and employed as a local construction worker, and the last four are attending school. S. is married to Tha, 49, who is a traditional wine distiller with a net income of US$ 4 per day.

Since 1999, S. has earned a living by raising pigs in her pig pen behind her house because the leftovers from distilling in her husband's business can be made into pig feed. Her business is going well and she needs to rebuild her pig pen, so S. is applying for a loan of US$ 600 to buy a number of pigs for her pig pen and to rebuild her pig pen.

loans.use: To buy a number of pigs for her pig pen and to rebuild her pig pen

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia sews clothes for her customers as well as tailoring materials.

She is 32 years old and married with three children. Patricia lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.

Patricia needs a loan of N30000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. She says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: Purchase more tailoring materials to sell.

loans.name: Lemou

texts.fr:
Madame  Lemou T. est mariée, mère de 5 enfants (2garçons et 3filles). Elle est née vers 1964 à Bamako (capitale du Mali).  Elle vit dans la maison de son mari avec leurs enfants à Kadiolo quartier Noumousso.
Elle fait le commerce  de boubous bazin teintés, de pagnes bazin teintés et  de l’encens il ya plus de 17ans ans. Expérimentée en raison des années d’activités, elle le fait avec beaucoup de réussite.
Elle est à son sixième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Les prêts passés  se sont  bien dénoués.
Elle compte acheter avec son prêt 4 pièces de bazins blancs de motifs différents, de la graine de gueni, du magnon et d’autres ingrédients. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et à Sikasso. Elle vend au comptant ou à crédit (sur commande et en détail) à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elle envisage  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour augmenter le fonds de commerce et l’autre partie pour aider  son mari à subvenir aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lemou T. is married and the mother of 5 children (2 boys and 3 girls). She was born circa 1964 in Bamako, the capital of Mali. She lives in her husband's house with their children, in the Noumousso neighborhood in Kadiolo. For more than 17 years, she's been selling boubous made out of dyed bazin (highly prized cloth), pagnes (colorful African cloth), and incense. Very experienced thanks to her many years in this business, she runs it with much success. She's seeking her sixth loan from Kiva's partner, the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso. Past loans ended without problems.

She intends to use this loan to buy 4 pieces of white bazin with different patterns, and ingredients to make incense: gueni seeds (frankincense), magnon (a plant), ... She gets her supplies in Bamako and in Sikasso. She sells for cash or on credit (retail and on order) to a clientele comprising both women and men. She foresees turning an average monthly profit of XOF 25'000 (ca US$ 50), to be used in part to bolster her working capital. The other part will help her husband provide for the day-to-day family expenses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bazin (highly prized cloth) and ingredients to make incense

loans.name: Felicisima

texts.en:
Felicisima F. manages a small rice field in their village. Her harvest is intended for family consumption. The remainder is sold to rice traders for additional living expenses. Her husband, Gonzalo, also grows vegetables in addition to their farm. Both of them work together to provide for the growing needs of their five children.

She is asking for a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy additional stocks of merchandise for her store. She thinks that by doing so, she could attract more customers and increase her sales.


CEVI is a non-profit organization that aims to help small businesses to grow. CEVI provides all its clients with loans, training and insurance services to better support their clients’ livelihood.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise for her store

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy is thirty-four years old and married with four children. She sells baskets of tomatoes both wholesale and retail to her customers. She is asking for a loan to purchase more baskets of tomatoes to sell. She offers her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Jover

texts.en:
Jover T. is from the village of Segatic Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 29 years old. Jover is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Jover owns & operates a business planting & harvesting corn for sale. Jover has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jover joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Jover is requesting a loan of PHP 5000. He will use these funds to raise additional crops. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jover from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business for his family's needs and for his children's allowance and tuition fees. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To raise additional crops.

loans.name: Sharifbeg

texts.ru: Худоив Шарифбег проживает в городе вахдат. Возраст 40 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Шарифбег более 16 лет занимается торговлей, он имеет арендованный магазин, где торгует продуктами питания. Клиент просит кредит, для увеличения товараоборота. На полученную прибыль, он хочет купить себе этот магазин.
texts.en:
Sharifbeg H. lives in the city of Vahdat. He is 40 years old, married and has 4 children. Sharifbeg has been involved in sales for over 16 years. He leases a store, where he sells food products. Our client is requesting this loan in order to increase his goods turnover. He wants to use the resulting profit to purchase his leased store.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: 004-Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
"Thuỷ Lê Thị is thirty-nine years old and lives in the town of Thanh Hoá.  She is the leader of a four-member group loan offered by the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women, a partner of Save the Children, which in turn is a Kiva field partner.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 004-Quảng hưng.

Thuỷ is married and has three school-age children.  To make a living, she owns and operates a business raising cattle for sale.  Thuỷ has been engaged in this business for over six years and earns approximately $87 a month from these activities.

In 2005, Thuỷ joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation through engaging in business activities.  She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3.079.800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6.000.000 VND, which will be used to purchase more baby livestock. This will be her seventh loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Thuỷ plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  N. Thị Ngân is twenty-eight years old and is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector, raising livestock.

2.  H. Thị Minh is fifty-nine years old and is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector, raising livestock.

3.  Lê Thị Nghìn is fifty-nine years old is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector, raising livestock.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is a woman of faith and determination to rise above poverty. She is 54 years old and mother to five children. She is happily married to Vinancio, an electrician who is 57 years old. She lives in the island village in Binangonan, Rizal province in the Philippines.
With her desire to step out from poverty, in 1997, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines with a bagful of hope of having access to capital for her business. For almost three years, she been doing the Sari-sari Store (General Store) business. And the income is not sufficient to sustain the needs of her family.
Now on her eighth loan, she proposes a loan of 40,000 pesos to pay for a tricycle (rickshaw) to be managed by her husband. Since the use of rickshaw as a means of transportation in the village is in demand, she believes that her new business will click and will bring her enough income.
She dreams of sending her younger children to school and to renovate her house into a more durable and spacious one.

loans.use: To purchase tricycle (rickshaw).

loans.name: La Paz Group

texts.en: The La Paz committee members are involved in activities such as: the buying and selling of flour, meat, olives, eggs, condiments, milk, sugar, herbs, salt, vegetables, sodas, beers, wines, etc. They will use their loans to invest in their businesses and diversify their activities. They have completed their second loan cycle and each woman has her own productive micro-business. They each receive an average of 400,000 guaraníes.

loans.use: To buy flour, meat, olives, eggs, condiments, milk, sugar, herbs, salt, vegetables, sodas, beers, wines, etc.

loans.name: Dina Brigida

texts.es:
La señora Dina pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manuela de Hoy II”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Camicachi de el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 24 años de edad, estado civil conviviente y madre de 1 hijo y estudio secundaria incompleta (3er grado), vive en  la comunidad de Urani Marca Kollo. 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 4 meses con un préstamo inicial de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles  para la compra de fruta. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de frutas tales como plátanos, naranjas, papayas, etc. Para la venta en las ferias de  Camicachi.

Su deseo es poner una tienda de abarrotes

A ella le gustan las facilidades en los pagos.
texts.en:
Dina belongs to the Manuela de Hoy II Community Bank, which is located in the Camicachi community, Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno department. She is 24, has a common law partner, and she has one child. She attended high school until her third year. She lives in the Urani Marco Kollo community. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for four months. She used her initial loan for 500 PEN to buy fruit. She now needs a loan for 500 PEN to buy fruit like bananas, oranges, and papayas, etc. to sell in the fairs in Camicachi. Her wish is to set up a grocery store. She likes the ease of the payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruit like bananas, oranges, and papayas, etc.

loans.name: Lato

texts.en: Lato L. is currently in the business of distillation and selling local alcohol and is requesting a loan to purchase more yeasts for brewing. Lato is 43 years old and was widowed when her husband was shot dead during the two decade war in Southern Sudan. She has six children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, Lato hopes to be able to pay her children’s school fees. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more yeasts for brewing

loans.name: Hun-Eng

texts.en:
Mrs. Hun-eng S., 41, and her husband, Mr. Vuthy Seng, 42, live in a small village off of National Road number 2 about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. They were married in 1987 and have four children: three sons and one daughter. Three of them are attending school, one of whom is studying at university level. 

Hun-eng is a primary teacher. Her husband has been growing rice since he was young. One of Hun-eng’s sons is a guide, so she is applying for her first loan of $800 to add to her own money to purchase a van for her son, which will be used in his business as transportation for his customers.

loans.use: To add to her own money to purchase a van for her son.

loans.name: Peuya

texts.fr:
C'est le premier crédit pour Madame Peuya M., une vendeuse de cosmétiques a Camberene, une banlieue de Dakar.  Elle voudrait augmenter son fond de roulement pour mieux soutenir sa famille.  Aujourd'hui elle a une revenu de 25.000 frs par mois mais elle envisage une augmentation a 35.000 frs après le prêt.

Madame M. est une bénéficiaire du protocole entre U-IMCEC et le Programme de Développement de l'Enfant et de la Famille (PDEF) Seydina Issa Laye.  Le PDEF cherche à réduire la pauvreté au sein de la communauté et surtout à protéger les enfants issus des familles démunies.  Grâce a cette coopération, les parentes de ces derniers peuvent profiter de crédit a des conditions plus souples par rapport aux crédits ordinaires..  Depuis le démarrage du protocole en Décembre 2008, 120 parents ont reçu un financement pour des montants qui varient entre 50.000 et 150.000 frs.
texts.en:
This is the first loan for Mrs Peuya M. who sells cosmetics in Cambere, a suburb of Dakar. She would like to increase her working capital to better provide for her family. Currently her monthly income amounts to 25,000 CFA francs (US$57), but she expects it to rise to 35,000 CFA francs (US$80) when she has got the loan.

Mrs M. is a beneficiary of the Protocol between Kiva Partner U-IMCEC and the Development Program for Children and Families "Seydina Issa Laye". This Program seeks to reduce poverty within the community and especially to protect children from destitute families. Thanks to this cooperation, the parents of these families can benefit from loans with more flexible terms than ordinary loans. Since the start of this Protocol in December 2008, 120 parents have received loans in amounts varying from 50,000 to 150,000 CFA francs (US$114-343).

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma is into a fish selling business. She is a 52-year-old single parent of four children. All of her children are currently out of senior high school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in the town of Kade in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Though a commercial town, the majority of the inhabitants practice farming as a hobby or major occupation alongside other trading activities. Emma buys smoked fish from nearby fishing communities. She hawks them in her community and also sells at the local market. She has been in business for six years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy smoked fish

loans.name: Celia Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Celia  es socia del Banco Comunal  “Azangarinas Valientes “ del distrito y provincia Azangaro, tiene 47 años de edad es conviviente  y tiene 02 hijos, ella estudió hasta el quinto grado de primaria, viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 03 años, se dedica a la artesanía, específicamente tejidos a mano y máquina.

Celia dice que  el primer préstamo  fue de s/300.00 nuevos soles con los cuales adquirió su material para la elaboración de sus tejidos, así mismo arregló algunas inperfecciones que tenia  su máquina.

Ella requiere un credito de s/ 1500.00 nuevos soles, con lo que comprará mas  material y accesorios para su máquina; Piensa instalar un un pequeño taller para trabajar con mas tranquilidad y que sus trabajos sean de mayor calidad .

Su deseo  para el futuro es de construir y ampliar su casa ya que tiene dos hijos.

Lo que mas le agrada de su Banco Comunal son las charlas y el diálogo con sus compañeras
texts.en:
Celia, 47, is a member of the “Azangarinas Valientes" communal bank which is located in the district and province of Azangaro . She lives with her life partner and has two children. She finished fifth grade and has been cooperating with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the last 3 years. She is a craftsperson specializing in hand- and machine-made knitted items. Celia tells us that she used her first, 300 new sol loan, to buy materials and supplies needed for her knitting as well as to make some repairs to her knitting machine. She now needs a 1500 new sol loan to buy more materials and attachments for her machine. She intends to install a small workshop so that she can work with more tranquility and her finished items will be of a higher quality. Her future desire is to build and enlarge her house because she has two children. What she most enjoys about her communal bank are the chats and the dialogue with her fellow members.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool and attachments for her machine.

loans.name: Lucía

texts.es:
Lucía es una madre de familia de 46 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 06 y 11 años de edad en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace más de seis meses es propietaria de un pequeño taller de carpintería ubicado en su domicilio. La idea de este negocio surgió debido a la necesidad de brindarle a su familia un sustento más permanente ya que su esposo trabaja como obrero agrícola y los ingresos que percibe no son suficientes para mantener la economía familiar.

Ella atiende el taller junto a su hermano y trabajan en base a pedidos. El trabajo que realizan es de muy buena calidad por lo que su clientela ha ido aumentando. Lucía no cuenta con el capital suficiente para seguir atendiendo los pedidos de sus clientes por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de madera.

Su más grande anhelo es seguir adelante con su taller y comprar maquinaria para hacer la producción más eficiente. Ella es una mujer bastante activa, responsable y creativa.
texts.en:
Lucia is a 46 year old mother who lives with her husband and two children (age 6 and 11) in the district of Cayaltí, which is located an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

She has managed a small carpentry shop at her home for the past six months. The idea for this business came about as a result of her need to provide her family with a steadier source of income. Her husband works as a farm laborer and his earnings are not sufficient to maintain the family financially.

Lucia manages the workshop with her brother and they work based on the orders they receive. Their products are of very good quality and have resulted in an increase in customers. Lucia does not have sufficient capital to continue fulfilling her customers’ requests, so she has requested her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 soles to buy wood.

Her greatest dreams are to have continued success with her workshop and purchase machinery to make production more efficient. Lucia is an active, responsible, and creative woman.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wood

loans.name: God Cares Group, Lugazi

texts.en:
O. Edith is the leader of her group in Lugazi. She is married with 12 children, some of whom have completed university while others are in secondary and primary education. She also takes care of six dependants.
Edith is a farmer with plantations. For the last five years, she has also sold milk from her own cows in Naminya. She makes 40,000 UGX weekly profits but has limited capital. Edith would like to own more cows in order to expand her business She would also like to build more rental houses to be able to educate her children well. Edith is requesting a loan to buy another cow, and is happy that the loans have increased her capital.

loans.use: To buy another cow

loans.name: Maria De La Concepcion

texts.es: La señora Maria de la Concepcion F. G. tiene 51 años de edad, vive en el reparto Juan Ramos Padilla es casada y su esposo trabaja en la agricultura, ellos tienen 3 hijos entre las edades de 33, 30 y 15 años de edad los mayores son independientes y la menor actualmente estudia la escuela secundaria, el mayor logro que la familia visualiza seria el poder brindarle a su hija los recursos necesarios para que ella estudie su carrera profesional, la señora F. labora como conserge desde hace 3 años pero por sus bajos inrgesos se les ha dificultado la idea de poder reconstruir su vivienda con este prestamo tiene planeado comprar materiales de construccion con el fin de comenzar la primera etapa de reconstruccion del hogar, esto les daria mejores comodidades para su familia y podrian ofrecerle a su hija un espacio mejor que le procure mas seguridad, armonía y comodidad.
texts.en:
Señora Maria de la Concepcion F. G. is 51 years of age. She lives in the Juan Ramos Padilla neighborhood. She is married and her husband works in agriculture. They have 3 children ages 33, 30 and 15 years. The oldest are independent and the youngest one at present is a student in secondary school. The major achievement that the family visualizes is to have the ability to give their daughter the necessary resources so that she can study her professional career. Señora F. has worked as a consierge for 3 years, but her low income has complicated their ability to reconstruct their home. With this loan she plans to buy construction materials in order to begin the first phase of reconstruccion of the home. This would provide better comfort for her family and she would be able to give her daughter a better place with more security, harmony and comfort.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials for her home.

loans.name: Twezimbe Group, Lugazi

texts.en: N. Florence is the leader of her lending group in Lugazi. She is married with six children aged 4 - 18 and she takes care of some orphans. Florence has worked as a tailor in Lweru Trading Centre for four years and is able to make weekly profits amounting to 25,000 UGX. She is grateful to her loans for they enable her to have quality made clothes; however, in the future, she would like to change her main business to animal husbandry so that she could better educate her children. Florence needs a loan to be able to buy more clothing materials and threads to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothing materials and threads for her business

loans.name: Salimata

texts.fr:
Salimata Traoré est une femme mariée de 42 ans, mère de 4 enfants qui vit avec son époux  dans une grande famille traditionnelle à Fama, le centre ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame Salimata Traoré après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, s’est initiée à la fabrication des savons traditionnels (savons noirs) depuis plus de cinq ans, qu’elle a appris auprès d’une voisine. Elle mène son activité dans son domicile de Sikasso où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il ya  3 année avec laquelle est à son 4ème prêt individuel, tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursé. 
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt, 15 fûts des déchets d’huile de coton, 8 sacs de soude caustique et 5 chargements de charrette en bois de chauffe. 
Après fabrication des savons à base de déchets d’huile de coton et de soude caustique, elle les revend en détail à une clientèle composée généralement de femmes de sa localité.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 200 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Salimata Traoré, age 42, is a married woman and the mother of 4 children. She lives with her husband in a large traditional family in Fama, in downtown Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After running several unsuccessful businesses, she started selling traditional soaps (black soap) five years ago, a business she learned from one of her neighbors. She runs this business at home in Sikasso, where she's very much in demand due to the quality of her products. To meet an ever-increasing customer demand, she decided to join Kiva's partner, the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso, three years ago. She's seeking her fourth individual loan, and all previous loans were repaid without problems. She intends to use this loan to buy 15 drums of cotton oil waste, 8 sacks of sodium hydroxide, and 5 wagonloads of firewood. After making soaps from cotton oil waste and sodium hydroxide, she retails them to a clientele usually composed of women of her town. With this loan, she foresees turning a monthly profit of XOF 200'000 (ca US$ 400), to be used mostly to bolster her working capital, help with the family expenses, and repay the loan. The remainder will be invested in her business.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 15 drums of cotton oil waste, 8 sacks of sodium hydroxide, and 5 wagonloads of firewood

loans.name: Virgen De Fátima Group

texts.en: This committee is based in the Empalado Ari neighborhood in the city of Caaguazú.  Juana Sisinia B., who discovered the program through her neighbor, is the president of another group, and as she sensed significant interest in her neighborhood she decided to form a group to participate in the Women Entrepreneurs Program.  The group is comprised of 24 hardworking women who want to get ahead in life.  They have formed this group to support each other in their work.  Nevertheless the women work independently selling clothing, shoes and food.  They will receive loans of the following amounts: 1,000,000 gs, 800,000 gs, 600,000 gs, 500,000 gs and 300,000 gs to invest in their businesses.  They all hope to support their family with this loan from Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: Purchase sugar, flower, eggs, oil, sweets, noodles, meat, fruit, vegetables, milk, cheese

loans.name: God Is Able Group

texts.en: Gondoun B. is the leader of this group of five borrowers called God Is Able. In the photo, he is the one holding the sign. Gondoun is 33 years old, married, and has three children who range from 2 to 10 years old. He was only able to attend school, himself, through high school due to poverty. For two years, Gondoun has been selling foodstuffs such as bread, milk, and sardines at the Thinker’s Village in Paynesville, Liberia. He sells the foodstuffs in a friendly manner, which keeps his customers returning. Gondoun plans to use his 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more milk, sardines and bread. His goal is to grow his business so that it has branches around town and to build a house for his family to live in. About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating micro-finance institution with thirteen branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy more milk, sardines and bread to sell

loans.name: Benk Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe BENK sont toutes mariées et ont une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans et  3 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles avec leurs frères, sœurs, co-épouses, enfants et époux. Elles résident dans le village de Djoutièbougou de la préfecture de Bougouni, troisième région administrative de la république du Mali. 
Ces femmes se sont connues par des relations de parenté. 
Après avoir rencontré beaucoup de difficultés à acheter des condiments alimentaires au comptant avec leurs fournisseurs, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. 
Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt de groupe après avoir remboursés  les huit précédents prêts sans aucune difficulté. 
Avec ce prêt elles  comptent acheter, 150kg d’oignon, 250kg de sel de cuisine et 50 paquets de 100 morceaux de cube maggi. Tous ces condiments sont achetés dans le marché de Bougouni pour être revendus en détail, au comptant ou à crédit à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. Avec ce prêt les femmes espèrent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour soutenir les frais de santé et d’éducation des enfants.
texts.en:
The women of Benk Group are all married. On average, they are 30 years old and have three children. They all live in extended traditional families with their brothers, sisters, cowives, children and husbands in the village of Djoutièbougou in the prefecture of Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know each other through family ties. Having met with many difficulties to buy food condiments for cash from their suppliers, they decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. This is their ninth group loan. They repaid their previous eight loans without any difficulty. The women will use their loan to buy 200 kilograms of onions, 250 kilograms of cooking salt and 50 packs of 100 bouillon cubes. They will buy all these condiments at the market of Bougouni and retail them for cash or credit to a clientele made up mainly of women. Thanks to the loan, they expect to make an average monthly profit of 20,000 CFA francs, which they will spend on healthcare and school fees for their children.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food condiments

loans.name: Augenia

texts.en:
Augenia B. is an entrepreneur and a married woman. She runs a business selling fruit, potatoes, onions and green vegetables in Makangarawe Ward in Dar es Salaam. She purchases her business goods from the food market in Buguruni and in the Temeke City Market shopping center. She also runs a business raising poultry, which she developed with the income from her other business. She meets her family's daily needs from her business income. 

She is requesting a loan of T.shs 1,400,000 to improve her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more groceries  to sell

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Manuel M. L., tiene la edad de 54 años, está casado, y vive con su esposa y tres hijos, de 28,27 y 8 años de edad, ellos son su mayor prioridad. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de herramienta. para los trabajadores que tiene a su cargo. La idea es facilitarle el trabajo a los trabajadores en la construcción.Don Manuel tiene varios años de dedicarse a la construcción. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Manuel espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona, además de poder alcanzar sus metas y proyectos.
texts.en:
Manuel M. L. is 54 years old, and he is married. He lives with his wife and their three children; 28, 27, and 8 years old. They are his greatest priority. He wants the loan to buy tools for the workers he is in charge of. Manuel has been working in construction for several years. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR, and he is very happy with the terms of the loan. In the future Manuel hopes to give his family a better quality of life and greater economic stability. He also wants to be able to keep growing as a person and to reach his goals and complete his projects.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tools for work

loans.name: Lidia Del Transito

texts.es: Lidia del Transito tiene la edad de 55 años. Su actividad es la venta de refrescos, además tiene otra actividad que es venta de lácteos y ropa interior. Su actividad consiste en vender estos productos que son muy importantes para ella, siempre busca la manera de mejorar y ampliar cada día su actividad. Su mayor sueño es establecer una pulpería muy grande. Por lo que el financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de materia prima que será destinado para la inversión de su negocio.
texts.en:
Lidia Del Transito is 55 years old. Her main activity is selling sodas, milk, and undergarments; products that are very important to her. She is always looking for a way to improve and expand her daily business. Her biggest dream is to establish a very large grocery store. The loan requested is to purchase raw material which will be used to invest back in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Gustavo Gutierrez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: La señora Maria Elena  tiene cuatro hijos todos mayores de edad y trabajan, además que es soltera.
