La señora  Maria tiene un negocio de venta de ropa variada en un tramo localizado en el mercado, en el cual además vende ropa interior tanto de varón como de mujer. Ella empezó este negocio desde hace 35 años debido a la necesidad de tener un ingreso para mantener a su familia. Ella desea este crédito con el objetivo de realizar varias compras de mercaderías de ropa interior, ya que es lo que está vendiendo más y desea aprovechar las ventas de mayo. Cabe señalarse su sueño es mantener su negocio con estos y otros productos y ampliar su negocio con otros productos como venta de CD, manzanas y uvas.
texts.en:
Señora Maria Elena is single and she has four grown-up children who work. She has a business selling assorted clothing from a stall in the market, where she also sells underwear for both men and women. She started this business 35 years ago because she needed an income in order to look after her family. Señora Maria Elena wants this loan to buy various items of underwear as that is what sells best, and she wants to make the most of the May sales. Her dream is to continue running her business and expand to sell other goods such as CDs, apples and grapes.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: for working capital

loans.name: Yesica

texts.es:
Yesica, tiene 26 años, es conviviente, tiene dos hijos y pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva Visión de Rumichaca”. Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la comunidad de Rumichaca en la casa del señor Paulino.  
Su actividad económica principal de Giovanna es la venta de comestibles como por ejemplo arroz, fideos, leche en tarro, etc. Yesica es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora pues de esta forma va sacar adelante a sus hijos y les va dar una buena educación. Yesica participa en el banco comunal y le va muy bien porque es una persona responsable y puntual al momento de pagar sus cuotas, ella requiere el préstamo para comprar más comestibles como azúcar, gaseosas,  pan, etc.   

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma
texts.en:
26-year old Yesica is married and has two children. She belongs to the Nueva Visión de Rumichaca Community Bank. The bank holds meetings every month in the community of Rumichaca at Sr. Paulino’s house. Yesica’s main source of income comes from selling foodstuffs such as rice, noodles, cans of milk etc. She is a hardworking and resourceful mother who is going to ensure that her children do well in life and provide them with a good education. Yesica participates in the bank’s activities and all is going well for her as she is responsible and makes her repayments on time. The loan is to buy more foodstuffs such as sugar, soft drinks, bread etc. Yesica is grateful for the opportunity to obtain a loan and promises to repay the money according to the established schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy sugar, soft drinks, bread etc

loans.name: Huy

texts.en: Huy N., 61, is a widow and resides with her child in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for it's rubber plantation. N. sells traditional cakes, earning an income of USD 5 per day. Her child is a motor-taxi driver and earns an income of USD 6 per day. N. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a new motorbike for her child to operat, making his business more efficient. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Irine Sekeyian

texts.en:
Irine Sekeyian K. is 35 years old. She is married to Daniel Saoli and is the mother of two school-aged children. Irine has been farming on her own piece of land for the last ten years.

She learned about KADET through an awareness program run by KADET staff in her area of residence. This will be her first loan. She is planning to spend Kshs. 20,000  on harrowing,Kshs. 10,000  on seeds and on planting ten acres of wheat. With the profits she hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, she intends to plant wheat on a bigger piece of land. Her future dream is to be able to buy a bigger piece of land where she can do commercial farming. Irine believes she is hardworking and only needs the resources necessary to attain her dreams.

loans.use: to harrow and plant ten acres of wheat and to buy seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Sabaly Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe Sabaly, 3 femmes mariées et une veuve,  avec une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans et 5 enfants  vivent dans des familles  polygames à KAMALEN SIRAKORO, un des villages de la commune de Sikasso, (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur onzième  prêt. Les prêts passés se sont tous bien dénoués. 
Elles font entre autre la vente de charbons de bois, de condiments alimentaires et des chaussures en plastique avec Djata T..
 Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter  12 douzaines de paires de chaussures en plastique. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de Sikasso ville.
Elle vend au marché de KAMALEN SIRAKORO, de façon ambulante  et à domicile, au comptant et  souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 35.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Elle ambitionne avoir un prêt  plus consistant pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et  devenir grossiste à KAMALEN SIRAKORO
texts.en:
Of the four members of the group named Sabaly 3 are married women and one is a widow. They have an average age of 42 and they have 5 children each, living in polygamous families in Kamalen Sirakoro, a village of the Sikasso commune in the third administrative region of Mali. They are members of the microfinance instutution Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner) with the goal of meeting client demand. This will be their eleventh loan and their past loans have all been successfully repaid. Among other activities they sell wood coal, condiments, and plastic shoes with Djata T.. With this loan she will purchase 12 dozens of plastic shoes. She carries out her purchases in the Sikasso village market. She makes her sales in the market of Kamalen Sirakoro, while travelling, and from her home. She finalizes her sales in cash and often on credit. She sells to a clientele made up of both men and women. She foreseees earning 35.500 francs monthly, of which a part will be put away in savings and a part will be used to fill the family's needs. A part of these earnings will be reinvested back into the business. Her ambitions are to have a source of credit to better satisfy her clientele and to become a wholesaler in Kamalen Sirakoro.

Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase plastic shoes.

loans.name: Birugi

texts.en: Birugi N. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is married and has three children. All of her children are currently in school. For four years, Birugi has had a business of selling matooke. She also sells charcoal. To help expand her business, Birugi has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more matooke and charcoal. With the help of the loan, Birugi hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, Birugi hopes to see her children complete university. Birugi is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has improved her prospects for the future by increasing profit on her business.

loans.use: To buy more matooke and charcoal

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is a happy mother who has raised two children. They are now grown and live separately. Valentina is a successful entrepreneur from Kahovka, Kherson region in the south-east of Ukraine. She sells footwear in one of the local markets and she has been in this trade for 14 years. Economical crisis and high unemployment rates forced her to launch a small venture and to take the financial risks that come along with it. Valentina managed not only to survive in highly unfavorable surroundings but also to make her business sustainable. Currently, she has about 40,000 Grivnyas in stock. Her monthly net profit is little over 7,000 Grivnyas. 
	
Valentina says she is happy to be able to provide for her family and realize they have everything they need for normal life. Moreover, she enjoys working with people on a daily basis, learning to serve her customers better and getting more experience along the way. This time Valentina is requesting a 15,000 Gryvna loan to re-stock her inventory for the fall/winter season.

loans.use: To increase the merchandise assortment.

loans.name: Jimmy Jose

texts.es: El señor Jimmy José, tiene  42 años es casado y tiene cuatro hijos menores de edad. El se dedica a la fabricación de productos químicos, los cuales distribuye de manera ambulante y en su casa de habitación. Dio inicio a su negocio hace 15 años, es por medio de su Mama que logro aprender este negocio y fue así que más tarde decide hacerse cargo del negocio. También tiene un local que está localizado en el mercado en donde tiene una gran variedad de clientes. El crédito será invertido para aumentar su inventario y así elaborar más productos como vainilla, vinagre, frambuesa y otros. Su  principal sueño es ampliar más su vivienda.
texts.en:
Jimmy José is 42 years old, is married, and has four young children.  He makes chemical products which he distributes on foot and from his home.  He began his business 15 years ago.  He learned this work from his mother, and later he took charge of the business.  He also has a shop in the market, where he has a wide variety of customers.

The loan will be used to increase his inventory so he can make more products like vanilla, vinegar, raspberry and others.  His main dream is to add on to his house.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This borrower is 30 years old and single. The borrower graduated from preparatory school. He will use this loan to develop his  generator repair shop and to purchase spare parts. He can repair all kinds of generators. The borrower has a good reputation in the market and that has allowed him to attract lots of clients. The borrower has acquired a great deal of experience. He has become well-known in the market due to the good quality of his work in addition to his low prices.

loans.use: purchasing spare parts for generators

loans.name: Edison Efren

texts.es:
Edison de 19 años, tiene una tienda en donde vende accesorios de plásticos. Vive en una zona periurbana con todos los servicios básicos el lugar está ubicado en la Perimetral de Guayaquil zona rodeada de un estero.  

Con motivación de la mama y al verla que trabajaba muy duro para poder mantener la casa el decidió comenzar a vender vasos, cucharas y fundas plásticas a sus conocidos poco a poco y a pesar de su corta edad pudo tener un local con artículos plásticos. En la actualidad le hacen pedidos a Edison empresas para que les envíen los plásticos a un volumen más o menos alto. Vende fundas, vasos, platos, cucharas plásticas. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar utensilios plásticos, vasos, platos, cucharas para mejorar las ventas y así sus clientes tengan más variedad al comprar. En el futuro quiere comenzar a estudiar en la universidad contabilidad.
texts.en:
Edison, 19 years old, has a store where he sells plastic goods.  He lives in a peri-urban zone with all of the basic services.  This location on the perimeter of Guayaquil is surrounded by a marsh.  

With encouragement from his mother, and having watched her work very hard to keep their house, he decided to begin selling plastic cups, spoons and bowls to his acquaintances. Little by little, and in spite of his young age, he was able to obtain a store with plastic items.  Currently, businesses submit requests to Edison to deliver fairly large volumes of plastic goods.  He sells plastic bowls, cups, plates and spoons.

With the loan he wants to buy plastic utensils, cups, plates and spoons to improve his sales and give his customers more variety.  In the future he would like to begin studying accounting at the university.

loans.use: Plates, Bowls, Cups

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.fr: Née en 1975 à Adjohoun  dans l’ouémé au Bénin, G. Antoinette est mariée à YETONGNON Mahougnon. Antoinette est mère de trois enfants tous scolarisés. La famille vit depuis huit ans dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji au Bénin.  Le couple supporte ensemble les charges familiales. Antoinette exerce comme activité la vente de sac de maïs, de pain sucré à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. C’est également à Cotonou que Antoinette achète ses produits. Antoinette a été à l’école jusqu’au cours primaire et cela fait déjà cinq ans qu’elle mène cette activité. Antoinette a déjà bénéficié de trois crédits auprès de ALIDé qui ont tous été bien remboursés.  Antoinette désire renouveler sa marchandise et diversifier ses produits, c’est la raison pour laquelle elle souhaite obtenir un quatrième prêt à ALIDé. Antoinette voudrait plus tard augmenter son stock.
texts.en: Born in 1975 in Adjohoun in l’Ouémé in Bénin, Antoinette G. is married to Mahougnon Yetongnon. Antoinette is the mother of 3 children, all of whom attend school. The family has been living in the village of Sèmè-Podji in Bénin for eight years. The couple share household expenses. Antoinette sells bags of corn and sweet bread in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. Antoinette also stocks up in Cotonou. Antoinette attended school through elementary school and she has been selling her products for five years. Antoinette has already benefitted from three loans with ALIDé which were all repaid. Antoinette would like to replenish her stock and diversify her product offerings, which is why she seeks this fourth loan from ALIDé. Later, Antoinette would like to increase her stock.

loans.use: To buy a bag of corn, a box of fish, and some sweet bread

loans.name: Marlene Elizabeth

texts.es:
la joven Marlene P. tiene 30 años de edad, vive en el caserio el Obraje Namasigue Choluteca y se dedica a la venta de celulares, recargas, tarjetas de saldo y sim cards.
Marlene es una mujer dedicada a su negocio y es soltera, vive con su mama que tambien le ayuda a vender en su casa cuando ella sale a vender a diferentes lugares cercanos de su hogar.
Marlene vive en una zona muy productiva y muchas personas compran celulares por la facilidad que obtiene un numero de telefono rapido y sin mucho tramite.
sus tiempos libres los dedica a visitar a sus demas familiares.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de celulares, sim cards, tarjetas de pre pago y recargas.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir con sus gastos personales y ayudarle a su madre con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
The young Marlene P. is thirty and lives in the village of Obraje Namasigue Choluteca.  She earns her living selling cell phones, recharge minutes, prepaid cards and SIM cards.

She is a woman who is devoted to her business.  She's single and lives with her mother, who helps out by doing sales from home while Marlene is out vending in areas nearby.

Marlene lives in a very profitable area.  A lot of people buy cell phones because it's easy to obtain a phone number quickly and without going through much of a process.

Marlene uses her free time to visit relatives.  She plans to use her loan to buy phone cards, SIM cards, prepaid cards, and recharge minutes.  She needs the income to cover her personal expenses and to help her mother out with household expenses.

loans.use:
compra de celulares, sim cards, tarjetas de pre pago, recargas.
To buy cell phones, SIM cards, prepaid cards, and recharge minutes

loans.name: Mrs. Nao Chantha Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of twenty-two people living in Preaek Svay village in Kandal province. Mrs. Nao C. is the village bank president who has been selected by the other members.  The members will use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their family's living. 

Mrs. Nao C. is a Khmer noodle and congee seller in the local village.  With this business, she is able to earn some money to support her family.  Her husband, Mr. Oeun Uon, is a trailer and construction worker who also earns money to support his family. Her house is not comfortable to live in  because it is too old.  To improve her family's living conditions, Mrs. Nao C. is seeking a loan to rebuild her house. 

Mrs. Nao C. is a mother of five children, three are construction workers and the others are attending public school.

loans.use: To rebuild her house

loans.name: Martin Antonio

texts.es:
Don Martín Antonio Bustos trabaja como Higienista en el Mercado Oriental de Managua desde hace 10 años.
Es casado con 4 personas a su cargo, su esposa y tres hijos menores de 15 años, es decir en edad escolar. Su esposa trabaja como ama de casa. Solo cuentan con los ingresos del prestatario
Este es el crédito número 12 con CEPRODEL los que ha pagado en tiempo y forma ya que es una persona responsable. Este crédito lo necesita para mejora de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Martín Antonio Bustos has been working as a custodian in Managua's Western Market for the past 10 years.

He is married and supports four people; his wife and three young school-aged children.  His wife works as a housekeeper.  They are only able to count on the borrower's income.

This will be his 12th loan through CEPRODEL and he has repaid the previous ones responsibly and on time.  He needs this loan in order to make improvements to his home.

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es: Esteban O.  tiene 46 años, natural del distrito de San Francisco; esta  casado con la señora Esidora Quispe, de 42 años de edad,  fruto del inmenso amor que tuvieron concibieron 05 hijos; juntos viven en su propia casa  en la localidad de Carmen pampa anexo de San Francisco. Esteban, es campesino  sus padres le enseñaron este oficio desde muy niño,  viene trabajando en su propia chacra hace 20 años  donde cultiva los siguientes productos: cacao, café y plátano. En tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de su familia y los jornaleros. Sabe muy bien el dinero que obtiene es por producir buena calidad de frutos. Sus productos de cacao y café los comercializa  en la ciudad de San Francisco, puesto que es donde mejores precios le ofrecen por la calidad de sus granos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar los frutos, ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo no han sido en vano. En adelante, espera comprar nuevas tierras para aumentar su producción. Este es su 16avo crédito con MFP, siente que este aporte le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es muy querido por el resto de sus compañeros, ya que es muy solidario con ellos. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono y fertilizantes para mejorar la calidad de sus tierras.
texts.en: Esteban O. is 46 years old and originally from the district of San Francisco. He is married with Esidora Quispe, 42 years old, and the fruit of their immense love is their 5 children. They live together in their own home in the community of Carmen Pampa near San Francisco. Satan is an agriculturist and his parents taught him the business since he was a boy. He has been working his fields for 20 years, cultivating the following products: cocoa, coffee, and bananas. During the harvest season he depends on his family's support and that of hired laborers. He knows that his earnings directly depend on the quality of the harvest. He sells his cocoa and coffee harvest in the city of San Francisco where he gets the best prices for the quality of the grains. What he most enjoys about his work is the harvest because he is able to see that months’ worth of hard work have not been in vain. In the future he wants to buy more land to increase production. This is his 16th loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and it will be a great support in the progress of his business. He is very well liked by the other members of the communal bank, especially because he is united with them. With the two thousand nuevos soles he requests he will purchase more fertilizer to improve the quality of his fields.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers for his land.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman who owns a house that has electricity but not running water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. For the past ten years, Asha has operated a cashew nut selling business. She sells cashews at the market to her neighbors and community members. Her major business challenge is seasonality. 

Asha decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her livelihood. She is requesting a loan of 25,000 KES to purchase sacks of cashew nuts. In the future, Asha hopes to be a reliable supplier of cashews.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of cashews

loans.name: Epifania

texts.es: Epifania es madre soltera, tiene 28 años y vive con su hijo en su casa propia. Desde que era muy joven aprendió a trabajar en el campo, en el sembrado y cosecha de tubérculos y otros alimentos, y esto gracias a las técnicas que su padre le enseñó. Hoy esta actividad se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos económicos, desde entonces siembra papa, olluco, maíz y arveja, productos que tiene mucha demanda y que los ofrece también en su tienda. Manifiesta que le gusta mucho cultivar, porque es lo que mejor  que sabe hacer, aunque es algo sacrificado levantarse todos los días al amanecer, y vigilar con dedicación sus campos, sin embargo considera gratificante recoger la gran producción en temporada de cosecha, y vender todo a los mayoristas de la zona que le pagan regular dinero, permitiéndole ofrecer una buena calidad de vida a sus hijos. Como es una mujer muy emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado extender la siembra para así aumentar la producción, asimismo surtir su  tienda con productos variados, según indica, es un negocio muy rentable. Es su segundo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, y agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de mostradores para su tienda y también más mercadería en menestras como lentejas y fréjoles.
texts.en: Epifania, 28, is a single mother.  She lives with her son in her own house.  She learned farming when she was very young, planting and harvesting potatoes and other crops, all thanks to her father who was a farmer.  Farming has become her main source of income now.  She plants potatoes, olluco, maize and beans because there's a lot of demand for them.  She also sells what she grows in her own shop.  She says that she likes farming because it is what she knows best, even though it requires much sacrifice.  She has to get up at dawn every day to work her fields but it's worth the effort at harvest time.  She takes her crop to market and sells to the wholesalers there who pay her with real money!  She, in turn, uses the money to provide a better quality of life for her child.  Epifania is an enterprising woman and she wants to plant more crops in the future and increase her production.  She also wants to stock her store with various products because, she says, the business is very profitable.  This is Epifania's second MFP loan.  She has a history of replaying past loans on time and she is grateful for your help.  She will use the loan to buy products for her store that she will then resell.

loans.use: Buy products to resell and a display case for retail business.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia S. is from the village of Patawag, Liloy,Zamboanga del Norte. She is 51 years old. Lydia is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Lydia owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Lydia has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Lydia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lydia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lydia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es:
Evangelina nació en la ciudad del Cusco y tiene 41 años de edad. Actualmente, Evangelina vive en la ciudad imperial de los Incas y está casada y tiene dos hijos, ella y su esposo Alfredo tienen un pequeño negocio familiar que consiste en instalar vidriería a edificios. Ya son 15 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Evangelina participó de un concurso para obtener la administración del kiosco escolar del colegio Túpac Amaru de la ciudad del Cusco y gano, ella requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo dulces, galletas y otras cosas más.

Evangelina es una persona responsable que pertenece al banco comunal “Comuzone III” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en:
Evangelina was born in the city of Cusco and is 41 years old. Currently, Evangelina lives in the imperial city of the Incas, is married, and has 2 children. She and her husband, Alfredo, have a family business installing windows in buildings. They have been doing this for 15 years and it is going very well. Evangelina participated and won a contest to win the rights to run a snack kiosk in the Túpac Amaru school in the city of Cusco. She needs the loan to purchase merchandise such as candy, cookies, and other things that the kiosk will need. 

Evangelina is a responsible person who belongs to the community bank "Comuzone II" of the Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco, Perú.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, cookies, and others

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
La señora María Elena F. es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora de 31 años en el 2,000 inicio su pulpería con 500 córdobas compró unas chiverías (meneítos, platanitos, dulces, tortillerías, yuquitas, ranchitas, papas…etc.) y poco a poco fue creciendo.   
Ella tiene dos hijos de 12 y 9 años por los cuales trabaja arduamente y desea tener una miscelánea.
texts.en:
Maria Elena is a hard-working, striving, and enterprising woman of 31 who launched her small store in 2000. With just 500 cordobas she bought some snacks (including seven or more types of typical treats, candies, etc.), and little by little, her business grew.

Maria Elena has 2 children, ages 12 and 9, for whom she works arduously, and she hopes to have a general store.

loans.use: TO BUY BASIC GRAINS, MEAT, SNACKS, SOFT DRINKS, ETC., TO SELL

loans.name: Yesenia

texts.es:
Yesenia tiene 33 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia.

Desde hace 13 años vende artesanías que adquiere  comprando de los artesanos  de su localidad y luego lo lleva a vender a la ciudad de Lima a venderlas junto con su mama, su mercadería lo guarda en su estante,  de acuerdo a la temporada también lleva productos alimenticios nativos de su zona periódicamente cada 15 días de acuerdo a las temporadas de venta, tanto como las artesanías y los productos alimenticios. Este negocio le ha resultado ser rentable en sus ganancias porque ella compra al por mayor y vende al por menor además que tiene clientes fijos en el lugar donde viaja. Su deseo es incrementar su capital de trabajo.

Esa su crédito numero  7 que tiene con MFP, considera que su trabajo en su banco comunal es muy gratificante de la cual aprendió bastante sobre la importancia del ahorro y en este nuevo ciclo de trabajo con su grupo se compromete a seguir siendo puntual en sus pagos. 

El dinero lo invertirá en la compra de mas mercadería para aumentar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Yesenia is 33 years old and lives in a home of her own with her husband and two children.

She’s been selling art that she buys from local artists for the past 13 years.  She sells in Lima with her mother and keeps her merchandise on a shelf.  She also takes seasonal food items from her zone with her every two weeks.  This has turned out to be a profitable business for her because she buys wholesale and sells at retail and has steady customers where she goes.  She wants to increase her working capital.

This will be her seventh loan through MFP and she finds her work with the communal bank very satisfying.  She also learned about the importance of saving and she is committed to continue repaying on time during this new loan cycle.

She will use the money from this loan to buy more merchandise to increase her inventory.

loans.use: to increase her inventory

loans.name: Yerli

texts.es:
La señora Yerli es socia del banco comunal El Arenal del Distrito de Calleria, Departamento Ucayali.  Tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos, solo dos están a su cargo.
Lleva 4 años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos y tiene su negocio de venta de jugos y empanadas, negocio que realiza en su misma casa y no tiene la necesidad de salir. 
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 1 botella de esencia de vainilla, 1 caja de cerveza negra, ½ saco de azúcar, 5 docenas de huevo, 1 botellas de algarrobina, 1 caja de leche, 2 kilos de betarraga, 2 kilos de zanahoria, 5 kilos de manzana, 1 botella de miel de abeja, 1 sanguchera.
Su trabajo es de todos los días, pero la ventaja es que solo es hasta el medio día, tiene parte de las tardes para poder dedicarse a su casa y hacer las compras para el día siguiente.
Gracias a Manuela Ramos ha podido implementar su negocio, Yerli está muy agradecida por ello.
texts.en:
Sra. Yerli is a member of the Communal Bank “El Arenal” which is in the District of Calleria, Department of Ucayali. She is 44 years old, married, and has four children. Only two are still under her care.

Yerly has been working with Manuela Ramos for four years. She has a business selling juices and empanadas. Since she works from home, there is no need for her to leave.

With this new loan of 3000 PEN, she will buy the following items: one bottle of vanilla extract, one case of stout, a half sack of sugar, five dozen eggs, one bottle of carob flavoring, one case of milk, two kilos of beets, two kilos of carrots, five kilos of apples, one bottle of honey, and a waffle iron.

Yerly works every day, but only until noon. She takes advantage of her afternoons to take care of her home and to purchase supplies for the following day. Yerli is grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping her maintain her business and would like to express her thanks.

loans.use: to purchase vanilla extract, stout, sugar, eggs, carob flavoring, milk, beets, carrots, apples, honey, and a waffle iron.

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Crucita, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.

En este lugar conocimos a Modesta ella tiene 56 años de edad, es soltera y vive en casa de sus padres. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otros lugares y porque los créditos son rápidos y sin tantos requisitos.

Ella para obtener sus propios recursos se  dedica al comercio, vende  productos para el hogar como: (licuadoras, planchas, ventiladores, colchones, entre otros) a través de cartillas de la distribuidora La Gran Cadena, su forma de ventas es que ella compra todos los productos al contado para luego ir entregando los productos de acuerdo a como les toquen a sus clientes el turno, nos cuenta que ella lleva en este negocio por más de 15 años y que siempre le ha ido bien ya que tiene muchos clientes que la prefieren por la confianza que les ha brindado y por la responsabilidad a la hora de entregar los productos.

Este crédito es para comprar licuadoras, planchas, colchones, entre otros productos y artefactos.
 
Sus sueños son tener buena salud y seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
The members of “Crucita” communal bank meet in Portoviejo Canton’s Crucita Parish.  This location is known for the beautiful beaches that surround it that are very popular with national and foreign tourists.  It is known as “Crucita la Bella” (Crucita the Beautiful.)

We met Modesta, 56, here.  She’s single and lives in her parents’ house.  She is a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it because the interest rates are much lower than in other places and because the loans are quick with fewer requirements.

To earn her own income she is a merchant.  She sells items for the home like: blenders, irons, fans, mattresses, among others via distribution savings books from the La Gran Cadena distributorship.  The way she operates is this:  she buys all the items for cash and then sells them according to whose turn it is among her customers to receive them.  She tells us that she’s had this business for over 15 years and has always done well because she has many customers that prefer her because of the trust she’s inspired and the responsibility at the time of delivering the goods.

This loan is to buy blenders, irons and mattresses, among other products and appliances.  Her dream is to enjoy good health and continue working.

loans.use: to buy blenders, irons, mattresses, etc.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is 22 years old, married to Veronica, and the father of one child aged six years. Joshua has been selling motorcycle spare parts for the past five years and makes a monthly income of KES. 8,000.

Now applying for his first loan of KES.30,000 after being introduced to KADET LTD by a staff member, he plans to purchase motorcycle spare parts for sale. With the profits from the business he intends to service his current motorcycle and improve his parents' living standard. Joshua also hopes to educate his child, improve his family's living standard, and eventually own a car wash machine.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish.

loans.name: La Seriedad Group

texts.es:
Luz Benita es miembro del Grupo Solidario La Seriedad, es comerciante, tiene 43 años de edad, es madre soltera de cuatro hijos y junto a ellos reside en la Comunidad de San Nicolas. Muchos años atras su padre le prestó 500 lempiras y con eso compró algo de ropa de segunda mano para luego vendersela a sus vecinos, de sus ventas le quedaba algo de ganancia y volvia a comprar mercaderia. 

Despues de un tiempo se dio cuenta de FAMA y solicitó un prestamo el cual le fue otorgado y con eso pudo cambiar de negocio. Ahora Luz se dedica a la venta de condimentos, y aprendió de una de sus hermanas, ésta se dedicaba al negocio y le iba muy bien. 

Tres de sus cuatro hijos la ayudan a preparar los condimientos y luego ella sale a las Aldeas cercanas a venderlos, se transporta a jalon, sale a la calle y espera que alguien conocido pase y la lleve. Las ventas las realiza cada 15 dias pero en su casa vende de forma permanente. Sus mayores dificultades son el clima y que cuando no encuentra a nadie que le de jalon tiene que caminar grandes distancias. 

Con el apoyo del prestamo comprará condimentos como ser: achiote, especias, canela, clavos de olor, romero, linaza, y tambien comprar bolsitas, grapas para el empaque. Con el apoyo de este prestamo podrá surtir su negocio y espera que sus ventas aumenten. Su meta es seguir apoyando a sus hijos para que estos se graduen, dos de ellos ya lo hicieron gracias a su esfuerzo laboral. 

Luz es clienta de FAMA por 15 ciclos y es puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Luz Benita is a member of the La Seriedad communal bank. She is a 43-year-old shopkeeper and single mother of four children. She lives with her children in the community of San Nicolas. Many years ago her father lent her 500 lempiras and with that she bought some second hand clothing to later resell it to her neighbors. She made a profit from her sales and then bought more merchandise.  

After a while she became aware of FAMA and requested a loan which she was granted and with that she was able to change her business. Now Luz earns her living selling seasonings, which she learned from one of her sisters who was in the business and did very well. 

Three of her four children help her prepare the seasonings and later she goes out to the nearby villages to sell them. She travels by hitchhiking. She goes out to the street and waits until someone she knows passes by and picks her up. She makes her sales every 15 days but she also makes sales from her house permanently. Her biggest obstacles are the weather and, when she is unable to find a ride, having to walk long distances.

With the support of this loan she will buy seasonings such as annatto, spices, cinnamon, cloves, rosemary, linseed, as well as little bags and staples for packaging. She will be able to supply her business with the support of this loan and she hopes her sales increase. Her goal is to continue supporting her children so that they will graduate. Two of them already have graduated thanks to her effort. 

Luz has been a client of FAMA for 15 loan cycles and she is punctual with her repayments.

loans.use: to purchase seasonings.

loans.name: And Soukali Jeeguene Pire 24 Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de 5 membres qui habitent dans le village de Pire à cent km de DAKAR la capitale du Sénégal, leur activité principale est le commerce de produits agricoles  les tubercules de manioc. Elles sont expérimentées dans le domaine et disposent  d’une bonne  clientèle. Leur journée commence à 8 heures du matin et se  termine vers 20heures du soir. Avec ce financement elles comptent  acheter 100 sacs de manioc qu’elles vont revendre  au marché. Les revenus tirés de la vente du manioc leur permettra de renforcer leur commerce mais aussi de satisfaire les besoins de leurs enfants (paiement des frais de scolarité les frais médicaux et participer a l’entretien de la maison).
texts.en:
This is a group composed of five members who live in the village of Pire, 100 km from DAKAR, the capital of Senegal. Their main work involves commerce in farm products and cassava root. The group members are experienced in this domain and have a good customer base. The workday starts at 8:00 in the morning and ends around 8:00 at night. 

With this financing, the group members intend to buy 100 sacks of cassava that they are going to resell at the market. The revenues derived from the sale of cassava will enable them to bolster their business but also to satisfy the needs of their children (payment of school and medical fees and maintaining the house).

loans.use: to buy cassava, peanuts, and millet

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is 36 years old and married to Maureen. They have two school-going children. Philip has a retail shop. He is applying for his third loan from KADET LTD to enable him buy salad, sugar, cooking flour, bread and milk.

He hopes to see his business grow and own a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy salad, sugar, cooking flour, bread and milk

loans.name: Johnston

texts.en:
Johnston is a married man with three children. Two of his children attend school and the other is still too young. Johnston lives in a rented house with electricity but no running water and his greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. For the past two years, he has operated a boda boda (motorcycle) transport business. His potential customers are passersby and his major business challenge is the high cost of fuel. Johnston decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

Johnston is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to purchase another motorcycle and increase his income and savings. In the future, he dreams of purchasing more motorcycles.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es: La señora Rebeca y su esposo son una pareja muy estable, que desean que su pequeño hijo de 1 año no le falte nada, hacen lo posible para que tengan una vida digna. Desde hace 2 años viven en casa prestada de un familiar, por lo que ellos desean tener su propio patrimonio y en este momento se les presenta la oportunidad de enganchar un terreno a un precio accesible y pagos cómodos que no afecte la estabilidad económica de la familia. Rebeca quiere aprovechar la oportunidad ya que es la forma que iniciaría la construcción de lo que será su hogar, de esta manera le podrán ofrecer a su pequeño hijo un mejor patrimonio.
texts.en:
Sra. Rebeca and her husband are a very stable couple. They want their one-year-old son to not lack anything so that it is possible for him to have a decent life. For the past two years, they have lived in a rented house that belongs to a relative. They want to have their own property and have been presented with the opportunity to acquire a plot of land at an affordable price and with convenient payment options. This will not have a negative impact on the economic stability of their family.

Rebeca wants to take advantage of this opportunity to begin the construction of their home since it will allow them to provide an inheritance for their son.

loans.use: to acquire a plot of land for building a house.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is a seamstress and at the same time smokes fish for sale at Kukwa. She has received a junior-high education.  She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a mason. Ama has been smoking fish for 3 years now. She supports her husband in educating, feeding and clothing her children. 

Her loan will be used to buy extra batches of fish to smoke for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy extra batches of fish to smoke for resale.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.en:
This is Ma.Teresa, 45, resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. She is a single parent with three children. She, together with her children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Ma.Teresa operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She makes money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also sells electronic cell phone loads (prepaid cell phone credits) and offers direct-selling products to her customer. Her store is adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She has a minimum of PHP 400 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 11,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 

Ma.Teresa hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams to be able to give her children a high-quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is married and blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. She has been running a tailor shop for the last two years to earn a living. She has employed two people to help her manage the business. In the next 5 years, she wants to expand her business. 

Monica is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to buy fabrics and a sewing machine for her business. Thanks to to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to boost her business with the previous loan.

loans.use: buy fabrics and a sewing machine

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es: Verónica de 30 años de edad, convive con su pareja hace 12 años, en todo este tiempo ambos vieron nacer 4 hijos. Ahora el mayor tiene 11 años y el menor, 9 meses. Ella y su familia viven en casa de su madre. Verónica se dedica  a la compra y venta de ganados pero en poca cantidad. Ella tiene, 7 vacas, 3 chanchos, pero antes contaba con varias ovejas a las que vendía y sacaba buenas ganancias. Por problemas de mala administración y sobre-gastos, no pudieron comprar más de estos animales para continuar con el negocio. Así empezaron a sembrar papa, en las pequeñas parcelas que posee, de esa manera pudo pagar sus deudas. Considera que su negocio es rentable, “por cabeza ganaba  de 15 a 20 soles”, comenta. En el futuro, ella espera volver al ritmo anterior, y seguir con la venta de los carneros, administrar bien sus negocios y mandar a sus pequeños hijos a estudiar a la ciudad de Tarma y más adelante facilitarles una educación superior y profesional. Es la octava vez que ella trabaja con MFP. Está entusiasmada con las visiones que tiene, y que espera alcanzar gracias a su trabajo coordinado. Verónica comprará con su préstamo por lo menos 7 carneros pequeños, estima que cada uno de ellos costará 170 soles, los que al criarlos y engordarlos venderá a 190 ó 200 soles.
texts.en:
Verónica, 30, has lived with her spouse for 12 years.  In that time they’ve witnessed the birth of their four children.  Today, the oldest is 11 years old and the youngest is 9 months old.  She and her family live in her mother’s house.

Verónica is a small quantity livestock merchant.  She has 7 cows and 3 pigs.  She used to have several sheep that she’d sell and make good profits.  Because of poor administration and cost overruns she was unable to buy more of these animals to continue in business.  They started to grow potatoes on the small plots of land she has and was able to repay her debts that way.

She considers her business to be profitable.  “For each head I’d earn 15 to 20 soles,” she comments.  In the future she hopes to recover her previous rhythm and continue to sell sheep, to run her business well and to send her children to school in the city of Tarma and later on provide them with higher and professional education.

This is the 8th time she’s worked with MFP.  She’s excited with the vision she has and that she hopes to reach thanks to coordinated work.  Verónica will use her loan to buy at least 7 small lambs.  She estimates that each one will cost 170 soles which once grown and fattened up she will sell for 190 to 200 soles.

loans.use: to buy seven small calves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase the following items: 2 bales of cotton napkins @ 2,400,000 SLL, 1 bale of towels @ 1,080,000 SLL, and 10 dozen baby panties @ 450,000 SLL.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: El señor Juan es padre de familia de dos pequeñas entre 10 y 6 años que se encuentran estudiando en la primaria. Lo que más desea es ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida y una vivienda digna donde puedan vivir. El suegro de Juan le regalo un terreno para construyeran su casa por lo que se dio a la tarea de levantar los muros poco a poco hasta construir un cuarto y después otro, en este momento le queda pendiente enjarrar las paredes de la parte de afuera para que se vea mejor vista. Para poder realizar su proyecto necesita comprar cemento, arena y pagar la mano de obra.
texts.en: Juan is the father of two young children between the ages of 6 and 10, who are in primary school. What he wants most is to offer them a better quality of life and a proper home to live in. Juan's father-in-law gave him a piece of land to build a house, and so he set himself to the task of raising the walls bit by bit, building one room and then another. At this time, the next task is to plaster the walls on the outside so that the house will look better. To carry out this project, he needs to buy cement and sand and pay for labor.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to plaster the walls of his house.

loans.name: Jamilett Del Carmen

texts.es: Jamileth Del Carmen tiene 39 años, ella es oficinista en la alcaldía. Ella quiere realizar mejoras en su vivienda como que son terminar de construir dos cuartos que inicio. Ella no había podido realizar estas mejoras porque no tenía dinero suficiente. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de zinc, cemento, perlines, arena, piedras, alambre, tablas, material eléctrico entre otros productos. Sueña con terminar de construir su vivienda para sus 3 hijos que todavía están bajo su cargo.
texts.en: Jamileth Del Carmen is 39 years old and an office worker for the council.  She would like to make some improvements to her home and finish building two rooms that she started.  She hasn't been able to make these improvements because she didn't have enough money.  She will use this loan to buy metal sheets, cement, beams, sand, stone, wire, planks, electrical materials and other products.  She dreams of finishing her house for her three children who are still in her care.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets, cement, beams, sand, stone, wire, planks and electrical materials

loans.name: Hilario

texts.es: Hilario es casado tiene tres hijos y desde hace 7 años vive en una casa de interés social trabaja como operador de maquinas en una maquiladora de la localidad hace menos de un año el trabaja de 6:00 de la mañana a 4:00 de la tarde de lunes a viernes con lo que el gana no les alacanza a el y  a su familia para cubrir cubrir las necesidades  básicas del hogar y su esposa Gloria se vio en la necesidad de tener que buscar un empleo el cual le permitiera apoyar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar, para Hilario ha sido complicado el tener que cubrir la educación de sus hijos, los gastos de alimentación, el pago de servicios y hacerle las mejoras que requiere su hogar es por ello que solicitan el apoyo para pintar su casa por dentro y por fuera.
texts.en: Hilario is married, has 3 children and has lived in an environmentally friendly house for the last 7 years. He has worked for less than a year as a machine operator in a local components factory. He works from 6:00 in the morning until 4:00 in the aftrenoon from Monday to Friday. He does not earn enough to cover his and his familiy's basic household needs and his wife, Gloria, found it necessary to seek employment to allow her to suport her husband with the hosuehold expenses. Hilario has found it difficult to pay for his children's education, food, services and make the neccessary improvements his house needs. This is why they are asking for help to paint their house inside and out.

loans.use: to buy paint to improve his house.

loans.name: Rosa Ines

texts.es:
Rosa Inés cuenta con 31 años de edad es casada su esposo se llama David es policía estatal tiene 3 hijos los cuales están estudiando el mayor se llama Andrés y esta en la secundaria, laura itzel esta en la primaria y Maximiliano solo tiene 11 meses de edad.

Ella cuenta con un negocio de dulces su negocio ha ido creciendo porque ahora también ya vende abarrotes, e invertirá su préstamo en la compra de productos de abarrotes como son: aceites, arroz, fríjol, azúcar, leche, etc.

A doña rosa Inés le gustaría poner un local para ahí poner su tienda aun dice que no le pone nombre pero esta pensando en uno para así registrarla espera que el préstamo le ayudo a incrementar mas el negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa Inés is 31 years old and married.  Her husband is called David, and he is a state policeman.  She has three children who are are in school; the oldest is named Andrés and is in secondary school, Laura Itzel is in primary school, and Maximiliano is only 11 months old.

She has a business selling sweets.  Her business has grown because now she also sells groceries, and she will invest her loan in the purchase of grocery products such as oil, rice, noodles, sugar, milk, etc.

Doña Rosa Inés would like to have premises where she could have her store.  She says that she doesn't have a name for it, but she is thinking about one so that she can register it.  She hopes that the loan will help her to grow her business further.

loans.use: to purchase grocery products such as oil, rice, noodles, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Glenda Maricela

texts.es:
Glenda, es soltera, vive con sus padres y hermanos, se dedica a la venta de riguas, atol y además ropa, lleva tres años en el negocio, vende ropa por las mañanas de 8:00am a 1:00pm, por las tardes ofrece los antojitos como el atol y riguas desde las 3:00pm.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de pantalones, camisas, blusas, ropa interior, este crédito le ayudara para mejorar el negocio, ya que obtendrá más mercadería de nuevos estilos para los clientes.
Los sueños de Glenda es mantenerse en el negocio e ir creciendo poco a poco, logrando experiencia para poder ayudar a sus padres.
texts.en:
Glenda is single and lives with her parents and brothers. She sells riguas (corn patties cooked on a banana leaf), atol (cornstarch hot drink) and clothing. She has been in the business for three years, and sells her clothing in the mornings from 8:00 a.m. to 1:00 p.m. and in the afternoons she sells her treats like atol and riguas from 3:00 p.m.

Glenda needs the loan to buy pants, shirts, blouses, and underwear; this loan will help her improve the business since she will have more merchandize in new fashions for her customers.

Glenda’s dreams are to keep her businesses, and grow little by little and gaining experience to be able to help her parents.

loans.use: buy pants, shirts, blouses, and underwear.

loans.name: Dhanmanti

texts.en:
Dhanmanti is a 43-year-old woman. She is married and a mother of two sons and three daughters. 

For the past five years, she and her family members have been working in agriculture, which has been a profitable project. But they need more support to cover their costs. So Dhanmanti is requesting a. 20,000 NPR loan. The loan will help Dhanmanti purchase seasonal seedlings, seeds, and fertilizers. The loan will help them grow vegetables, which will provide income to live in better conditions.

loans.use: To expand the business.

loans.name: Eldo

texts.en:
Eldo and his family live a simple life in the city of Baybay, Leyte. He is a married man and a father of three children; they are 20, 18 and 15 years old. His wife stays home and takes good care of them. And Eldo supports them by doing the hog raising business.

Thus, he is 44 years old and plans to improve his business to be able to send his children to college. He dreams for them to finish their studies and have a good future someday. With this, he is asking for a loan to buy feed for them. In this way, he will be able to uplift his earnings.

loans.use: to buy feed

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en: Violeta is a 63-year-old woman from Calape, Bohol. She is a married woman with three adult children. To earn a living, she runs a hog raising business and a small sari-sari (variety) store. Violeta wants to improve these businesses in the future for their sustainability. With this, she is asking for a loan to buy feed for her pigs and grocery items such as drinks, coffee, sugar, biscuits, biscuits, bread, candies, spices and toiletries. In this way, she will be able to improve her store and enhance her profit.

loans.use: to buy feed; grocery items such as drinks, coffee, sugar, biscuits, biscuits, bread, candies, spices and toiletries

loans.name: Laura Isabel

texts.en:
Hi, my name is Laura. I have a small business making dairy products, located in my house for the past three years. This business generates income for my family and for the costs of educating my children. Right now I have one child in grammar school and another in high school. I have also been able to make improvements to my house.

Translated from Spanish by Ruth, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Laura, cuento con una pequeño negocio de productos lacteos,ubicado en mi casa de habitación, desde hace 3 años, actividad que me permimte generar ingresos para mis gastos familiares y gastos de estudio de mis hijos actualmente tengo en el colegio y el la Escuela, tambien he logrado hacerle mejoras a mi vivienda.

loans.use: To buy milk, salt, rennet, soap and wood.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson W. is 54 years old, is married and has 5 children. He also takes care of his two grandchildren, the children of his daughter. He decided to take up the responsibility of his grandchildren together with their mother (his daughter) since she had the two children out of wedlock. Rather than send his daughter away, he encouraged and cautioned her to take care of herself not to get another child until she is ready to take care of them. They live in Kayole, an informal settlement area within Nairobi. In addition, Mr. W. is a church pastor, and he also supports some of his church members.

Wilson has been a carpenter now for a period of four years and apart from that, he also does welding. He started by doing small contracts from schools within his community. It was not an easy start but he was driven by determination since he wanted to be involved in another activity besides being a pastor. He borrowed Ksh 20,000.00 (USD 285) from a friend and bought the basic items he needed in the carpentry workshop together with timber. He has been able to settle this loan with time and although he has had many difficulties, he has seen his business expanding through the many contracts he is getting. His major setback is the ability to deal with the growing number of contracts since his customers pay a minimal deposit, barely enough to enable him to make purchases for the requirements. He is now intending to make a set of desks and chairs for two schools within his community before schools reopen for the second term.

A loan of USD 900 is Wilson’s plea to enable him purchase a drilling machine, timber, block board, and the backs and seats for the chairs. These will go a long way in enabling him to make a wide range of quality furniture for his customers in order to attract additional customers, and to retain the existing ones, especially from the nearby schools. This will also enable him to gain additional income that will help him to support both his family and members of his church better. The repayment period of the loan is 15 – 18 months.

loans.use: Purchase of a drilling machine and carpentry materials

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy A. is a 42 year old woman who is married with five (5) children. She became a LAPO client in 2001 (7 years ago). She started the above businesses in 1995 in a semi urban area of Ubiaja of the Edo State of Nigeria.

She sells Farley used cloths to the community, and she is requesting $400 for business growth.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes for sales

loans.name: Luzmelia

texts.en:
Luzmelia is a Juliacan single mother. Her daughter, thirteen year old Kattia Lucero, is currently attending high school. Up until recently Luzmelia would sell food on the streets around the Plaza San Jose, some of the busiest streets in Juliaca. Luzmelia worked from 6:00 in the morning until 5:00 in the evening. As her sales continued to increase she opened her own restaurant “Restaurante Lucero”, naming it after her daughter who she considers the most important person in her life.

She currently does not prepare food at night because she does not have enough personnel. She plans to use the $500 loan towards renovating of a few tables and purchasing more silverware to be able to meet her increased demand. She hopes that with time and a lot of hard work, she will be able to open other locations in which she can continue to sell food. Her dream is to one day own her own restaurant chain not only in Juliaca, but also in cities like Puno that are fairly close.

loans.use: Expand restaurant capabilities by purchasing more silverware and repairing tables.

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
Mr. Lucio P. is 46 years old and lives with his companion María Larrosa. They have three children and even though they are still young and in school, they assist in a public school in the city. Lucio is very proud of his children, who are excellent kids and good students.

Lucio has a small grocery store at his house that María also helps to administer. Lucio provides delivery services and sells around the neighborhood to better accommodate his clients. After saving a little, they have been able to supply and increase their grocery store. They offer all types of consumer items such as pasta, milk, meat, vegetable, etc.

Thanks to the variety of their products and their hard work, they now need to expand the infrastructure of their business. They are seeking a loan of $600.

Translated from Spanish by Gabrielle Sham, Kiva Volunteer.

EL señor Lucio P. tiene 46 años, el vive en pareja con la señora María Larrosa y tienen tres hijos que están aún en edad escolar, asisten a un colegio público de la ciudad; Lucio nos cuenta que está muy orgulloso de sus hijos, ya que son excelentes hijos y buenos estudiantes. Lucio posee una despensa en su casa, que la atiende y administra junto con María. Lucio realiza entregas a domicilio y ventas por el barrio, dando así mayor comodidad a sus clientes. Luego de ahorrar un poco pudieron montar la despensa, y de a poco fue creciendo. En la misma ofrecen todo tipo de artículos de primera necesidad como fideos, leche, carne, verduras, etc. Gracias a la buena atención y la variedad de sus productos, hoy se ven obligados a ampliar la infraestructura del negocio, para ello solicitan un crédito de $ 600.

loans.use: Expand the infrastructure of their business.

loans.name: Karidja

texts.en:
O. Karidja is a dynamic and courageous 33 year old woman. She is a widow who lost her husband last year (2006) in dramatic circumstances. She has 2 children, one in secondary school and the other in primary school. Karidja has been able to overcome the difficulties and hardships she faces and has retaken control of her life.

She takes care of her children and has continued developing her microbusiness. She has a clothing sales store in Adjamé-Forum market in the north of the Abidjan district. She is ambitious and manages her activities well. She requested the loan to purchase women's fashion clothes in time for the end-of-year celebrations and festivities.

loans.use: Ouattara Karidja will use the loan to purchase goods

loans.name: Bernadetha

texts.en:
Bernadetha M. is 59 years old and raises cattle and chickens in the rural town of Maili Moja. Both are good investments, because they yield short and long-term profits: long-term, from the sale of the whole animal and short-term, from the sale of milk and eggs. Bernadetha requires a loan of $450 to purchase additional chicks to raise and sell. She is a single mother, and her business allows her to support her four children.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania, where customs and traditions normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Because they lack tangible collateral assets, women are considered not credit-worthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low income.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA buys equipment and leases it to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from her, extending her a loan, and then leases the same equipment back to her – a process called "sale and leaseback".

loans.use: To purchase additional livestock (cows and chickens).

loans.name: Nora

texts.en: Nora is into the sale of clothing. She is 35 years old, married with 2 children. She has been a LAPO member for 2 years. She needs the loan amount of $275 to enable her to buy more clothing to sell. She has been in this business since 2002.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell

loans.name: Shahlo

texts.en:
K. Shahlo is 37 years old. She is married with three children.

Shahlo sells such goods as batteries, blades, machine twists and threads, pens and other goods. She has been in this business for 13 years. Shahlo's husband helps and supports her always. Like any mother, Shahlo dreams that her kids will have higher education, and that is why she is working hard. The business is successful, bringing considerable income to the family.

Shahlo wants to expand her business and increase working capital in order to purchase new goods for selling. For this purpose she requests 2100.00 Somoni (625.00 US dollars) for the term of 4 months. Having received IMON loans several times already and having demonstrated herself as a good client, Shahlo promises to manage this loan with accuracy.

loans.use: Expanding business and increasing the working capital for purchasing new goods.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary U. hails from Edo State, Nigeria. She is married with 5 children. Mary is 56 years old.

Mary sells drinks and provisions to earn a living. She has been in business since 2002. She needs the loan of $350 so she can buy more provisions and drinks to sell.

loans.use: To buy provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is seventy-five years old. She a widow with three children and three grandchildren. She has been selling charcoal, palm oil and palm kernel oil for ten years.

Victoria wants to use her new loan to buy more oils and charcoal, because the demand for her products are high.

She is a member of the group called Maranatha. Group members use peer pressure as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more oil and charcoal.

loans.name: Willca Calixta De

texts.es:
Calixta and her husband own their home, where they live with their three children, ages 14, 8, and 3. The two older children attend public school. Calixta sells cosmetics and home remedies and her husband works as a bus driver. Calixta has two carts that she uses to display a variety of cosmetics and home remedies, usually at the bus stop.

Calixta has been in this business for 10 years, and is now competent her field. However, her success is also dependent on the success of her husband in his respective field and above all their joint work at the bus stop. Calixta will buy shampoo, perfumes, soaps, lanterns, and home remedies in bulk and then sell them individually. This is her 12th loan from the Fundación and she and her husband have proven themselves to be responsible people and punctual in their payments.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Calixta y su esposo cuentan con un domicilio propio, tienen tres hijos de 14, 8, y 3 años respectivamente, actualmente los dos mayores estan estudiando en una escuela fiscal. Calixta se dedica al comercio de cosméticos y chiflería y su esposo se dedica al transporte de pasajeros en su vagoneta en Montero. calixta cuenta con dos carritos donde tiene un surtido de productos de cosméticos y chiflería, generalmente se ubica en las paradas de los micros para poder vender, ella realiza esta actividad desde hace más de 10 años atras. Existe competencia en el rubro, sin embargo el éxito se concentra en la experiencia que ambos tienen en sus respectivos rubros y sobre todo su consolidación frente a la parada de micros. Calizta comprará shampoo, perfumes, jaboncillos, linternas y demás artículos de chiflería, estos los comprará por docenas para venderlos por unidad. Este es el 12avo crédito en la Fundación y en este tiempo de trabajo demostraron ser personas responsables y puntuales en sus pagos.

loans.use: Operating capital to buy cosmetic supplies

loans.name: Augusto César

texts.es:
Augusto Cesar is 27 years old, lives in the neighborhood Hialeah in Managua. He is married and has two children, a boy and a girl. His wife is a housewife and is the one that takes care of the home and their two small children.

Augusto Cesar makes a living buying and selling recyclable products. Two years ago his search for a business that would generate income started him in the buying and selling of recyclable materials. Thanks to his good management skills, this business has done well.

He needs the loan to purchase recycled products from people that sell them, in order to later resell them. He hopes to continue and grow his business, increasing the quantity of products that he buys and sells.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Augusto César tiene 27 años de edad, habita en el barrio Hialeah de Managua, es casado y tiene 2 hijos un niño y una niña. Su esposa es ama de casa, y es quien se encarga del cuido del hogar y de sus dos pequeños hijos.

Augusto César se dedica a la compra y venta de productos de reciclaje. Hace 2 años en busca de un negocio que le generara ingresos, empezó con la compra y venta de productos de reciclaje, le ha ido bien en su negocio, gracias a su buena administración.

Requiere del préstamo para adquirir productos reciclados de las personas que se lo venden, para él despues venderlos. Espera poder seguir con su negocio y que éste crezca en cantidad de productos de sus compras y ventas.

loans.use: Acquire products that can be recycled to increase his sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more beauty products for her shop

loans.name: Ni Made Indriani

texts.id:
Life in the village is not busy, but this doesn't steer Indriani away from opening her convenient kiosk. With renewed spirit everyday, Indriani left her home by 5:00 am to the market to buy her inventory. With an initial capital of $107, Indriani completes her convenient kiosk with snacks, drinks and everyday household supplies. Indriani's kiosk is open from 6:00 am to 6:00 pm. The profit that she earns is used to help her husband, Nengah Yudiartama, who has his own business. Indriani also uses her profits to meet her financial needs and pay for her children's elementary school and kindergarten tuitions. Her house is built on a land that they purchased with quite solid structure. This loan from DINARI will be used to add her business capital and expand her business.

Translated by Joan, Kiva Volunteer.

Kehidupan didesa memang tidak begitu ramai, tetapi tidak membuat Indriani putus asa untuk membuka usaha warung. Dengan semangat baru setiap harinya, pukul 05.00 pagi, Indriani sudah pergi kepasar untuk membeli bahan dagangannya. Dengan modal awal Rp.1.000.000, Indriani melengkapi isi warungnya dengan bermacam-macam barang dagangan seperti makanan ringan, minuman ringan dan kebutuhan keluarga sehari – hari.. Indriani membuka warungnya pada pagi hari pukul 06.00 pagi dan tutup pada pukul 06.00 sore. Keuntungan yang didapatnya dipakai untuk membantu suaminya, Nengah Yudiartama, yang bekerja sebagai wiraswasta. Keuntungan itu juga dipergunakan untuk memenuhi kebutuhan ekonominya dan juga untuk pendidikan anak-anaknya yang masih sekolah SD dan yang kecil masih TK. Rumahnya dibangun ditanah sendiri dengan bangunan yang cukup permanen. Pinjaman Dinari dipakai untuk menambah modal usaha dan mengembangkan usahanya.

loans.use: To buy more inventory and display racks

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es:
La Sra. María Antonia y su Esposo José Luis quieren que sus hijos tengo lo mejor para la escuela es por eso que están solicitando un préstamo para comprar les una computadora para que no tengo problemas al realizar los trabajos que les encarga en la escuela. 
La Sra. María es la que se encarga de la familia mientras que el Sr. José trabaja en una compañía que se dedican a la exportación de mercancía en la republica Mexicana el Sr. José esta en el puesta de tramitador y documentados, esté es le ingreso que tiene para sacar a su familia adelante y quiere que sus hijos tengan el mejor estudio para su futoro.
La Sra. María Antonia no cuenta con el dinero para comprar la computadora que necesitan sus hijos es por eso que se acerco a Fvp y a  Kiva para solicitando un préstamo de $475.00 dlls.
texts.en:
Mrs.Maria Antonia and her husband Jose Luis want their children to have the best for school and that is why they are requesting a loan to purchase a computer, so that the children do not have any problems completing the work that is assigned to them at school.

Mrs. Maria is the one that is in charge of the children while Mr. Jose works at a company dedicated to exporting merchandise in Mexico. Mr. Jose has the job of processing documents and this is the income that he has to move the family ahead. He wants his children to have the best education for their future.

Mrs. Maria Antonia does not have the money to buy the computer that her children need, and that is the reason for her turning to Fvp and Kiva to request a loan of USD $475.


Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a computer for her children.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac T. is a 36-year-old business man. He is married with one kid and very dedicated to his work. He owns and operates a grocery shop and sells bulk and retail items like rice, evaporated milk, canned foods and drinks, assorted cooking oil, washing powder, toilet soaps, candies, biscuits, etc. in the local market of Suhum in Koforidua of the Eastern region. Isaac supports his family with proceeds from his business. He wants to use the loan to buy bulk supply of rice, canned foods and drinks, milk, assorted food spices, washing soaps and powders, etc. to expand his business. Isaac hopes to save more towards his kid's education.

He belongs to the community group called 'Biako Ye Trust Group'. The group members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans on time. His picture was taken after his group meeting.

loans.use: To more bags of rice, canned foods and drinks, milk, assorted food spices, washing soaps and powders, cartons of sardines, carton of canned beef etc.

loans.name: Sabiha

texts.en: Sabiha was born in 1953. She lives in Graučanica, a small village in Bosnia.  She is married and runs a cleaning service with her husband, which earns about 500KM/month (about $330 USD). Sabiha has an adult son, who continues to live in her home. The income from the cleaning service is not enough to sustain her family, so Sabiha also raises cows, selling the milk and milk products at a local market. Sabiha hopes to focus her time on raising cows, as she is getting too old for the manual labor required by the cleaning business. She requests a loan of 600KM from Women for Women, International, which she will use to buy a calf.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Lidia Candelaria

texts.es: La Señora Lidia S. de 27 años de edad,  Casada de oficios Tejedora, “Compra y Venta de Ropa de vestir” cuenta con un pequeño Negocio,  habita conjuntamente con su esposo e hijos,  desde tres años se dedica al comercio gracias a los Préstamos a podido llevar a su familia adelante donde es persona muy conocida, y su residencia en el Paraje Choescuela del Cantón Juchanep del municipio y departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala. Donde ha llegado a Solicitar a la Asociación Asdir un financiamiento para la compra y venta de Ropa de Vestir para dicha artesanía para facilitar y poder cubrir la demanda a su clientela y así poder darle mejore condiciones de vida a su familia
texts.en:
Señora Lidia S. is a 27-year-old married weaver. She has a small business buying and selling clothing. She lives with her husband and children. For three years, she has been a wholesalerthanks to the loans which allow her to carry her family forward. She is well-known and lives in Paraje Choescuela Canton Juchanep in the city and department of Totonicapan, Guatemala. She has come to ask Association Asdir for financing the purchase and sale of clothing to facilitate and to meet the demand of her customers and thus have the opportunity to provide improved living conditions for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase and sale of clothing

loans.name: Yan

texts.en: Mrs. Yan N. is a villager in Samnak Thboung village in Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Ngem Yoeung, is a cow breeder. Since his cow-breeding business is going well, he wants to expand it; thus, Mrs. Yan N. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to raise. She is a 58-year-old and the mother of three children, one of whom is a construction worker while the other two are employed in a garment factory. Her husband is also in the picture.

loans.use: to buy a cow to raise

loans.name: Laurencio

texts.es:
EL señor Laurencio S.  trabaja como taxi desde hace ya mas de treinta años el cual es su ingreso familiar.
Horita tiene un problema que su automóvil necesita unas reparaciones mecánicas pero no cuenta con el capital necesaria para poder reparar el carro.
 Esta solicitando su cooperación para poder arreglar su automóvil y así poder trabajar sin ninguna preocupación.
texts.en:
Mr. Laurencio S. has been working as a taxi cab driver for more than thirty years now. This job is his family’s source of income.

His current problem is that his vehicle needs to have some repairs, but he does not have the funds necessary to carry out those repairs. He is requesting your cooperation so that he can fix his taxi cab and continue to work without any worries.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair taxi cab

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es:
Empezó trabajando para otra persona en la galería de ropa más grande de la ciudad,  eventualmente sigue apoyando con sus servicios cuando tiene tiempo y en temporadas de ventas fuertes (como Navidad o día de la madre). Luego de más de quince años de haberse dedicado a este trabajo decidió independizarse.

Contando solo con sus conocimientos de confección personalizada y de confección industrial, además de una pequeña máquina de coser, ambientó un pequeño taller en su casa.
