En el cual ya tiene seis años produciendo polares y ropa de verano. Ella se encarga de mantener los gastos básicos de su casa y también a sus tres hijos. Solo de vez en cuando su ex esposo le da ayuda mínima.

Lo que más quisiera ella es comprar una máquina industrial para así poder producir mayores cantidad de prendas.
texts.en:
María began working for another person in the largest clothing store in the city and she continues supporting this person with her services when she has time and during high sales periods such as Christmas and Mother’s Day. After more than fifteen years of working as a seamstress she has decided to become an independent businesswoman.

Relying only on her knowledge of personalized tailoring, the tailoring industry and a small sewing machine she set up a small workshop in her home. She has run a business producing sweatshirts and summer clothing for six years. She sees to the expenses of her household and of her three children. Her ex-husband will only give her minimal help on occasion.

What she wants the most is to be able to buy an industrial sewing machine so that she can produce greater quantities of garments.

Translated from Spanish by Breanne Kochert, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of fabric.

loans.name: Chadulu K Group

texts.en:
Hadija has owned a small food vendor store in the Ipagala neighborhood of Dodoma for 5 years. She currently makes an average monthly profit of $175. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.  She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more food items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business, improve her home and pay school fees for her children.  


Hadija is 48 years old, married, and has four children between 12  and 28 years old. She also cares for one additional dependent. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Nelly, Mary and Emmy.Each woman also has her own small business in Dodoma.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice M. is married with 3 children and has no formal education. Beatrice has sold fish since 1999. She purchases fish from the fishermen, brings them home for processing and preservation, and then sends them to the market for sale at Bantama in Elmina. Her husband also works in the fish industry as a fisherman.

Beatrice uses her income to support her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family. Beatrice will use the loan to increase her capital to enable her to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Beatrice plans to reinvest to increase the expansion of her trade.

loans.use: To increase her capital to enable her to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale.

loans.name: Justine

texts.fr:
A. Justine est née vers 1970. Justine est mariée mais elle n'a pas encore d'enfant. Justine réside au quartier AKPAKPA dans la ville de Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin; où elle exerce son activité de vente de maïs. Justine s’approvisionne en maïs à l’intérieur du pays dans les marchés locaux du Bénin. Justine a besoin de plus de moyens financiers qu'elle n'en a aujourd'hui pour faire fasse à la demande de ses clients. C'est pourquoi Justine demande de crédit à ALIDé. 


 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
Justine A. was born around 1970 and is married, as yet without children. She lives in the Akpakpa area of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, where she makes a living selling corn. She gets her corn supplies at local markets in Benin. Justine needs greater financial resources than she currently has in order to meet customer demand, which is why she is requesting this loan from ALIDé. ALIDé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Fon, a regional language in Benin. Benin is a small West African country next to Nigeria with a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn sacks

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Mademoiselle  sassou afi habite le quartier d’adidogimé, pour subvenir à ses propres besoins elle a appris le métier de la coiffure et a ouvert en 2001 son atelier de coiffure, à ce métier elle a ajouté la vente de mèches, perruques et de tissages qu’elle vend à ses clients. Son stock de mèches est épuisé, elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour renouveler son stock de mèches, perruques et tissages.
texts.en:
Miss Afi Sassou lives in the Adidogomé district. To meet her own needs, she trained to become a hairstylist and opened her own hair salon in 2001. In addition to this work, she sells hair extensions, wigs, and hair weaves to her customers. Her stock of hair extensions is depleted, so she is seeking (through WAGES) her first loan to renew her supplies of hair extensions, wigs, and hair weaves.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hair extensions and hair weaves

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is 42 years old and married with five children. She sells sarongs and laces in Uselu market in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She hopes for a loan of N70,000 to purchase more sarongs and laces to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders

loans.use: Purchase sarongs and laces to resell

loans.name: Obdulia

texts.en:
Obdulia helped support her family with an office job in electronics while her husband worked as a car mechanic.  When Obdulia was laid off, she saw an opportunity to combine her office experience with her husband’s automotive skills.  Using their savings, they opened Family Auto Repair together in 2007.  But their savings were not enough to cover essential tools and advertising, and Obdulia’s application for a bank line of credit was denied, leaving them unable to make key investments in their business.
A $10,000 loan enables Obdulia to build her business because she will be able to pay for the tools they need and advertise Family Auto Repair’s services to the community.

loans.use: Tools, equipment, and advertising

loans.name: Olena

texts.en:
Olena is married. She sells various cosmetic items at a market in Kherson city. Olena started this business about 10 years ago. At that time she lost her job and needed a source of income. She knew some friends who already were involved in a sales business. She decided to try and the attempt was successful!

Today Olena has many customers and always offers them good quality products at affordable prices. Olena would like to borrow 15,240 UAH to increase her assortment. She has tried small business loans several times and has found them to be a good aid for her business.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of cosmetics

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 48 years old and is married with one child who is currently in school. She lives at Sefwi Bekwai in the Western Region of Ghana.

Beatrice is a petty trader and, for eight years now, has sold items like salt, ginger, spices, shear butter, etc. in taking care of the home (shear butter, or shea butter, is a popular natural face and hair cream and is also used as a cooking oil in West Africa). She works very hard to sustain her business growth and also to take care of her child who is in school. She sells at the community market where she lives.

Beatrice complains that business is doing well but that she needs the loan facility to upgrade her inventory. With the loan, she would buy salt, shear butter, ginger, etc. in bulk for retail to her customers. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy salt, ginger, spices, etc. in bulk

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe M. is from the village of Puntod Lopez Jaena Misamis Occidental. She is 41 years old. Fe is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Fe owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, fishing and selling of fish. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting and selling wild-caught fish to local community members. Fe has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Fe joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Fe is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Fe from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine B. is from the village of Barangay 3, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 45 years old. Josephine is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Josephine owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store selling a variety of different products including viands in the local community. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Josephine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Josephine from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income and support her children's education. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
La señora Fortunata es socia del Banco Comunal “Manuela de Hoy II”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Camicachi de el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 55 años de edad, estado civil casada y madre de 6 hijos (3 a su cargo), Fortunata no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, ella  vive en la comunidad de Urani Marca Kollo.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 1 año, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo utilizo en la compra de ganado menor. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1400.00 Nuevos soles, para invertirlo en la compra ganado menor ovino para engorde, luego los venderá en las ferias semanales.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le gustan los ahorros.
texts.en:
Fortunata is a member of the communal bank "Manuela de Hoy II," which is located in Camicachi in the Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno. She is 55 years old, married, and is the mother of 6 children (3 currently in her care). Fortunata did not have the opportunity to study, she lives in the community of Urani Mara Kollo. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos organization for a year, her initial loan was for 300 nuevos soles, and was used to purchase livestock. She currently needs a loan of 1,400 nuevos soles to invest in the purchase of sheep that she will fatten, and later will sell in the weekly market. Her desire is to keep working, and she enjoys saving money.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep to fatten up

loans.name: Battumur

texts.en: C. Battumur is 50 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. His oldest daughter currently attends university, his youngest daughter is in kindergarten, and his teenage son attends a local secondary school. He operates a small wooden products production business in his town. Battumur started his wood products business in 2008 with capital of 200,000 tugrugs (~140 USD). By managing and conducting his business successfully, he has been able to achieve stable operations in a short time. Today, his working capital exceeds 600,000 tugrugs (~420 USD). He has used the success of his business to greatly improve his quality of life. For the future, Battumur hopes to improve the quality and increase the variety of wood products he produces. He hopes his future success will enable him to purchase a car that he will use in his business. He is requesting a 900,000 tugrug (~630 USD) loan to buy more wood for his business.

loans.use: to buy more wood for his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat de pièces détachées

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase sewing machines and work materials

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is forty-three years old. She is married and has three children, all of whom attend school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in the town of Kade in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She works hard to help her husband provide for the family. 

Lucy is a trader. She runs a drug store by the roadside in her community. She buys the drugs from vans that distribute them in her area. She has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to buy all kinds of drugs to increase her stock.

loans.use: To buy drugs for her drug store

loans.name: Rosa Gerardina

texts.es:
El banco comunal El Cisne se encuentra en la  hermosa parroquia El Valle al  suroeste de la Ciudad de Cuenca, siendo famosa por su producción agrícola como maíz, papas, etc., sus atractivos turísticos como la laguna de Cochapamba que se encuentra llena de totoras (plantas para hacer esteras, sombreros, adornos), la colina de Tasqui que nos brinda una hermosa vista de la parroquia y de la ciudad de entera y su gente muy cálida y amable.
 
La señora Rosa L. es una de las socias fundadoras de éste banco, ella vive en la comunidad  San Miguel en la parroquia el Valle en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 32 años de edad, se encuentra casada y en su unión matrimonial procreó cinco  hijos de 18, 16, 14, 5, 1 año, su primer y tercer hijo estudian en el colegio Técnico Salesiano,  su segunda hija se graduó en una academia de corte y confección ya trabaja y aporta económicamente para los gastos de la casa, su penúltimo hijo estudia en el jardín de infantes San Miguel. Su esposo trabaja como albañil profesión que le ha permitido salir adelante con su familia, lo más gratificante del esfuerzo de su trabajo es tener su casa propia.

Rosa trabaja criando animales como pollos, chanchos y cuyes hace  ya varios años, sus animales los vende en su comunidad y en las ferias de la localidad, lleva 19 ciclos trabajando con la fundación y los créditos obtenidos le han  beneficiado tanto en su hogar  como en su  negocio, con el nuevo préstamo solicitado va a comprar más pollos y cuyes que son de rápido crecimiento así como alimento para los mismos.

Su meta es ir incrementando poco a poco otros animales para su criadero y salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
The Swan Communal Bank is located in the beautiful parish of El Valle in southwestern Cuenca. This area is famous for its agricultural production of corn, potatoes, and other crops. Tourist attractions such as the Cochapamba Lagoon are filled with reeds used for making mats, hats, and decorations. Tasqui Hill provides a beautiful view of the parish and the entire city of Cuenca. The people are very warm and friendly.

Sra. Rosa L. is one of the founding members of this Communal Bank. She lives in the community of San Miguel in the El Valle Parish of Cuenca. She is 32 years old, married, and has 5 children ranging in age from 1 to 18. Her two oldest sons (the first and third children) are students at the Salesiano Technical School. Her oldest daughter (the second child) graduated from a sewing academy and now works in order to contribute to the household expenses. The second youngest child attends kindergarten in San Miguel. Her husband works as a bricklayer, which has helped her family get ahead. The most gratifying result of her hard work is being able to own a home.

Rosa raises animals such as chickens, pigs, and guinea pigs. She has been engaged in this business for several years and sells her animals in the community and at local fairs. Rosa has worked with the Foundation on 19 previous loan cycles. The funding she has received has benefited her home and her business. With this new loan, she will buy more chickens and guinea pigs since they grow faster. She will also purchase feed for the animals. Her goal is to gradually increase the number of other animals that she raises so that her family can get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chickens, guinea pigs, and feed

loans.name: Mayra Concepcion

texts.en: Mayra opened her beauty shop seven years ago because she recognized that there was a great demand for these services and it could be a profitable business. She will use her loan to buy cosmetics and products that she needs for styling hair. Mayra has a good credit history with Fundación León 2000 and she says that her loans have been of help in supporting her business. Mayra says that cosmetics sales have been slow lately. Mayra’s dream is to build her own house. She isn’t married and has two children, ages six and nine.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and hair styling products

loans.name: Rescate Group

texts.es:
Costura de polleras, tejido de prendas de vestir, producción de muebles y venta de fruta, son los diversos negocios de las integrantes del grupo Rescate que pertenece al Centro Focal German Busch, un ejemplo claro es Irma Q. de 22 años que trabaja hace 1 año costurando prendas de vestir y desea fortalecer su negocio comprando tela, otro ejemplo es Ema A. de 40 años, que desea iniciar un nuevo negocio como la  venda de fruta.
Los 8 integrantes de Rescate están esperanzados en mejorar sus negocios y por lo tanto mejorar su calidad de vida para ellas y sus familias.
texts.en:
Sewing, weaving, furniture making, and fruit sales are the diverse businesses of the members of the Rescate group of the German Busch regional center of Pro Mujer.

A good example is Irma Q., 22 years old, who has been working for the last year making clothing and wants to build her business by buying cloth. Another example is Ema A., 40 years old, who wants to start a new business selling fruit.

The eight members of Rescate are hopeful they can improve their businesses thus improve the quality of life for themselves and their families.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials and merchandise

loans.name: Rosa Yolanda

texts.es:
La señora Rosa V.  es socia del  Banco Comunal Avenida del Ejercito en la ciudad de Portoviejo desde hace ocho ciclos, ella es  madre soltera de cuatro hijos que ya son casados e independientes,  a sus 50 años Rosa  se dedica a la venta de comida rápida, su  negocio lo tiene en su propia casa  aquí ofrece  carne, alitas de pollo asadas, sanduches y colas, este negocio lo inició hace cuatro años,  pero también vende  confites en una escuela cerca de  su casa durante la mañana y por las tardes se dedica a su negocio de comida rápida.

 Rosa es independiente puesto que sola se encarga de su negocio, a pesar de su edad ella tiene muchas ganas de seguir trabajando y  su mayor sueño es mantener una  buena salud para seguir adelante,  nos comenta que su negocio  se mantiene estable gracias  a los créditos recibidos de  la fundación y  con este nuevo préstamo surtirá sus negocios con  pan,  colas, confites y carnes para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes ya que ella invierte  diario 20 dólares o más.
texts.en:
Rosa V., 50, has been a member of the Avenida del Ejercito communal bank in Portoviejo for 8 cycles now. She is a single mother of four children, all of whom are married and independent. She sells fast food from her home. She offers meat, broiled chicken wings, sandwiches and colas. She began this work four years ago but she also sells sweets at a school near her home during the mornings and in the afternoons she tends to her fast food business. Rosa is independent in that she alone tends to her business. Despite her age, she is eager to continue working and her greatest wish is to maintain good health so that she can carry on. She comments that her business has persevered thanks to the loans she has received from the Foundation. This new loan will be used to stock her business with such items as: bread, colas, sweets and meats so as to provide better customer service; she invests 20 or more dollars into her business daily.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bread, colas, sweets and meats to stock her store.

loans.name: Ángela María

texts.es:
Muy alegremente y con gran entusiasmo, en el municipio de Nagarote la señora Angela C. se dedica a su actividad de elaboración de tortillas las que son preparadas por ella misma y comercializadas a diario desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana.

Ella es casada y con un hijo que mantener y también tiene un nieto que mantener por lo que está solicitando un crédito para la compra de la materia prima como lo es la leña y cuatro quintales de maíz para continuar elaborando las riquísimas tortillas.
texts.en:
Very happily and with great enthusiasm, in the town of Nagarote, Señora Angela C. works making tortillas. She prepares them herself and sells daily, starting in the very early hours of the morning. She is married and has one son to take care of. She also cares for a grandson so she is requesting a loan to buy basic materials like firewood and four 100 pound sacks of corn to continue making her very rich tortillas.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn and firewood to make tortillas

loans.name: Esperanza Divina 2, 3 Group

texts.en:
Dorka is the coordinator of her group, Esperanza Divina (Divine Hope), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in Hato Mayor, an agricultural area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple structure as a single mother with her child.

Dorka is excited to be taking out her seventh loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling clothing by purchasing more merchandise to sell such as jeans, blouses and underwear. She also plans to buy a glass display case.

Dorka will use the profits to invest in her family by purchasing school supplies for her children, by refurbishing her home, and by purchasing high-quality fertilizer so that she can grow vegetables in her backyard. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy blue jeans, blouses and underwear to sell

loans.name: Barclay Farm United Group

texts.en:
F. G. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Barclay Farm United.  He is 26 years old, married, and has two girls.  One of his girls is six years old and is in the 1st grade, the other is 3 months old.  F. and his family live in the Barclay Farm Community in Harbel, about 40 miles from the capital of Liberia, Monrovia.  He also helps care for two of his siblings who live with him, and regularly sends money to his parents who are farmers in Lofa County in northwest Liberia.

F. currently attends night school, and is enrolled in the 11th grade.  His education was interrupted by the Liberian civil war, when his family went to neighboring Guinea to escape the fighting.  He sells hardware and tools from a stall at the Harbel Market, which is located on the Firestone Rubber Plantation.  Firestone's plantation in Liberia is one of the largest in the world, with a million acres under long-term lease from the Liberian government.

F. says he started his business with 4,000 Liberian dollars in seed money from his father.  He originally sold tools and hardware from a wheelbarrow, but thanks to his hard work and perseverance he has been able to move up to selling at the market.  He hopes to move his shop to a storefront one day soon.  With his 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian dollar group loan, F. plans to buy more inventory for his business, such as nails, cutlasses (machetes), shovels, and hammers.

F. credits his success in business to selling quality items and treating his customers well.  In future, he wants to have more children and hopes to be able to send them all to school so they get a good education.


In the photo that accompanies this profile, F. is the one holding the sign.  Siah F. is inset at lower left.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy nails, cutlasses (machetes), shovels, hammers, and other tools and hardware.

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en: Augustina A. is 35 years old and married with 3 children. Her husband is a civil servant. She sells ice blocks, drinks, groceries and she also bakes cakes to make a living. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She has been in this business for 3 years. Augustina is a LAPO client. She hopes to grow her business. Augustina needs a loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more drinks and groceries to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and groceries

loans.name: Ventina

texts.en: This is 30-year-old Mrs. N. Ventina. For over two years, she has run a beauty salon where she sells hair chemicals, hair shampoo, hair gel, sprays, powders, beads and so forth. She is requesting a loan to stock hair accessories such as hair chemicals, hair shampoo, hair gel, sprays, powders, beads and so forth for sale in her beauty salon business. Ventina is a hardworking businesswoman whose dream is to construct a house.

loans.use: To purchase hair chemicals, hair shampoo, hair gel, sprays, powders, beads etc.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a 21-year-old married man who has three children who go to school.  He has been doing photography for three years.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, his living standard has improved. This is because he has been saving his money with a group called Nrbi in Faulu Kenya.  This savings has helped him improve his business. He has requested a loan of Kes 30,000 from Faulu Kenya, which has been guaranteed by the group members.  He plans to use this loan to buy cameras.  He hopes to get more customers in the future.

loans.use: To buy cameras

loans.name: Kaku

texts.en:
Kaku E. is currently in the business of selling bags of charcoal at home. She is requesting a loan to stock firewood to sell. Kaku is 32 years old and is married. Her husband is a small-scale farmer. She has three children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up her stock of charcoal.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase firewood to sell

loans.name: Sajida Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Sajida Parveen, a resident of Borewala (famous for its shrines) Pakistan, is the wife of A. A. and owns a small house of two rooms where she has been living with her family for over 15 years. A very talented and organized lady, Sajida efficiently manages both her house and her clothes-sewing business, the latter providing financial support for her family. Her husband is a farmer.

Sajida and her husband feel proud when they see their children receiving an education and working hard to make their future bright. They have four children, two daughters and two sons. Their elder daughter is in 12th standard; the next to her is doing FSC, while her elder son reads in 9th standard and the younger is in 3rd standard.

Sajida is now applying for her third loan from Asasah so she can purchase an electric sewing machine to sew more clothes.

Note: In this picture Sajida and Sugran are showing their sewing machines.

loans.use: To purchase an electric sewing machine for sewing clothes

loans.name: Aura Sofia

texts.es:
Si usted conoce a la señora Aura O., identifica la naturaleza de negociante que la caracteriza, pues aunque no tiene maquinaria, ofrece vestidos para niñas y accesorios a la medida y al gusto de sus clientes; su negocio consiste en comprar telas  e insumos de modistería para mandarle a fabricar a 3 confeccionistas, los mas fantásticos vestidos, combinados con accesorios armónicos y adornos como sombreros cintillos, binchas adornadas, para niñas que participan como ninfas, damas de honor en matrimonios, o en cumpleaños, bautizos y ocasiones elegantes y especiales de las familias. Mediante este sistema Aura  suministra a crédito y a muy buen precio sus productos, porque para ella es  muy  claro que con su calidad en los precios ella compite. Sus clientes   son  almacenes en los centro de Barranquilla y en muchas ciudades y municipios de la costa caribe como Bosconia, en el Departamento del Cesar,  Cienaga en el Departamento del Magdalena y Montería en el Departamento de Córdoba,  donde viaja semanalmente llevando sus productos  junto a su libreta de cuentas por cobrar para recuperar su dinero.

Ella trabaja en horario extendido y ha progresado mucho desde su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo hasta la presente, sus ventas se han incrementado en un 50% y así mismo sus ingresos y utilidades. Hoy está solicitando su tercer financiamiento y desea prepararse para la temporada alta del segundo semestre del año, comprando materias primas al  por mayor y de contado e insumos como telas y adornos para poder mandar a elaborar los diseños mas apetecidos.
Su meta y gran desafío es hacer de sus hijos unos profesionales, ya que la mayor se gradúa este año como bachiller y el menor terminará su nivel de primaria, por lo que tiene que  seguir realizando muchos esfuerzos  desde su populoso barrio ubicado en el sur de Barranquilla muy cerca de centros comerciales y del famoso estadio donde juega el equipo de futbol que mas quiere la ciudad: “El Junior de Barranquilla”
texts.en:
If you knew Señora Aura O., you’d know that she personifies “saleswoman.” Even though she doesn’t have machines, she sells little girls’ dresses and accessories to the size and preference of her customers. Her business is buying material and dressmaking supplies to send out to three seamstresses. The most fantastic dresses combined with the right accessories and adornments like headbands for hats and decorated binchas for girls who participate as nymphs, bridesmaids, or in birthdays, baptisms, elegant occasions, and special family events. Through this system Aura sells her products on credit, and at a good price, because it is very clear to her that quality and price compete. Her customers are stores in Barranquilla and in many cities and municipalities of the Caribbean coast like Bosconia in the Department of Cesar, Cienaga in the Department of Magdalena, and Montería in the Department of Córdoba where she travels weekly bringing her products alongside her accounting book to collect her money. She works extended hours and has progressed a lot since her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to the present. Her sales have increased by 50% as well as her earnings and profits. Today she is taking out her third loan and wants to get ready for the high season (the second semester of the year) by buying wholesale raw materials and supplies like fabrics and decorations, paying in full, to be able to send out to have the best designs made. Her goal, and great challenge, is to make her children professionals since the oldest graduates from high school this year and the youngest finishes grade school. She has to keep going as much as possible from her populous neighborhood, south of Barranquilla, very close to malls and the famous stadium where the city’s most beloved team “El Junior de Barranquilla” plays.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Wholesale raw materials and supplies -- paid in full (fabrics, accessories, decorations)

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es:
Rodeada por un hermoso valle y cubierta por tamarindos, es la Ciudad de Portoviejo, donde vive  La señora María  Fernández, quien se dedica al comercio de semi joyas brasileras,  lleva 4 años con este negocio, está comprometida desde hace 13 años y tiene 3 hijos, su casa esta ubica por el Puente el Salto, en la capital manabita,  ella compra en efectivo las joyas y  le queda de  ganancia  el 50 %, las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Portoviejo en un distribuidor, ella busco su negocio le gusto y se quedo con él, por las ganancias y beneficios que le deja.

Nuestra socia comenzó con 50 dólares de capital, su forma de vender es recorrer la ciudad y entregar a sus amigas las joyas  dejándoseles a 2 cuotas para que ellas puedan pagar.

 Su esposo es guardián de una empresa en Portoviejo, ella es de la capital manabita y el de manta. El dinero que solicita es para invertir en su negocio de joyas tales como aretes, gargantillas y anillos; la señora María dice que pensó  invertir en ropa pero es más caro y que no le resulta mucho, las joyas se están vendiendo mas, sobre todo la marca brasilera Gale.

Su sueño es llegar a tener su negocio en un local, para así no tener que salir a recorrer la ciudad.
texts.en:
The city of Portoviejo, surrounded by a beautiful valley and covered with tamarind trees, is where Ms. Maria F. lives. For the past four years, she has been working in the sale of semi-Brazilian jewelry. She has been married for over 13 years and has 3 children. Her home is located by el Puente el Salto, in the Manabita capital. She purchases with cash the jewelry and makes a 50% profit. She buys the jewelry in the city of Portoviejo from a distributor. She enjoys her business and wants to continue it because of the earnings and the benefits. Our member began with $50 in capital. Her method of selling her products is by traveling throughout the city and offering them to her friends but allowing them to pay in 2 payments. Her husband is a security guard at a company in Portoviejo. She is from the Manabita capital, while he is from the port city, Manta. She plans to invest this loan in her jewelry business by purchasing earrings, necklaces, and rings. Ms. Maria says that she originally thought of investing it in clothing but it is very expensive and may not produce very much profit. However, the jewelry sells more and better, above all the Brazilian brand, Gale. Her dream is to have her own shop so that she doesn't have to travel around the city.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rings, earrings, necklaces, and bracelets.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Al visitar al  banco comunal “Virgen de Copacabana” entrevistamos a la socia Andrea. Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la oficina de atención de la ciudad de Ollantaytambo. 

Andrea, tiene 50 años, es casada y tiene ocho hijos. Su actividad económica de Andrea es la venta de jugos de frutas en el mercado Virgen Asunta de la ciudad de Ollantaytambo. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ya son diez años que participa en el banco comunal y le va muy bien gracias a la puntualidad de sus pagos, ella requiere el préstamo para comprar más insumos como por ejemplo azúcar y frutas. La socia nos cuenta con mucha pena que su yerno, el marido de su hija Aydee murió en un accidente de tránsito hace varios días atrás y están tratando superar el incidente.
texts.en:
Andrea recently visited the Virgen de Copacabana Community Bank where she told us about her life. The bank holds meetings every month in an office in Ollantaytambo’s town hall. She is 50 years old, married, and has eight children. Her job is selling fruit juice in the Virgen Asunta market in Ollantaytambo. She’s been doing this for a number of years and all is going well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. Andrea has been a member of the bank for ten years and is always punctual with her repayments. She now needs a loan to buy more ingredients such as sugar and fruit. She told us she is very sad because her son-in-law, the husband of her daughter Aydee, died in a traffic accident a few days earlier, and she is trying to get over the tragedy.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as sugar and fruit

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim is a 39 years old lady who is very supportive for her family. She has applied for a loan to help her husband buy animals for his business
She lives in a city called Borewala with her husband and six children. Four of the children are getting their education while the other two are very young and have not started to attend school yet. 

Shamim supports her family financially by sewing. She takes orders from her neighborhood clients and fulfills them on time to make an income. 
Shamim’s husband has bought and sold animals for 20 years. She is hopeful that by investing money in his business, he will be able to earn more by purchasing animals in bulk.

loans.use: Purchase animals to resell

loans.name: Sreytoch

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreytoch S. (in the picture) is 46 years old  and her husband, Mr. Vichet Touch, is 42 years old. They have been married since 1991 and have two sons who are mechanics. They live in a small village outside of Phnom Penh City. 

Sreytoch has been a garment factory worker for ten years, while her husband has been a mechanic for two years. She does not have her own transportation so she spends a lot of money for traveling costs. It’s difficult for her to manage their income to support her family. 

That’s why she is requesting her first loan in the amount of US$ 1,000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. She will be able to cut down on some expenses by not spending so much on traveling costs any more.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa C., aged 36, and her husband have six children – four of them are at school, one is working, and one is currently living at home. Elsa works hard to cover her daily expenses by direct selling fiber drinks, coffee and chocolate drinks to generate a small profit each month.
Elsa has applied for a loan of 12,000 PHP to help restock her supplies. She hopes that the purchase of additional health drinks will allow her to expand her business and generate more revenue. Elsa has been a member of Kiva partner, the Center for Community Transformation (CCT), for several loan cycles and has consistently attended weekly fellowship meetings*. Elsa hopes that her profits will allow her to continue to run her business and that all of her children will successfully finish school.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase health drinks

loans.name: Djiguissèmè Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Djiguissèmè sont toutes mariées. Elles ont en moyenne 48 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Tènè relevant de SAN(quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et font  essentiellement de la restauration et l’achat vente de céréales. 
Après avoir correctement remboursés les 3 prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe sont à leur  4 prêt solidaire.
KADIA T., la présidente du groupe,  compte utiliser ce nouveau prêt pour acheter, 10 sacs  de céréales (haricot mil, maïs, riz) et une importante quantité d’ingrédients pour la restauration. 
Elle s’approvisionne essentiellement sur place auprès des producteurs de céréales et grossistes pour les ingrédients rentrant dans la restauration au marché hebdomadaire de Tènè et effectue sa vente  sur place au marché de Tènè et à domicile, au comptant en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20.000 FCFA qui servira à étoffer son fonds de commerce et subvenir aux dépenses ayant trait à la nourriture, à la scolarité des enfants et à la santé.
Les autres membres espèrent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 18.000 FCFA chacune.
texts.en:
The members of the Dijugissèmè group are all married women who are on the average 48 years old, with four children. They live in traditional extended families in the village of Tènè (San Prefecture, the 4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women know each other as neighbors and friends; their main line of business is cooking food for sale and selling cereals. After having duly repaid 3 previous loans, they are now on their 4th solidarity loan. Kadia Threa, the group’s leader, plans to use this new loan to purchase ten bags of cereals (beans, millet, corn, and rice) and an ample supply of ingredients for cooking. She purchases her stock locally from cereal farmers as well as, in case of other ingredients, from wholesalers, at the weekly market in Tènè. She sells at the local market of Tènè and out of her home, retail, for cash and on credit, to a customer base composed of both men and women. She anticipates earning an average monthly income of 20,000 West African Francs, which will bolster her business capital and allow her to cover expenses related to food, healthcare, and her children’s schooling. Other members hope to achieve a monthly income of 18,000 West African Francs each.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing food products

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David B. is 36 years old and married with four school-aged children.  David is a dairy farmer from Kitale in western Kenya. He has been farming for more than five years. He is currently producing six liters of milk, which he sells at a local market. He also runs a shop, which helps him supplement his income.

He has requested a loan of 31,200 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The proceeds from the sale of milk will help him provide an education for his children. His biggest challenges are animal diseases, which are too costly to treat, and the fluctuations in the prices of milk. In the future, he plans to expand his farm to enable him increase the number of his dairy cows to five. He is very optimistic that Juhudi will partner with him throughout the season until he obtains a second dairy cow.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Cludia Yojana

texts.es:
la sra. Claudia Yojana D. tiene 27 años de edad, es madre de una hija.
Claudia se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa desde el año 2007 a la fecha, Claudia vende ropa para niños y adultos en los barrios y colonias de San Lorenzo de casa en casa y con clientes que trabajan en empresas de la localidad, tambien viaja a la ciudad de Choluteca a realizar ventas  a algunos familiares.

Claudia no tiene casa propia alquila y su mayor deseo es tener su propia casa.
 
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ropa, tiene muchos clientes que le estan haciendo varios pedidos y no tiene capital para comprar mas ropa.
texts.en:
Claudia Yojana D. is 27 years old and she is the mother a girl. Claudia has been buying and selling clothes since 2007. Claudia sells kids and adults' clothing in the districts and colonies in San Lorenzo, going from door to door and selling to clients that work in the various companies in the region. She also travels to the city of Choluteca to make sales to some family members. 

Claudia does not have her own home, she rents. Her greatest dream is to have a home of her own. 

The loan will be used to purchase clothing. She has a large client base and there are many orders that have been placed but she does not have the capital to purchase more clothing.

loans.use: To purchase clothing.

loans.name: Esmilda

texts.es:
Esmilda tiene 34 años de edad, es soltera y reside junto a su familia en el caserío Cruce Nuevo Jaén del distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica al comercio de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí ella ofrece a sus clientes productos de consumo diario por los cuales usualmente tendrían que transladarse hasta el pueblo de Olmos para adquirirlos. Su negocio cuenta con una clientela estable que prefiere el buen trato y los productos de calidad que brinda.

Esmilda desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos de modo que su negocio pueda crecer y desarrollarse correctamente. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Esmilda es una mujer trabajadora y bastante entregada a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Esmilda is 34 years old, single, and lives with her family in the village of Cruce Nuevo Jaén in the District of Olmos. This agricultural area is part of Lambayeque Province and located two hours away from the city of Chiclayo.

Esmilda sells basic necessities and groceries from a store located in her home. There she offers her customers daily consumer products that she obtains in the town of Olmos. Her business has established customers who prefer the good service and high quality products that she offers.

Esmilda wants to expand her business by acquiring more products so that her business will grow and develop properly. Therefore, she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN to help her accomplish this goal.

Esmilda is a hardworking woman who is devoted to her family. Her greatest wish is to continue growing as a businesswoman and get ahead.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Ma. Sunny

texts.en:
Ma. Sunny C. is a married woman who lives in Prk. Angas, Brgy. Casay, Dalaguete, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: fishing and fish vending. 

Her husband, Joel C., who is 49 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have seven children who are 7 to  20 years old. 

Ma. Sunny joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 10 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Ma. Sunny has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 14,500 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 7,500 PHP, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 11th cycle loan, she is borrowing 19,500 PHP, which she intends to use to purchase additional fishing equipment so that she can continue to save up for the future of her children. 

Ma. Sunny C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase of fishing equipment

loans.name: Portales Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Portales. Está ubicado en la comunidad de Santana Portales en el Estado de Tlaxcala.  El grupo está conformado por 11 integrantes. 

Sra. Patricia C.C es una integrante de este grupo. Tiene 30 años, estudió hasta el 3ro de secundaria. Es casada y tiene en 2 hijos, 1niña y 1 varones.  Ella se dedica a elaborar chamarras  que inició hace 3 años. Solicita el préstamo para compra telas. Sus clientes son el público en general.  Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente entusiasmada ya que obtiene un crédito que para ella es importante para esta epoca. Quiere este crédito para compra tela ya que si compra por mayoreo le sale más barato. También espera que con este préstamo y su esfuerzo poder tener unas mejor calidad de vida para ella y su familia.

Nadia R.L es la presidente del grupo; Tiene 26 años, estudió hasta 3ro de secundaria  es propietaria de una estética, tiene un hijo varón.  Su  estética la  inició hace 3 años. Solicita el préstamo para comprar tintes; peróxidos y tijeras .Sus clientes son el  público en general.  Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se sintió entusiasmada por tener nuevamente la oportunidad de que le dieran su crédito con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Con este  préstamo desea obtener más clientes y así poder tener una mejor calidad de vida tanto ella como su hijo.
texts.en:
This group is called "Portales." It is located in the Santana Portales area in the state of Tlaxcala. The group is formed by 11 members.

Patricia C.C is a member of this group. She is 30 years old, studied through her third year of secondary school. She is married and has two children, a boy and a girl. She makes jackets and has been doing so for three years. She seeks this loan to buy fabric. Her clients are the general public. Upon seeking this loan, she felt excited because the loan is very important to her at this stage. She wants to buy fabric at wholesale because she can get it cheaper. Also, she hopes that with this loan, she can achieve a better quality of life for her and her family.

Nadia R.L is the president of the group. She is 26 years old, studied through the third year of secondary school, and is the owner of a beauty salon, and has one son. She has had her salon for three years. She seeks this loan to purchase dyes, bleaches, and scissors. Her clients are the general public. When she sought the loan, she felt excited to have new opportunity that the loan gave her. With this loan, she hopes to obtain more clients and therefore have a better quality of life for her and her son.

loans.use: To invest in their business

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Rosario socia del banco comunal Loreto, del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 52 años D. edad, está casada tiene 4 hijos mayores y su esposo se desempeña como conductor D. vehículos (transportista).
La señora Rosario siente la necesidad D. trabajar para no depender D. nadie, así que esta asegurando su vejez gracias a su actividad.
Viene trabajando con los préstamos que ofrece Manuela Ramos desD. hace 4 años, tiempo que le ha servido para comprarse una maquina mas.
Con este préstamo D. S/. 2,300.00 soles comprará 10 kilos D. tela, 4 conos D. hilos D. remalle, 2 conos D. hilo normales, 1 cajita D. agujas, aceite para dar mantenimiento a su máquina y carbón para el motor D. la maquina.
La señora Rosario está muy contenta porque tiene una fuente D. trabajo, que le permite vivir tranquila con su esposo.
texts.en:
Rosario is a member of the Loreto community bank which is in Ucayali department.  She is 52 years old, married, and has 4 grown-up children.  Her husband is a driver (carrier).

Rosario feels the need to work so that she doesn't have to depend on anybody.  In this way she is guaranteeing her old age through her business.

Rosario has been working with Manuela Ramos' loans for 4 years.  During this time she has bought one additional sewing machine.

She will use this loan for 2,300 Peruvian soles to buy 10 kilos of fabric, 4 cones of mending thread, 2 cones of normal thread, 1 box of needles, oil for carrying out maintenance work on her machine and carbon brushes for her machine's motor.

Rosario is very happy because she has a source of work which allows her to live quietly with her husband.

loans.use: To buy 10 kilos of fabric, 4 cones of mending thread, 2 cones of normal thread, 1 box of needles, oil for doing maintenance work on her machine and carbon brushes for her machine's motor

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 38 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en la casa de su hermana. Hace más de 10 años se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, productos que son vendidos diariamente a sus clientes. Su trabajo o realiza durante las mañanas, recorriendo las calles de su zona para visitar a sus clientes, quienes la esperan para recibir la mercadería o en todo caso para adelantar el pago del cosmético que lo compró a crédito. Asimismo vende también lencería, prenda que al igual de los cosméticos tiene mucha demanda. Para ella es muy importante tener un control adecuado de sus ventas ya que esto le permitirá saber cuanto está ganado, es así como ha logrado establecerse en este negocio, y por tal motivo espera tener más capital de trabajo. Es el crédito numero 8 que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del crédito que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más cosméticos al por mayor y aprovechar la campaña navideña.
texts.en:
Carmen is 38 years old.  She lives with her husband and two children in her sister's house.  She has been selling cosmetics for more than 10 years and she sells them to her customers daily.  She does her work in the mornings, walking the streets of her neighborhood, visiting her customers who wait for her so that they can receive their merchandise or make their payments for the cosmetics that they have bought on credit.  Carmen also sells underwear which, like cosmetics, are in high demand.  For her it is very important to have adequate control of her sales since this will allow her to know how much she is making.  This is how she managed to establish herself in this business and for this reason, she hopes to gain more working capital.

This is Carmen's 8th loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support.  She also likes being a member of her community bank because all the members are people she knows.  They are all responsible and very supportive of one another.  Carmen thanks everybody who will help fund her loan since it will be very useful to her in making progress in her business.  She will invest her loan in buying more cosmetics wholesale and take advantage of the Christmas season.

loans.use: To stock up with beauty products since there is a lot of demand during the Christmas season

loans.name: Chan's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Chan S. is a 31-year-old married man. He was selected as the village bank president by the fifteen members who are located in Krouch village, Kandal province. With the loans, they hope to increase their incomes to improve the living conditions of their families.
 
Mr. Chan S. is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he cultivates different vegetables for a living. He faces a problem in that he does not have a water pump to irrigate his crops. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan to purchase a pump. 

His wife, Mrs. In Sophy, 30 years old, works as seamstress in a garment factory where she receives a small salary with which to support her family. 
This couple has two children: one is attending the local school while the youngest one is 3 years old and not yet of school age.

loans.use: To purchase a pump to water crops

loans.name: Sobeyda Yasmina

texts.es: Sobeyda tiene 45 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 14 años que tiene este negocio, pues no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos pues ha sido de gran ayuda para su negocio. Siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una persona responsable y disfruta de su medio de vida ya que el tratar con clientes es lo que más le gusta. Sabe que todos los días tiene que levantarse temprano para ofrecer la gran variedad de productos que ofrece. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de lápiz labial, cremas, perfumes, ropa en general, calzado entre otros.
texts.en: Sobeyda is 45 years old, and she sells general merchandise for a living.  She has had this business for more than 14 years, and this is not the first time she has used loans or credit to help her develop the business.  She has always defined herself as a responsible person, and she enjoys her way of life, as interacting with customers is what she likes most.  She knows that every days she has to get up early to be able to offer a wide variety of products.  She plans to use the funds from this loan to buy lip pencils, creams, perfumes, clothing, and shoes, among other things.

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Milena De Los Ángeles

texts.es: La Sra. Milena de los Ángeles G. E. ella es trabajadora activa del Colegio Público “Los Velásquez” desempeñándose como Docente tiene  Veinte y cinco  años  de trabajar para esta institución como docente de la educación,  tiene tres hijos en edad escolar. Ha tenido  seis créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como Arena, Cemento, Piedra, Piedrín, Bloques etc.  Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en: Milena de los Ángeles G. E. works as a teacher at Los Velásquez School.  She has worked as a teacher here for twenty-five years.  Milena has three school-age children.  She has had six loans from Ceprodel and has used each one to buy building supplies such as sand, cement, stone, gravel, blocks, etc. in order to extend and improve her home.  The loans from Ceprodel have been a great help to her since they have enabled her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy gravel, sand, cement and corrugated metal roofing

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence N. lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has two children, who attend school. Florence has been operating a restaurant for over ten years, and she works seven days a week. Florence also sells her products in a shop. Florence has access to electricity but doesn’t have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

Florence has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy a deep freezer. Florence's main business challenges include seasonality and thieves. Her goals and hopes for her business are to eventually buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy a deep freezer

loans.name: Sobeyda Argentina

texts.es:
La Sra. Sobeyda tiene una librería en su casa de habitación desde hace 3 años donde vende artículos escolares y también sacan fotocopias 
Es el primer crédito que trabaja con ceprodel , este crédito será utilizado para la compra de cuadernos , lápices , y otros artículos ya que en esta época se inicia el año escolar en el municipio
Ella está casada y tiene a cargo a dos hijos su esposo le ayuda con remesas el cual está en un vecino país desde hace 5 años
texts.en:
Mrs. Sobeyda has a bookstore in her home where for 3 years she has sold school-related items and made photocopies.  This is her first loan with Ceprodel.  The loan will be used to buy notebooks, pencils, and other items, since this is the beginning of the school year in town.  

She is married and takes care of two children.  Her husband, who has lived in a neighboring country for five years, helps her by sending money.

loans.use: Purchase notebooks, writing tablets, pens, reams of paper, pencils

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy additional  important things for his general store.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina nació en la provincia de Cusco del departamento del Cusco y tiene 35 años de edad. Actualmente, Justina vive en la ciudad imperial de los Incas (Cusco, Perú) junto con sus dos hijos,  ella es una madre responsable que saca adelante a su familia y  su actividad económica principal es trabajar en el terminal terrestre de la ciudad del Cuso en el área de limpieza. Ya son varios años que trabaja en este negocio y va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 
 
Justina en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para uso personal específicamente para matricula de su hija Sharmely que está postulando a la Universidad de Nacional San Antonio Abad de la ciudad del Cusco a la carrera profesional de enfermería. 
 
Justina es una persona responsable que pertenece al banco comunal “Ana Jarvis III” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en:
Justina was born in Cusco Province and Department and is 35 years old.  Justina currently lives in the Imperial City of the Incas (Cusco, Perú) with her two children.  She is a responsible mother who moves her family forward.  Her main economic activity is working as a Cleaning Lady at Cusco’s bus terminal.  She’s been in this line of work for several years and does well thanks to the effort she puts into it.

On this occasion Justina needs a loan for personal use, specifically to pay her daughter Sharmely’s tuition at Cusco’s San Antonio Abad National University.  She’s studying Nursing.

Justina is a responsible person who is a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “Ana Jarvis III” communal bank in the city of Cusco, Perú.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's tuition.

loans.name: Xiomara

texts.es:
La señora Xiomara Estela M., mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora quien se dedica al comercio de ropa. Negocio en el que le va muy bien y que gracias a los créditos lo ha ido mejorando poco a poco. Ella sueña con tener una tienda de ropa y calzado el cual si Dios quiere será pronto.
M. solicito un crédito de autoestima el cual es otorgado a las clientas para su uso personal ella con el crédito se realizara un chequeo médico.
texts.en: Xiomara Estela M. is a hard working enterprising woman who puts a lot of effort into her clothing business.  The business is doing well, thanks to the loans she has gotten; she has been able to improve her business little by little.  She hopes to have a clothing and shoe store one day, God willing it will not be far off.  M. is asking for this loan so that she can pay for a medical exam.

loans.use: to have a medical exam

loans.name: El Algodonal Florece Group

texts.es:
Marina tiene un puesto D. venta en un mercado D. los Olivos, allí tiene su negocio  D. venta D. artículos D. belleza y ropa un negocio que ha prosperado mucho con el tiempo, cuando recién empezó solo vendía  productos D. belleza, ella es fundadora del grupo “EL ALGODONAL FLORECE” y esta agradecida porque integrar el grupo le sirvió para progresar y mejorar  su calidad D. vida además D. ayudar a sus hijos en sus estudios  lo que mas desea es seguir haciéndolo hasta que se conviertan en profesionales,  durante todo este tiempo aprendió a invertir en su negocio es por ello que ahora ha logrado crecer  y tiene un negocio surtido, también cada semana viaja a provincia llevando sus productos como  chompas, casacas y pantalones. La Sra. Marina quiere seguir progresando y tener mas tiendas en esta ocasión invertirá su préstamo para la compra D. ropa D. invierno aprovechando que se avecina la temporada  D. frío, ella es la tesorera del grupo “EL ALGODONAL FLORECE”.
* Marina es la ultima D. la foto aparece con chompa blanca con coquitos.
texts.en: Marina has a sales position the market of los Olivos.  There she has her business of selling beauty supplies and clothing; a business that has prospered much with time.  When she started it not long ago, she only sold beauty products.  She is the founder of the group called "EL ALGODONAL FLORECE" ("THE COTTON PLANTATION FLOURISHES") and is thankful because assembling the group helped her to progress and to improve her quality of life as well as help her children in their studies.  What she most desires is to continue doing this until they become professionals.  During all this time she has learned to invest in her business.  It is because of this that she has now managed to grow and to have a well supplied business. In addition, each week she travels in the country carrying her products such as sweaters, coats and pants.  Señora Maria wants to continue progressing and to have more stores.  On this occasion she will invest her loan in the purchase of winter clothes, taking advantage of the fact that the season of cold approaches.  She is the treasurer of the group "EL ALGODONAL FLORECE" .  Maria is the last one on the right in the photo.  She appears with a white seater with diamonds on it.

loans.use: to buy winter clothing.

loans.name: Concepción Del Socorro

texts.es:
Uno de los sueños que ha tenido la señora Concepción es la de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y por este motivo es que ella se esfuerza a diario porque está consciente que su sueño pronto lo logrará. 

Para esto, ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para ser invertido en la compra de los materiales de construcción tales como arena, bloque, hierro, estribo. Ella está confiando que su crédito le sea otorgado para arrancar con la obra de reconstrucción para su vivienda que tanto lo necesita y así cumplir sus sueños. 

Es menester mencionar que el crédito le ayudará mucho porque ella tiene una gran capacidad para administrar y así dirigirá la obra hasta terminarla satisfactoriamente.
texts.en:
One of Concepcion's dreams has been to improve her living conditions and that is why she works so hard every day.

Therefore, she has asked for a loan from Ceprodel (Kiva field partner) to invest in the purchase of construction materials such as sand, concrete blocks, iron, and posts. She is confident that her loan will be offered in a way that will allow her to begin the necessary reconstruction effort in her home, which will allow her to achieve her dreams. 

It is appropriate to mention that the loan will help her very much because she is highly capable of administrating the work and directing the job until it is done to her satisfaction.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for her home.

loans.name: Sani

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Sani. She is married and has two children, aged 17 and 14. In 2001, she established her vegetable-farming business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy seeds and fertilizers.  

In the future, Sani plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support.   

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buys seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Coka Kiwalani Group

texts.en:
Irene, who is in her late 20s, is single. She has a small general store, which she has run for six months. She works from 6 am to 10 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Irene's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she wants to use to increase the shop inventory. Her dream is to one day own a grocery where she can sell drinks and snacks. Irene will share this loan with her loan group "Coka Kiwalani," which has a total of 18 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to increase the shop inventory.

loans.name: Ayyub

texts.en:
Ayyub is 47 years old.  He is married and has two children.  He sells cattle.  As a rule, Ayyub purchases the small cattle in the central market, feeds them and then resells them at higher prices in the local market. 

After being in this business for 6 years, he knows how to choose the animals, how to breed them and look after them very well.  Thus, he gets up every morning in order to feed the animals and to look after them.  His knowledge and skills allow him to make his business successful and to generate a stable, considerable income for his large family.  With the first loan from AqroInvest Ayyub were able to purchase more animals and increase his income.

Ayyub is planning to enlarge the stock and to purchase more cattle.  For this purpose, he requests 1,500 AZN loan that he will spend for the purchase of young cattle and feed for them.

loans.use: to purchase three cattle and fodder

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is a hardworking and active 33-year-old business lady. She is single and has three children aged fifteen, eleven and five going to school. Previously, Naomi was a house wife, but for the past six years she has been operating a beauty salon.

Naomi is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to buy hair braids, weaves and oils. In five years she hopes to have a big salon as well as to sell beauty products. She feels that with the extra income from her business she will be able to realize her dream of opening up a beauty college.

loans.use: To buy hair braids, weaves and oils.

loans.name: Jose Adalberto

texts.es:
José de 32 años de edad, es soltero, vive en casa de sus padres, no cuenta con los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande, la cual pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadería  y artesanía.

José desde hace varios años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (ovejas), cuenta con 30 ovejas en su corral que se encuentra a unos minutos de su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada y  pastos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener su peso y talla ideal, para ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga las  ganancias necesarias para solventar sus gastos personales. 

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para comprar alimentos balanceados para engordar a sus animales y mejorar su corral de sus ovejas, al venderlos a un mejor precio a sus clientes sus ingresos aumentarán para poder pagar su crédito y realizar algunos objetivos que se a trazado.  José es una persona trabajadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelnte con su propio esfuerzo y de paso ayudar económicamente a sus padres.
texts.en:
José is 32 years old and single.  He lives in his parents’ home, located in the rural district of Tambogrande, which is part of the Piura department.  The home does not have running water or electricity.  This zone is known for its farming, livestock, and arts.

José has been raising and selling sheep for several years and currently has 30 sheep in his corral, located a few minutes from his home.  He feeds his animals balanced feed and natural grasses so that they reach the ideal size and weight and he can sell them in the different markets within the zone.  In this way he earns the money necessary to pay his personal expenses.

He is asking for this loan of 500 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa so he can buy balanced feed to fatten up his animals and sell them for better prices.  He also wants to make improvements to his corral.  This way, he can increase his income and be able to repay his loan and complete some other projects that he is behind on.  José is a hard working person with a desire to get ahead and help his parents financially through his own efforts.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed.

loans.name: Enoch

texts.en:
Enoch, 35, is self-reliant and hardworking. He is married and blessed with four children, three of whom are in school. Since 2006, he has been running a retail shop to make ends meet for his family. He makes extra income from the salary he gets from working as a a security officer. 

He wants in the next five years to have accumulated enough income so as to educate his children. His dream is to acquire a piece of land and build rental houses. 

He is requesting a loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, maize flour and sodas. He is grateful to Faulu Kenya for the financial management training.

loans.use: To buy sugar, maize flour and sodas.

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en:
Muhabbat is a hard-working woman. She is married and has three children. 

For the past 10 years Muhabbat has dedicated herself to selling office supplies. She started her business after her husband's contract with the construction company he was employed was ended. With her husband’s income missing, bills started to pile up, and she decided to generate her own income to try to fill the gap. She likes what she sells and has developed a stable enterprise. 

Currently Muhabbat has requested a loan in the size of $1000 USD to help purchase a new supply of items to sell. This is an important matter for this family's well-being. She truly appreciates your generosity.     


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase office supplies to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy electrical repair tools and electrical supplies

loans.name: Bonna

texts.en:
Bonna is 38 years old, married and has three children.  For seven years, she has been practicing dairy farming.  Besides this, she grows coffee so as to generate more income for her family.  So far she has serviced three loans from Faulu Kenya which has helped her to improve her business.  

She has requested 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy dairy cows.

loans.use: To buy dairy cows.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 49 years old and married with four children. Nida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling recycled materials in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy more recycled materials to sell.

Nida has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the recycled materials business for five years and also earns an income from candy making.

Nida aspires to save enough money to buy motorcycle for her business.

loans.use: To buy more recycled materials to sell.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
This is Regina, 41, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Juan, an overseas Filipino worker, and is the mother to their three children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income to cover their everyday expenses.

Regina operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this, she also does some direct selling. Her store is adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She makes a minimum of PHP 450 in sales every day.
